Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the customer at heart.
 



 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans to stop anytime soon. As we continue to expand our product offering to new merchants and geographic regions, our logistical network and operations are getting increasingly complex.
   





 As we expand our business we find ourselves in need of a TechOps Lead who wants to take on the responsibility for the future direction of our Terminal Tech within the Instabee Tech Ops organization.
 



**About the role** 








 As TechOps lead you will be responsible for all Terminal Tech related areas within the TechOps Organization and assist the product teams if necessary. You will lead the work on a global level and implement both global and local solutions in all Instabee markets. You are also responsible for setting ways-of-working and best practices in close collaboration with the local teams.
 



 Reporting to our Global Head of Tech Ops you will work alongside peers who will have the same goal as you, which is the continued improvement and efficiency of the techops organization. You will facilitate growth and learning, this may require you to adapt a very hands on approach but equally important; to get out of the way when needed.
   





 Your tasks will include, but not be limited to:
 


* You will be managing a team who have the responsibility to maintain and develop our Terminal Tech and IT Support.
* You’ll lead the work on a global level by assessing the needs of Instabee and putting effective solutions in place, driving continuous improvement of our Terminal Tech.
* Assist to design an entry strategy and handover plan to support all future Instabee markets
* Design, implement and improve Instabee’s network and other TechOps related hardware in our Terminals.
* Support and guide our local Tech Ops teams
* Drive automation in all Terminal Tech related areas.
* Supporting the teams in cross-team collaboration and communication.
* Assist to establish and implement the technical capabilities Instabee needs to cater for the massive growth in the markets we’re active in
* Proactively identifying problems and working to resolve them in the fast paced environment Instabee provides.
* Continue to build on the great culture of dedication, collaboration and caring for each other, while having fun!







**About you** 




 In order to be successful in this role we believe that you will have several years of experience working with Terminal Tech software and hardware. Your title may have been Tech Lead, Team Lead, senior engineer or something completely different. Regardless, you have achieved results by improving processes and possess the ability to make strategy come alive by engaging and inspiring others. That you are well versed in lean and agile thinking is a given.
 



 You have achieved results by improving solutions and possess the ability to make strategy come alive by engaging and inspiring others.
   




* What motivates you is solving complex problems and to really deliver business value efficiently.
* Worked in a fast growing company organization with high levels of ambiguity and flat hierarchy structures.
* The ability to provide constructive feedback, problem solving and analytical skills, not to mention collaboration.
* You’re great at making others shine.



**What we offer**




 The chance to be part of something truly amazing and fun. In this role you will have a tangible impact on the way that our products develop and the freedom to try new things and ways of working with your teams. You will work closely with our Global Head of TechOps, and with the local other Instabee leaders who are all passionate about building and improving our products. We can promise you that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and have the opportunity to work with dedicated, smart and humble people.
 



 The journey ahead is what excites every Instabeer working here today and we are just getting started. Then there is the compensation package, benefits, centrally located office etc. but we’ll get to that in due time.
 



*This recruitment process consists of personality tests via Alva Labs and background checks as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes in Sweden.*

title: PEI Stockholm: Volunteer Programme
description:
**Private Equity Conference Volunteer** 
 (25 October)
   

  

 Do you want to expand your network with 500+ leaders, entrepreneurs, investors, limited and general partners of the Private Equity sector, plus develop your skills in leadership? Now is your chance!
   

  

 Private Equity Insights organises the largest global events enabling finance and investment innovation by connecting C-level executives, GPs and LPs, with entrepreneurs and investors. Our conferences bring together some of the most important big industry players such as Blackstone, BlackRock, Apollo, Carlyle, CVC, KKR, Permira, Oliver Wyman, Mercer, and many more.
   

  

 We offer the opportunity for students in undergraduate and graduate programmes relating to business and finance, or for people with a strong interest in the Private Equity sector, to gain exposure to these companies and expand their network through our volunteer programme.
   

  

 We are building a community where the smartest, most innovative and ambitious people can meet and create the future of private equity. With the pace of industry change increasing and the reach of new possibilities expanding, this is needed more than ever. We are looking for ambitious and talented people, who want to be a part of a team of 25+ peers and help us build, run and deliver the leading Nordics Private Equity Conference.
   

  

 Private Equity Insights would not exist without our volunteers. Simple as that. Join us and see how the world's largest Private Equity community is built – from the inside.
   

  

**Sign up below and join NPEC24 at Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel in Stockholm on the 25th October 2024! Apply on this link.**
**You can get a better sense of the conference, in our 2023 Milan's highlight video.**
**For more information please visit our website here** 
**.**
**PROFESSIONAL BENEFITS:**
* Expand your network with 500+ leaders, entrepreneurs, investors, limited and general partners of the Private Equity sector.
* Create your next business opportunity & meet your new mentor
* Develop your soft skills and receive individual training in management from the Private Equity Team
* Receive the official 2024 Private Equity Insights Volunteer Certificate


**PERSONAL BENEFITS:**
* Take part in the 2024 Private Equity Insights Workshop, along with 25+ ambitious and talented people and learn the insights of running the leading Private Equity Conference and the possibilities that this entails
* Experience the unique atmosphere of Private Equity Insights on the day of the conference.
* Gain valuable knowledge, insights, and inspiration by listening and chatting to the world's leading speakers.
* Seize the opportunity to develop your competencies in communication and learn what it takes to create the leading event in Europe.


**SOCIAL BENEFITS:**
* Create personal relationships with like-minded, hardworking professionals from the Volunteer Programme and from the Private Equity Insights team.
* Exclusive access to the official 2024 Private Equity Insights Dinner for all members of the Volunteer Programme after the event!


 The conference will take place on the 25th of October 2024 at the Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel.
   

  

 Hours to contribute: the day of the conference, plus 2h the afternoon before the event, for training session & rehearsals.

title: Manager - Time Team
description:
Are you passionate about leading and coaching teams to deliver exceptional technology solutions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where collaboration and innovation drive success? SD Worx is looking for a dedicated and experienced Manager for our Nordics Time Team. 
 



 As the manager of our Nordics Time Team, you will lead a cross-functional team including product specialists, a product owner, a solution architect, software developers, and testers. You will deliver technology solutions in collaboration with stakeholders such as Sales, Consultants, Customer Care, and other Product Teams.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Report to the Technology Director as a member of the development management team.
* Coach and support your team of 15 people, ensuring their well-being and growth.
* Align product vision with the product roadmap in collaboration with the product owner and specialists.
* Facilitate day-to-day agile processes and continuous improvement.
* Communicate and report team progress to management.
* Ensure high-frequency deployments and address recurring problems with solutions.



**What You Bring:** 



* Master’s degree or equivalent experience.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.
* Relevant experience as a team lead or manager.
* Passion for coaching and motivating people.
* Initiative, a "can do" mentality, and strong communication skills.
* Problem-solving ability, curiosity, and collaboration skills.
* Experience with agile methodologies and business software development (5+ years).
* Familiarity with large distributed Microsoft (C#) environments.



 Join us at SD Worx and help bring people solutions to life!
 



**About Us :** 




 SD Worx is a leading European provider of Payroll & HR services with global reach. We have offices in Europe and an office in Mauritius. Our goal? We bring people solutions to life. So, companies of any size can turn Human Resources into a source of value for the business and the people in it. Our people solutions span the entire employee journey, from getting people paid to attracting, rewarding, and developing talent. Are you ready to join us?
 



**What do we have to offer?**



* An attractive salary based on your experience and achievement.
* A dynamic environment: flexible working hours and working from home.
* Learning opportunities: through an individual development plan and professional training
* Career growth: whether you want to become more of an expert in your field our you want to expand your knowledge more horizontally, there is always room to grow within SD Worx!



 From many places, we work as one, moving from better to best together.
 



 SD Worx lives diversity in the workplace. Diversity provides inspiration and innovation in our company. We particularly welcome applications from qualified talent, regardless of origin, nationality, gender, skin colour, ethnic and social background, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation and stage of life.

title: Site Manager
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Team Manager to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Managed Services business unit.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 300 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Team Manager who wants to make a difference in our Managed Services Team.
   

  

 Managed Security Services
   

  

 Truesec helps customers globally with Attack Prediction Services, Vulnerability Management Services and Managed Detection & Response services for IT and OT environments. Our services are all delivered by skilled security analysis teams that conducts 24/7 attack monitoring, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, and threat remediation. Our team of experts works tirelessly to identify and prevent cyber breaches, and to help increase our customers’ proactive cybersecurity defenses. Our goal is to be an extension of our customers’ IT organizations, customizing a combination of capabilities and tooling, tailored to prevent cyber attacks in the most efficient way.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As a Site Manager, your role will be central in the management and coordination of the SOC and the various monitoring teams to ensure their successful work.
   

  

 You will be responsible for and control the monitoring teams' activities on site to ensure that agreements, SLAs and compliance with quality standards are followed. You will also be responsible for ensuring that Managed Services' working methods are correct and adopted, promoting a good working environment and maintaining solid relationships with other departments, having a good dialogue with customer teams, customers, subcontractors and suppliers.
   

  

 This also includes tight cooperation with the Head of SOC manager, other team managers in the SOC and other stakeholders within Truesec.
   

  

 You will be a part of a leadership team working with great passion to create the best working environment for your teams and team-managers, enabling them to deliver with confidence, and excel at what they do best.
   

  

 As leaders, we aim to create an open and safe environment where everyone counts and can voice their opinion. We believe that diversity creates stronger teams and delivers the best results.
   

  

 The leadership includes enabling the team members to make decisions and grow their knowledge as a team, at the same time working towards common targets both short and long term to further grow our SOC service and keep more customers safe from external and internal cyber related threats.
   

  

**Responsibilities will include but not be limited to:**
* Lead and coordinate the SOC and various monitoring teams to ensure their successful work.
* Ensure compliance with contracts, SLAs, and quality standards.
* Promote a positive work environment and maintain solid relationships with other departments.
* Keep up to date with industry trends, cybersecurity trends, and best practices.
* Ensure resource availability according to needs and budget.
* Actively analyze data generated by tools and platforms used in Truesec's monitoring services.
* Conduct salary, goal, and development talks.
* Contribute to business development within the Managed Services business area.


 Your Potential Background
   

  

 We believe you want to work in a purpose driven organization and that you are passionate about stopping cyber breaches, that you enjoy and have experience from leading people and helping them thrive in their positions. You want to join a fast growing organization and want to be an important part in developing our company.
   

  

 We truly value and live by our culture and it's important that we lead by example.
   

  

 Preferably you have experience in 24/7 service delivery and have examples of creating changes in teams in accordance to an understanding of a holistic view. As we develop continually in a rapid speed it is important to understand and support your team in how to carry out the daily operation, and at the same time adapt the team in to new changes.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Excellent communication skills.
* Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* 6+ years of experience in a similar role or position
* Leadership experience
* Ability to handle high pressure situations with key stakeholders
* Good analytical skills
* Knowledge of budget management


**Bonus Skills:**
* Experience in a 24/7 delivery function
* Experience in recruitment/staffing


**What we hope you will bring:**
* Genuine interest and understanding in people
* An exceptional presence and responsiveness
* Excellent communication within and outside the team
* Sense of humor


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
 Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future
   

  

 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Product Analyst
description:
We are Tibber, the energy company that wants you to use less energy. Crazy, right? We are by definition an energy company, but we’re more techy than most. How and why you might ask? Well, a third of our employees are working on developing products and solutions that can help you use fossil-free energy more smartly, or even better: less energy. Our main goal is to empower people to reduce the amount of energy being used all around the globe. Good for our customers, their wallets, and the planet.
   

  

 Our growth rate has been quite stunning, and still, we’re just getting started. With hundreds of thousands of smart devices connected to the Tibber platform (like electric vehicles and smart thermostats), we have one of the most unique portfolios for trading energy and offering flexible services to the grid.
   

  

 The Data area within Tibber, is the main contributor to steering business value through data at Tibber. We, as Data Analysts, are experts in generating and communicating insights based on data, shaping the company's strategic direction. It's our job to perform specialised analyses and collaborate closely with our stakeholders, educating them in analytical methods and mindset.
   

  

**Job Mission🚀🚀**
 Join the Data Analytics Team consisting of four kind, humble and data loving colleagues. All four of them have their own domain expertise area, but you will work together and help each out on a frequent basis. Authenticity is considered a superpower, your voice will be heard, and your development needs will be taken very seriously. Creating a culture where everybody can be their full self at work is therefore very important to your Data Analytics Manager.
   

  

 For this specific role you will be embedded in the Smart Charging Product Area and work closely with its Product Area Lead and occasionally our CPO. This area is a crucial part of our business as it allows our users to get their EV charged every day, at the lowest possible cost. More recently it's the area which is making sure we are building the biggest Virtual Power Plant in Europe.
   

  

***Some of your responsibilities (but not limited to) will include:***
**Contribute to decision-making.** 
 You'll be able to support the product area's decision-making with recommendations and insights. Both on a strategic level (e.g.) and a tactical level (e.g. what's the impact of the latest product rollout?). Your contribution and proactiveness will be instrumental to this area. Sounds exciting, right?
   

  

**Product's data analyst swiss-army knife.** 
 Since you will work closely with our Product Area Lead and CPO, you will be asked to shift gears fast and take on projects which deliver the highest business value. This could range from building dbt models and performing analyses in ThoughtSpot on them to setting KPIs for a new area during another day.
   

  

**Champion self-service way of working.** 
 You are expected to build a self-service foundation and help your stakeholders gain insights themselves. It's a journey we have already started across the company and you will help your areas to get there. Data should not be an afterthought.
   

  

**KPIs.** 
 You will help define, implement, and track your Product Area KPIs.
   

  

**⚡⚡️Ideal Profile**
**Ideally, We Would Like To See The Following**
**Data Analyst experience.** 
 2+ years prior experience as a Data/Product Analyst. Anything from deep-dives using SQL to running A/B tests to finding funnel drop-offs is hugely beneficial.
   

  

**Product experience.** 
 2+ years prior experience working in product teams, preferably at a scale-up company.
   

  

**Created impact.** 
 Experience in doing analyses that drove big decision outcomes. Cares about making an impact, takes ownership and is very self-sufficient.
   

  

**Technical know-how.** 
 Proficient in actively using SQL (e.g. to create models in dbt). Prior experience working with tools similar to Thoughtspot, Looker, or Tableau.
   

  

**Collaborative** 
 . A role model and seamless communicator who successfully manages to build and maintain relationships with different stakeholders.
   

  

**Teaching ability.** 
 Excited about and has experience in educating others throughout Tibber on how to perform analytics work.
   

  

**A team player.** 
 Yes, every ad says this but we truly believe our team is more important than an individual and would expect you to actively contribute to this. Egos are left at the door.
   

  

**Some Additional Bonus Skills (but In No Way Essential)**
* Scale-up/start-up experience
* Familiarity with other parts of our tech stack (Databricks, dbt, ThoughtSpot)
* Understanding of EVs/wallboxes and energy markets


**🦹🏽‍♀️👨‍🎤Get Ready For**
**Innovation.** 
 A way to change the landscape of one of the most important industries on the planet.
   

  

**Growth.** 
 A possibility to learn a lot and push the barriers of what you think is possible, with the opportunity to grow personally and professionally.
   

  

**Autonomy.** 
 An autonomous and humble culture in a scale-up adventure.
   

  

**Empowerment.** 
 Your voice matters, we are a place to work where laughter and support amongst diverse and inclusive colleagues are guaranteed.
   

  

**Flexible benefits.** 
 Whether this is towards health, working hours and/or location, wellness, equipment, or other allowances important to you, we will do our best to accommodate your needs.
   

  

**💆🏻‍♀️💆🏽‍♂️The Tibber Mindset**
 Being on a mission to change an industry as we do fundamentally also means being prepared for the unexpected. Tibber is a scale-up in the true sense of the word which means we are on a journey of constant change. We do what others say can’t be done, try and fail together but never lose sight of our users.
   

  

 We work passionately with sustainability and a circular approach, both with our products and in the entire ecosystem that is affected by everything we do.
   

  

 We're very proud of being a mission-driven startup with thousands and thousands of new users every month. Starting with two passionate founders in 2016, we're now 300+ people working for Tibber in our offices in Stockholm, Førde, Berlin, Amsterdam, Oslo, and Helsinki, and with that number growing each week, we’re still just getting started. Through 2024 we will expand to new markets, and we are thrilled to be backed by investors like Balderton Capital, Eight Roads Ventures, Founders Fund, Summa, and Schibsted.
   

  

*At Tibber, we are committed to hiring, developing, and retaining exceptional people regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, or gender identity. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply.*
 Tibber is a different company in a very traditional industry. We are aiming to create the best digital tool so that you as a user can apply new technologies to reduce energy consumption and power costs.

title: Business Analyst till storbank i Stockholm!
description:
Vi söker en individ som har erfarenhet från finansbranschen och är redo att axla denna spännande tjänst! Som Business Analyst kommer du spela en nyckelroll i att analysera data och presentera förbättringsförslag för stakeholders. Välkommen med din ansökan - urval sker löpande!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Ekonomi/juridik/inköp
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, möjlighet att arbeta på distans
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Business Analyst kommer du att arbeta med att analysera och presentera data inom finanssektorn. Du kommer att få i uppdrag att utforska, analysera och strukturera data samt ge insikter och analysrekommendationer baserade på dina analyser. Du kommer att presentera dina analyser för seniora stakeholders och bistå med förändringsförslag. Rollen innebär också att implementera och testa lösningar.
 


  


 Du kommer bli en del av ett erfaret team på 9 personer som är placerade i Sverige, Finland och Polen. Detta är ett konsultuppdrag genom Academic Work med start omgående till och med sista december.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Bli en del av ett stort internationellt företag i framkant av teknologi
  
* Möjligheten att utvecklas och öka din expertis inom bank och finans
  
* En dedikerad konsultchef från Academic Work som kommer att stödja och coacha dig i din framtida karriär
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Analysera data och felmeddelanden enligt instruktioner
  
* Identifiera potentiella förbättringar/optimeringar och testa nya lösningar
  
* Skapa högkvalitativa analyser och presentationsmaterial för stakeholders
  
* Arbeta som länken mellan tech och business med syfte att översätta krav för att skapa nya lösningar
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har minst 2 års erfarenhet från liknande roll inom bank-/finansbranschen, exempelvis Business Analyst eller Credit Analyst
  
* Har relevant akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska i både tal och skrift
  
* Goda färdigheter inom kommunikation och stakeholder management
  
* Goda kunskaper inom SQL
  
* Goda kunskaper inom Excel
  
* Har svenskt medborgarskap eller giltigt arbetstillstånd för att kunna påbörja tjänsten omgående.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Kunskaper inom Basel 3, SAS, R eller Python
  


  


 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
 


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Självgående
  
* Problemlösande
  
* Affärsinriktad
  
* Kommunikativ
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Molly Rytter eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stw06@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104477

title: IT Vendor Management at Traton Financial Services
description:
At TRATON Financial Services we have started the journey to become the provider of Financial Services to all TRATON brands. Today we have a presence in over 65 markets, making us one of the most global private actors in the financial services industry. Do you want to join us on this journey?
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled IT Vendor Management Specialist to join our team and support the re-negotiation of current and procurement of new core applications.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The IT Vendor Management Specialist will play a crucial role in our organization by supporting the re-negotiation of current and procurement of new core applications. This position requires a deep understanding of Financial/Banking ERP functionalities, integration capabilities, and the strategic needs of the organization. The role involves close collaboration with the Sourcing organization to align requirements with procurement processes, ensuring that vendor selections and contract negotiations support the IT and organizational objectives.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

  

* Lead the technical and functional evaluation of potential ERP systems, ensuring they meet the organization's requirements in terms of scalability, integration, user-friendliness, and support. This includes setting evaluation criteria, coordinating demos, and synthesizing feedback from various stakeholders.
* Serve as the primary IT department contact for interactions with the Sourcing organization regarding ERP vendors. This involves conveying requirements, participating in vendor discussions, and providing input on the technical and service aspects during the vendor selection process.
* Work closely with key stakeholders across IT, finance, operations, and other relevant departments to gather system requirements and ensure the selected ERP solution addresses the diverse needs of the organization.
* Offer insights and feedback on technical clauses and service level agreements (SLAs) in contracts drafted by the Sourcing organization, ensuring they align with IT standards and requirements.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred.
* Proven experience in vendor management, particularly with ERP systems.
* In-depth knowledge of ERP technologies and implementation methodologies.
* Strong negotiation and contract management skills.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to solve complex problems.
* Professional in English both in writing and speaking.


 Application
   

  

 If you're ready to take on this exciting opportunity and believe you have the right skills and mindset to thrive in our team, we want to hear from you! Submit your application today and be part of our journey towards digital excellence at TRATON Financial Services.
   

  

 Last day of application is 26 of June and please note that we do not accept applications over email.
   

  

 TRATON Financial Services
   

  

 TRATON Financial Services is a global multi-brand captive finance provider. Services include financing for customers, dealers, and distributors as well as insurance solutions and additional services. By this, TRATON Financial Services supports transforming transportation. With its brands Scania, MAN, Navistar and Volkswagen Truck and Bus, the TRATON GROUP is one of the world’s leading commercial vehicle manufacturers. The Group aims to reinvent transportation with its products, its services, and as a partner to its customers.

title: Penetrationstestare
description:
På Saab är vårt främsta mål att människor och samhällen ska vara trygga. Vill du vara en del av detta där du tillhör en arbetsplats där du dagligen bidrar till att skapa en säkrare värld? Vi söker nu dig som brinner för cybersäkerhet och vill arbeta som penetrationstestare hos oss.
   

  

 Din roll
   

  

 I samband med att cyberhoten ökar är det alltmer viktigt att ha skapa en säker digital värld och alltid ligga steget före hackers. Som penetrationstestare arbetar du därmed med att hitta och verifiera sårbarheter i våra miljöer. På Saab arbetar vi mycket med att hålla hemligheter hemliga och IT-säkerhet är en del av vårt DNA. I en tjänst hos oss kommer du arbeta med större IT-system med höga säkerhetskrav och det är viktigt att du gillar att arbeta självständigt samtidigt som du är en teamplayer.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga uppgifter:
   

  

* Genomföra penetrationstester av större IT-system med höga säkerhetskrav. Att följa myndighetskrav och föreskrifter är därmed en stor del av rollen.
* Ansvara kring planering och prioritering utav olika penetrationstester Tolka resultaten från testerna och ge förslag på mitigerande åtgärder utifrån de identifierade bristerna.


 Din profil
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen ser vi gärna att du som person är en driven och självgående IT-säkerhetstekniker med erfarenhet av att självständigt arbeta med penetrationstester av större IT-system med höga säkerhetskrav. Du bör vara van vid att ha mycket eget ansvar kring planering, prioritering och genomförande av pen-tester och tycker det är kul att utifrån resultaten identifiera bristerna och ge förslag på åtgärder. Du bör även ha en stor social förmåga och ha lätt för att samarbeta. Vi tror du har en driv och en stark vilja att nå uppsatta mål
   

  

 Vi tror att du har erfarenhet:
   

  

* Av bred användning av olika verktyg/programvaror för genomförande av pen-tester (Black box, Grey box, White box)
* Nätverk – Design & struktur, kommunikation & protokoll, FW, IDS/IPS, Lastbalanserare, Storage, mm.
* Webbsystem
* Hårdvara och operativsystem (både Windows och Linux)
* Virtualisering och Containers
* Programmering och Reverse engineering


 Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap. Den här tjänsten är förlagd antingen i Stockholm eller i Linköping.
   

  

 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

title: Application Security Consultant
description:
**About Accenture Security**
**Be yourself,** 
**Influence the future**
**Are you ready to take your skills to a new level?**
 At Accenture, working days are never the same and that´s why we have fun here! This is a great opportunity to build a rewarding career at
 **Accenture Security.** 
 With us, you get to work in a relaxed bold team, with talented and supportive colleagues. We support your individual skills in an engaging work community where everyone is allowed to be themselves. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. At Accenture, you get to work on customer projects at the world´s leading companies. Accenture is a leading global consulting company that provides services in strategy, consulting, digitalization, technology, and outsourcing. With experience, specialized expertise, global resources, and extensive industry expertise. Accenture works at the business and technology level to help customers increase their performance and develop sustainable value for their stakeholders. With over 700.000 employees and customers in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation for a simplified everyday life. We are currently looking to recruit
 **Application Security Experts** 
 to be a part of our global security community
 **.**
**What We Are Looking For**
- Bachelor's or Master’s degree in IT/Information Technology/Computer Science.

- Minimum 4 years of work experience within the cyber security field.

- Deep experience with secure software development, application security and/or DevSecOps.

- Experience with cloud solutions such as Azure, AWS, GCP and/or infrastructure.

- Experience in engaging directly with technical representatives from clients during system development.

- Familiarity with standards, regulations, and frameworks such as: OWASP, OIDC, OAuth, XACML, or GDPR.

- Proficient in both spoken and written Swedish (or other Scandinavian languages), as well as English.

**Nice to have**
- Developer skills in areas such as Java, Spring framework, NodeJS, microservices architecture, Docker, Kubernetes, microservices, and more.

- Hands-on experience from security tools like Veracode, Splunk, Snyk, or similar.

- Relevant certifications: CCSK, CISSP, CSSLP, or similar.

- Current or former Norwegian security personnel clearance.

- Experience in leading projects and/or technical teams.

**Life at Accenture**
 Throughout your time at Accenture, we do not only offer our people the training they need but also expect them to take the time to learn and grow in a culture of continuous improvement. As you progress through your career in the path you choose, you will move more and more towards a leadership role in the truest sense of the word. Leaders lead by respect, knowledge and by helping those more junior than themselves. You will also be assigned a career counselor over time.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer and inclusive and inspiring work environment with access to our global network and ample training opportunities. You will be able to develop your skills within security and grow both personally and professionally. Our projects are built on cooperation and teamwork, and you will find yourself teaming with other talented, passionate and dedicated consultants, all working towards a shared goal. Some of our benefits:
   

  

  

- Accenture Sweden employees are entitled to minimum of 5 weeks of vacation every year.

- All employees in Accenture have a pension saving plan.

- Health Insurance

- Health Allowance at 5000 SEK per year

- Within Accenture, you are encouraged to do trainings related to your profession, to develop your skills.

 We also offer:
   

  

  

- A unique opportunity to use technical knowledge to contribute to innovation and socially changing projects – Accenture has a large customer portfolio across all industries. Which brings with it many exciting opportunities!

- Great professional challenges and a unique opportunity to apply your expertise and work on projects that matter to you and the society.

- Everyone in Accenture has a dedicated internal career counsellor and sparring partner with whom you can discuss personal development in confidence.

- Good bonus schemes, competitive salary, minimum 5 weeks of vacation, health insurance, pension schemes, share savings program and parental leave covered beyond NAV’s terms and conditions up to 12G.

- A packed social calendar for those interested. We have regular beer, board game night, watch handball match, play volleyball, go surfing, play chess and go cross-country skiing, etc

**We look forward to learning more about you!** 
 Apply online, attach your CV and letter of application in English. If you have any questions, please contact responsible recruiter: karl.kego@accenture.com

title: Mätvärdesoperatör till Vattenfall
description:
En spännande vardag – för en fossilfri framtid. Hos Vattenfall får du vara med och påverka morgondagens klimatsmarta samhälle och skapa framtidens elnät. Vi söker dig som ser möjligheter i förändringar och gillar att jobba med problemlösning! Som mätvärdesoperatör med inriktning mot Kundkontakt och Utredning erbjuder Vattenfall ett självständigt och stimulerande arbete. Släpp loss dina superkrafter med oss!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Vattenfall Eldistribution AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 September
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle så erbjuder Vattenfall en arbetsplats med goda möjligheter till utveckling. De uppmuntrar dig som vill komma vidare och utforska nya områden inom företaget. Det är viktigt att hela livet fungerar och därför är de måna om att deras medarbetare upplever en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. De är övertygade om att mångfald och inkludering leder till nytänkande, förbättrade affärsresultat och ökat engagemang och de strävar efter att representera mångfalden bland deras kunder och samhället de verkar i. Vår verksamhet går ut på att mäta förbrukad energi hos kunder och sedan hantera mätrelaterade avvikelser i såväl interna system som hos kunderna. Detta ansvar omfattar följande arbetsuppgifter:
 


  

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
  

  
* Administrativt utreda ärenden som relaterar till kunder.
  
* Säkerställa att mätdata och information om mätare är uppdaterad och korrekt i våra system.
  
* Aktivt bidra till att utveckla och förbättra mätinsamlingsprocessen.
  
* Hantera mätarbyten i våra system från återrapporteringarna i fält
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har minst en eftergymnasial utbildning med teknisk inriktning eller motsvarande erfarenheter.
  
* Har någon form av elnätskompetens eller förståelse för elnät och/eller elmätare
  
* Har god vana av att arbeta i olika IT system och har lätt för att lära dig nya system.
  
* Kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift
  
* Är strukturerad och noggrann i ditt arbete. Vi värdesätter dina personliga egenskaper. För att trivas och sedermera lyckas i rollen tror vi att du som söker gillar att jobba i en omväxlande miljö med mycket problemlösning. Du är självständig på din väg mot uppsatta mål. En god förmåga att kunna samarbeta med andra och vara flexibel när det behövs är även viktigt i denna roll.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du**



  

  
* Har erfarenhet av Mätinsamling eller Mätvärdeshantering.
  
* Har arbetat i fält med elnätsfrågor eller kommit i kontakt med elnätsfrågor i tidigare anställningar
  
* Har erfarenhet från elkraftsbranschen.
  
* Har erfarenhet av kundkontakt.

 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. title: Manager - Time Team
description:
Are you passionate about leading and coaching teams to deliver exceptional technology solutions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where collaboration and innovation drive success? SD Worx is looking for a dedicated and experienced Manager for our Nordics Time Team.
   

  

 As the manager of our Nordics Time Team, you will lead a cross-functional team including product specialists, a product owner, a solution architect, software developers, and testers. You will deliver technology solutions in collaboration with stakeholders such as Sales, Consultants, Customer Care, and other Product Teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Report to the Technology Director as a member of the development management team.
* Coach and support your team of 15 people, ensuring their well-being and growth.
* Align product vision with the product roadmap in collaboration with the product owner and specialists.
* Facilitate day-to-day agile processes and continuous improvement.
* Communicate and report team progress to management.
* Ensure high-frequency deployments and address recurring problems with solutions.


**What You Bring:**
* Master’s degree or equivalent experience.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.
* Relevant experience as a team lead or manager.
* Passion for coaching and motivating people.
* Initiative, a "can do" mentality, and strong communication skills.
* Problem-solving ability, curiosity, and collaboration skills.
* Experience with agile methodologies and business software development (5+ years).
* Familiarity with large distributed Microsoft (C#) environments.


 Join us at SD Worx and help bring people solutions to life!
   

  

**About Us :**
 SD Worx is a leading European provider of Payroll & HR services with global reach. We have offices in Europe and an office in Mauritius. Our goal? We bring people solutions to life. So, companies of any size can turn Human Resources into a source of value for the business and the people in it. Our people solutions span the entire employee journey, from getting people paid to attracting, rewarding, and developing talent. Are you ready to join us?
   

  

**What do we have to offer?**
* An attractive salary based on your experience and achievement.
* A dynamic environment: flexible working hours and working from home.
* Learning opportunities: through an individual development plan and professional training
* Career growth: whether you want to become more of an expert in your field our you want to expand your knowledge more horizontally, there is always room to grow within SD Worx!


 From many places, we work as one, moving from better to best together.
   

  

 SD Worx lives diversity in the workplace. Diversity provides inspiration and innovation in our company. We particularly welcome applications from qualified talent, regardless of origin, nationality, gender, skin colour, ethnic and social background, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation and stage of life.

title: Supply Chain Planner to international company!
description:
Are you a strategic planner with a passion for logistics? We are now looking for a Supply Chain Planner who wants to take the opportunity to become a key player in a global organization and develop with them. The start for this position is immediately - welcome with your application!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Warehousing / Logistics
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, time-limited assignment of 6 months
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Supply Chain Planner, your main responsibility is to plan, coordinate, and optimize our packed goods operations at our clients European hub. You will ensure cost-effectiveness and high customer service by managing production planning for drums and IBCs, participating in improvement projects, and assisting the Head of Supply Chain Operations with cost follow-up and invoice management. Additionally, you will handle stock reconciliation and maintain statistical reporting databases. You will also play an active role in matching supply and demand within the NSP Supply Chain Department along with other stakeholders.
 


  


 On a personal level we are seeking for applicants who lives the companies values of dedication, cooperation and proactivity. The candidate has a good basic understanding of logistics and planning, is structured, positive, service minded, resilient, open to changes, flexible and has good social, influencing and diplomatic skills.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* A challenging position in an international setting and a highly motivated team.
  
* The opportunity of making an impact and work closely with dedicated colleagues around the world.
  
* The opportunity to develop within Supply Chain Management.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Planning and optimization of the packed goods operation within the global hub in Antwerp including but not limited to production (filling of packed goods) planning for drums and IBC.
  
* Participation depot/hub improvement projects that have an impact on packed goods.
  
* Assist the Head of Supply Chain Operations with cost follow up and approval of costs/signing of invoices according to delegation.
  
* Synergi deviations related to packed goods and hub related operational and HSSE issues.
  
* Stock reconciliation at the end of each month.
  
* Maintaining statistical reporting database such as inventory levels, truck data, timeslots, demurrage, rejections, no shows, overtimes amongst others.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Academic degree, preferably in logistics and/or economics.
  
* Operational background experience. Previous work experience in logistics or the process industry, particularly within the chemical sector or any other company handling bulk liquids, is considered a valuable merit.
  
* Fluent in english. Knowledge in the Swedish or Dutch language is a valuable merit.
  
* Solid knowledge in IT and Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Structured
  
* Positive and service minded
  
* Good communication, diplomatic and social skills
  
* Self-sufficient
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Molly Rytter or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stw06@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15104853

title: Junior ERP/EPM utvecklare sökes till ledande svensk storbank
description:
Är du passionerad över teknik och vill göra en verklig skillnad i finansvärlden? Ta chansen att bli en del av ett högpresterande team på en av Sveriges ledande storbanker.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, möjlighet till distansbarbete 1-2 dagar i veckan
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 1 september
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

  

**Om tjänsten**
  

 Academic Work söker en driven och teknikintresserad individ med ekonomiskt och/eller tekniskt intresse till rollen som Oracle ERP/EPM Developer. Du kommer att ingå i ett högpresterande team bestående av sex personer med olika inriktningar inom teknik och ekonomi. Rollen är initialt ett konsultuppdrag via Academic Work, med möjlighet till överrekrytering vid positivt utfall.
 


  


  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**



  

  
* Skapa skräddarsydda Oracle-lösningar: Designa och implementera Oracle-verktyg som överensstämmer med bästa praxis och företagets affärsbehov.
  
* Optimera prestanda: Övervaka och finjustera systemen för att säkerställa högsta effektivitet.
  
* Lösa problem: Vara i framkant när det gäller att lösa problem och säkerställa smidig och effektiv drift.
  
* Samarbeta: Arbeta nära med ett mångsidigt team, dela insikter och driva kontinuerlig förbättring.
  


  


  

**Du erbjuds:**



  

  
* Utbildningsmöjligheter: Tillgång till utbildningsprogram och kontinuerliga läranderesurser.
  
* Stöttande team: Under din introduktion kommer du arbeta dedikerat med en kollega som stöttar dig i din utveckling.
  
* Inkluderande kultur: En vänlig och välkomnande miljö där alla kan trivas.
  
* Innovationshub: Bli en del av ett innovativt företag i framkant av tekniken.
  
* Moderna arbetsmetoder: Omfamna agila och moderna arbetsmetoder.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Relevant examen: Exempelvis inom IT/datavetenskap eller ekonomisk bakgrund.
  
* Språk: Flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
  
* Tidigare erfarenhet: Dokumenterad teknisk kompetens från tidigare yrken eller projekt.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* ERP/EPM-expertis: Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att konfigurera och utveckla ERP- eller EPM-lösningar.
  
* Grundläggande förståelse: Programmering och affärssystem.
  


  


  

**Personliga egenskaper för att lyckas i rollen:**



  

  
* Analytisk förmåga: Starka analytiska färdigheter för att hantera och tolka komplex information.
  
* Proaktiv problemlösare: Utmärkta problemlösningsförmågor med ett proaktivt tillvägagångssätt.
  
* Initiativtagande: Förmåga att ta egna initiativ till förbättringar och samarbeten där det passar.
  


  


  

**Start:**
 1 september
   

 Denna roll är ett konsultuppdrag via Academic Work med chans till överrekrytering.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Anton Hegart eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104977

title: Sales Executive, Siemens Digital Industries Software - Eviden
description:
Eviden, part of the Atos Group, with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion is a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 53,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.
   

  

 Eviden is an Atos Group business with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion and a global leader in data-driven, trusted, and sustainable digital transformation. As a next-generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing, and security, it brings deep expertise to all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 55,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.
   

  

 Eviden is investing in the Nordics. Our ambition is to implement heavy business growth across Nordics countries and become a Leader in empowering industrial customers with unwavering adaptability and industrial excellence . The hearth of our Nordics strategy is to build a local manufacturing center of excellence, to become a preferred partner for industrial companies in the Nordics.
   

  

 We are dedicated to innovating together with our clients and partners to enhance the design, manufacturing, sales, and service of products, serving our clients securely and sustainably.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 Eviden is the largest Siemens software reseller in the Nordics. We have built our expertise spanning nearly 30 years in the industry and have a strong team of experts in Scandinavia and the Baltics. Siemens's partnership is a strategic choice for us. We are at the forefront of digital transformation and cloud services, and we are seeking Sales Specialists for our Manufacturing Center of Excellence in the Nordics.
   

  

 Your mission: As a Sales Executive, you will join our Siemens Digital Industries Software sales team and focus on selling Siemens software and services to industrial clients in the region. Your goal is to position Siemens Digital Industries Software as the preferred technology and Eviden as a trusted advisor in PLM, MOM, and Product/Production Simulation areas. The main focus is to land new customers.
   

  

**We will consider candidates based in the following locations: Finland, Sweden, Denmark, or Norway**
****As a key contributor to our growth in the Nordics, your responsibilities include:****
* Strategize and penetrate large accounts with a focus on Siemens Digital Industries Software portfolio and you will be working with highly skilled professionals working in SAP, digital security, smart platforms, and manufacturing domains.
* Accrue and deploy customer insights, driving business transformation and reducing customer costs and risks.
* Lead with product and industry insights, best practices, and compelling business cases, establishing Eviden as a tier 1 industry partner and a trusted advisor.
* Manage customer relationships with integrity, driving satisfaction and positioning Eviden as a leader in innovation and service delivery.
* Leverage your existing network to land new customers in our Siemens Digital Industries Software offerings.
* Build a broad influential network amongst your clients to create additional opportunities to expand our footprint in the accounts.
* Engage prospects and provide strategic recommendations that position our products and services to advance the customer’s strategic initiatives and deliver mutual value.
* Work closely with marketing to improve our position in the market and harness your digital sales and marketing skills to drive new sales leads.
* Build and own your sales territory plan and execute the plan by leading our pre-sales consultants and marketing team.


****Qualifications:****
* Passion for industrial digitalization and experience and understanding of industrial value chain.
* 5+ years of experience in enterprise software sales, sales enablement, business development, software industry operations
* Experience in value-based sales methodologies
* Proven track record of success in selling complex technical software solutions and building strong qualified pipeline in systematic way.
* Skill in identifying key stakeholders and decision-makers, establishing long-term relationships of trust, credibility, and respect.
* Strong work ethic: Team player, self-starter, high energy, and results oriented.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills in English, both verbal and written, is mandatory. A fluent local language (Finnish, Swedish, Norwegian) is considered as a large benefit.


****What we offer:****
* A role in a unique technology powerhouse with a strong local and global presence and a commitment to driving sustainability and environmental programs.
* Opportunities for growth within a company that values learning, agility, and customer obsession.
* You will have a unique opportunity to witness heavy business expansion and you are essential contributor for the growth. #Eviden


**Let’s grow together.**

title: Underrättelseledare
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? FRA söker nu en underrättelseledare till avdelningen för signalunderrättelser som vill vara med och leda arbetet med att skapa förståelse för vad som egentligen händer i världen* 
*. Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv verksamhet där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag. På FRA arbetar vi med unika uppgifter – för Sveriges säkerhet och integritet.*
**Om FRA**
 Omvärlden är FRA:s arena. Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi gör det för att skydda det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Genom vår kunskap om omvärlden kan vårt land förbereda sig och möta hoten i tid. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning och en larmklocka för militära hot. Vi är också i kärnan av det svenska cyberförsvaret och skyddar de viktigaste verksamheterna och den viktigaste infrastrukturen från angrepp. För att klara våra kärnuppdrag krävs avancerade tekniklösningar. Tillsammans har vi en unik uppgift, som vi löser med kunskap och kompetens som vi är ensamma om i Sverige.
   

  

 För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 Som underrättelseledare hör du till avdelningen för signalunderrättelser som bedriver signalspaning enligt lagen om signalspaning i försvarsunderrättelseverksamhet. Avdelningen arbetar med inhämtning av råmaterial, bearbetning och analys samt levererar underrättelser och andra tjänster till myndighetens uppdragsgivare.
   

  

**I Rollen Som Underrättelseledare Ansvarar Du För**
* underrättelseproduktionen inom området yt- och luftlägesbevakning
* verksamhetsutveckling på området avseende metodik och till viss del teknik
* kvalitetssäkra rapporter före delgivning till uppdragsgivarna


 Du utgör en länk mellan FRA och uppdragsgivarna och har god kännedom om deras underrättelsebehov och verkar för att svara upp mot dessa. Du har många kontaktytor, såväl internt som med uppdragsgivare samt med internationella samverkanspartners. Vidare har du ett indirekt ledarskap för ett antal medarbetare och har lätt för att skapa goda relationer. Du ingår i en större ledningsgrupp och är delaktig i arbete med planering och uppföljning av verksamhet.
   

  

 Tjänsteresor inrikes och utrikes förekommer.
   

  

**Du kan**
**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* tidigare erfarenhet av underrättelseproduktion
* allmänna kunskaper, samt visst intresse, för IT- och telekomfrågor
* mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


**Vi Ser Det Som Meriterande Om Du Har**
* akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande kunskap som du tillägnat dig via arbete
* erfarenhet av underrättelseproduktion med fokus på Ryssland och ryska militära plattformar
* erfarenhet som konsument av FRA:s militära rapportering
* tidigare erfarenhet av ledande befattningar
* språkkunskaper i ryska eller andra relevanta språk för verksamhetsområdet
* kunskap om FRA:s verksamhetsområde


**Du är**
 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som med stor integritet och ett gott omdöme har förmågan att strukturera ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt. Du har en förmåga att förutse problem och anpassar ditt arbete därefter i både lång- och kortsiktiga planer. Du drar lärdom från erfarenheter och feedback från omgivningen för att utveckla din kompetens och prestation över tid. Tydlig kommunikation är en naturlig del av ditt arbetssätt och vi ser även att du har en god samarbetsförmåga. Inom rollen som underrättelseledare kommer du att ha många kontaktytor och behöver ha lätt för att etablera nya kontakter för att bygga eller stärka relationer i yrkesmässiga sammanhang. I ditt beslutsfattande tar du stor hänsyn till uppdragsgivare och försöker aktivt att hitta lösningar som bäst motsvarar deras behov.
   

  

**Mer information**
 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min med buss från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta Rekryterande chef på telefon 010-557 47 50. Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00.
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökningar via www.fra.se
 **senast 2024-07-21.**
 Referensnummer
 **4454/21** 
 .

title: Säkerhetsskyddshandläggare till Sweco!
description:
Har du en bakgrund inom säkerhetskydd och vill ha ett jobb som gör skillnad? Till Sweco som är en helhetsleverantör av tjänster inom säkerhet och skydd, söker vi nu en Säkerhetskyddshandläggare! Läs mer om tjänsten här och skicka in en ansökan redan idag.
 



  

**Företag :**
 SWECO Sverige AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 HR/kontor/administration
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 För Swecos räkning söker vi nu en säkerhetsskyddshandläggare med betoning på säkerhetsprövningar med placering vid deras huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Avdelningen består av en säkerhetsskyddschef tillika säkerhetschef, en biträdande säkerhetsskyddschef samt två säkerhetsskyddshandläggare.
 


  


 Som säkerhetsskyddshandläggare hos Sweco kommer du få stora möjligheter att utvecklas både personlighets- intresse- och erfarenhetsmässigt, i ett bolag som ständigt utvecklas. Här får du möjlighet att vara en del av företagets arbete med att bistå Swecos kunder i att skydda viktiga funktioner i samhället. Hos Sweco blir du del av ett starkt team som kompletterar och ställer upp för varandra i verksamheten.
 


  


 Tjänsten är ett bemanningsuppdrag via Academic Work som förväntas pågå långsiktigt förutsatt att samarbetet fungerar bra.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Genomföra och följa upp säkerhetsprövningar
  
* Genomföra personutredningar vid särskilda händelser
  
* Administration i form av säkerhetsskyddsavtal, bakgrundskontroller, ansökan om registerkontroller, utbildningar m.m.
  
* Utveckla, driva och säkerhetställa att säkerhetsskyddet i Sweco efterlevs
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad universitetsutbildning inom säkerhet, beteendevetenskap, IT eller liknande
  
* Har intresse för system, IT och säkerhet
  
* Har lätt för att sätta dig in i nya system och arbetssätt
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska då bägge språken används i det dagliga arbetet
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetsskydd
  
* Säkerhetsbakgrund av något slag exempelvis informationssäkerhet, personalsäkerhet eller om du studerat på eftergymnasial nivå inom ämnet
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Stabil
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  


 I den här processen kommer dina personliga egenskaper vara avgörande. För att lyckas i tjänsten är bör du vara driven, trygg, pålitlig och ha hög integritet. Vidare är du noggrann, kvalitetsmedveten och har en välutvecklad analytisk förmåga. Du behöver även ha en god kommunikativ- och pedagogisk förmåga, vilket gör att du skapar förtroende och förståelse till våra medarbetare. För dig är det viktigt att driva uppgifter framåt och i mål.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 


  


 Går du vidare i processen kommer bakgrundskontroller genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här

 Alina Finnberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105313

title: SAP SD OTC Solution Architect
description:
**HCLTech is a global technology company, home to more than 221,000 people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services.** 




  





**Our global team of SAP experts deliver a full range of advisory, implementation and support services to ensure our clients achieve their desired business and IT outcomes. We bring together the best of technology and our people to supercharge progress.** 




**SAP, Done Better!** 




  





**Job Title: SAP OTC Solution Architect** 




**Key Function: To provide OTC Subject Matter Expertise/Solution Architecture to clients** 









**Key Objectives:**




  






 • To be part of the project delivery team to provide subject matter expertise and architecture.
 



 • Analysis of business requirements.
 



 • Design and implementation of full solutions.
 



 • Identify integration issues and develop solutions to these issues.
 



 • Collaborate as a key member of the sales team to represent the solution offering to the client buyer
 



 • Coach and develop skills within a project team.
 



 • Work effectively in mixed client and consultancy teams.
 








**Competencies:**




  






 • Can conceptualize and communicate proposal – making complex ideas look simple.
 



 • Bright, ability to rapidly pick-up new technologies, propositions, and business areas.
 



 • Outcome oriented – maximizing balance of effort vs benefit to achieve objectives.
 



 • Demonstrates excellent communication skills both verbally and in writing.
 



 • Ability to work under own initiative and under tight time pressures - planning, prioritising, and controlling own workload.
 



 • Demonstrates excellent communication skills both verbally and in writing.
 



 • Precise approach to project management and procedures.
 



 • Ability to assert own ideas to business and within business senior management.
 



 • Is able to give strong coaching and feedback where needed to team members.
 



 • Continuous improvement - Inquisitive – “self teaching” of relevant new business thinking and technology solutions.
 



 • Proactively contributes to the body of knowledge.
 



 • Uses a set of basic consulting tools Is able to conduct one-to-one interviews with middle managers.
 



 • Can contribute to a mixed workshop process.
 









**Role Competencies:**




  






 • Detailed knowledge of business requirements and solutions in their focus area (Technology, Industry or LOB).
 



 • Mobilise and motivate a project team.
 



 • Ability to organise and co-ordinate diverse groups in complex situations.
 



 • Broad content experience across multiple lines of business.
 



 • Broad technical appreciation – including ALL key SAP functionality and technology. With ability to rapidly assess new technology solutions.
 



 • Lead functional / technical architecture in complex SAP and non-SAP environments.
 



 • Support the Programme Director to develop phasing strategy, plans, benefits case, org structures, risks and issues
 



 • Manages design workshops on multiple area of expertise.
 



 • Command the respect and confidence of other Solution Architects management.
 



 • Ability to develop methods and tools and contribute to Solution Team strategy.
 








**Delivery Excellence:**









 • Able to effectively manage a team of business team members.
 



 • Understands delivery within a fixed price model and able to operate effectively within those constraints.
 



 • Can take ownership of sub-plans for specific processes and can plan own time to ensure project milestones are met.
 



 • Able to take an issue, then plan and deliver a solution using own initiative, with little guidance.
 



 • Identifies and escalates issues and risks within project structure.
 



 • Can build strong relationships with consultants within the project.
 



 • Able to receive feedback / coaching on performance from other members of the team positively.
 



 • Have a strong understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies
 








**Client Development:**








 • Can contribute technical or procedural sections to a proposal.
 



 • Can identify and escalate business development opportunities.
 







**Skills/Knowledge/Experience Needed:**









 • Extensive SAP implementation experience within SD module
 



 • Strong knowledge on configuration /Variant
 



 • Strong Manufacturing industry background
 



 • Extensive experience of SAP OTC - with 6 project lifecycles.
 



 • Track history of leadership.
 



 • Strong client facing Consultancy experience
 



 • Fluent Language skills required
 



  





*HCLTech is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants receive consideration for employment regardless of their race, colour, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, age, marital status, or status with regard to public assistance.*

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Automat-it is an all-in AWS Premier partner that empowers startups with DevOps and FinOps expertise and hands-on services. We guide and support hundreds of startups leveraging AWS smarter throughout their growth journey. We save our customers significant time to market and optimize their cloud performance and cost-effectiveness.
   

  

 Automat-it operates in more than seven countries across EMEA. We provide a dynamic environment where you can expand your professional expertise and make a significant impact.
   

  

 In this position as Senior Solutions Architect, you will be a crucial member of the pre-sales process, working with account managers to develop AWS solutions for our startup customers.
   

  

 📍 Work location - hybrid from Stockholm.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and implement solutions to meet business requirements and create cost-efficient, highly available, and scalable solutions for customers, including Well-Architected reviews and SoW.
* Research and analyze current solutions and initiate improvement plans.
* Collaborate with other engineers and stakeholders to ensure solutions are designed and developed according to best practices.
* Share your knowledge with our customers and the cloud community by participating in public speaking engagements such as workshops, conferences, webinars, and more.


**Requirements**
* 3+ years of hands-on experience in an AWS environment, including implementation, migration, and maintenance, designing solutions end-to-end
* 2+ years of experience in technical customer-facing roles, such as Customer Engineering, SRE, Cloud Architect, or equivalent
* 2+ years of experience in an IT environment, including hands-on in Kubernetes, CI/CD, and DevOps tools - advantage
* Proven experience in a production environment, developing software with either Python, Go, Java, or equivalents
* In-depth knowledge of AWS's main services, with an emphasis on Kubernetes and Containers
* Successfully designed DevOps and Infrastructure for high-scale production environments in AWS
* Understanding of Information Security best practices
* Certified AWS Solutions Architect - Associate.
* AWS Solutions Architect Professional or a specialty certification - an advantage
* Ability to effectively communicate technical design in verbal and written formats in front of customers
* Ability to lead an end-to-end engagement with the account management team
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both English and Swedish
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment


 Automat-it is committed to fostering a workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all. We firmly believe that cultivating a diverse workforce is crucial to our success. Our recruitment decisions are grounded in your experience and skills, recognizing the value you bring to our team.

title: Markförvaltare till Mark- och exploateringsenheten
description:
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en markförvaltare till vårt team på Mark- och exploateringsenheten i Norrtälje kommun. Som markförvaltare är du en viktig del av enhetens löpande arbete med markförvaltning och bevakar kommunens intressen inom förvaltning och utveckling av skärgård, skog och mark. Du får vara med och analysera och planera förvaltningen på ett långsiktigt hållbart sätt och ansvara för kontakter med kommunens intressenter. Du kommer även vara en viktig del av utveckling av struktur och processer för förvaltningen. Här har du chansen att ta plats i en trevlig och kompetent grupp.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Som markförvaltare kommer du ha många omväxlande arbetsuppgifter. I rollen ingår att:
   

  

* Företräda och förvalta kommunens marktillgångar på ett ekonomiskt, hållbart och juridiskt perspektiv på kort och lång sikt
* Utveckla kommunens markförvaltning med en ansvarsfull och professionell förvaltningsstruktur
* Representera kommunen som markägare i bl.a. avtal, lantmäteriförrättningar, bygglov och planera för kommande exploateringar
* Hantera löpande markförvaltning såsom framtagande av arrenden, servitut, ledningsrätt och andra nyttjanderätter och avtal
* Bereda och presentera ärenden med att ta fram underlag och avtal för beslut hos politiken
* Utveckling och utbyggnad av kommunägda hamnar
* Samverka med olika intressenter, privatpersoner, företag och andra förvaltningar
* Hantera mark-, skogs- och skärgårdsfrågor där jakt kan ingå
* Hantera administration och diarieföring som krävs för ärenden och avtal
* Stödja förvaltningen med utveckling av rutiner och processer


**Kvalifikationer**
 Krav
   

  

 Du har universitets- eller högskoleutbildning inom lantmäteri/samhällsbyggnad, förslagsvis med inriktning inom väg- och vatten, fastighetsutveckling, fastighetsjuridik eller annan lämplig akademisk utbildning.
   

  

 Du har erfarenhet av att hantera markförvaltarfrågor, till exempel framtagande av arrenden, servitut, försäljningsavtal eller andra nyttjanderätter.
