title: Technical Project Manager
description:
***Please note that the screening process for this role will start at the beginning of August due to the vacation period in July.***




  





*Do you have a passion for driving and executing technical topics and activities in a complex matrix organization landscape with a multitude of stakeholders.* 




  





*Do you want to help us reshape the Mobility Insurance Industry, and understand the benefits of a standard system implementation within existing technology landscape? Join our team as a Technical Project Manager.* 




  





**About the team** 




 You will be joining ‘Mobility and Classic SE Solutions’ one of the engineering units in If. Our unit is developing and operating core insurance systems for the private sector primarily in Sweden.
 



  





 We have just embarked on a major journey of renewing our core system landscape by implementing a standard SAAS insurance platform named Guidewire.
 



  





 This work has been created and executed as a program named CTP (Core Transformation Program) and your first assignment as Technical Project Manager will be to drive technical activities within the program.
 



 You will be working closely with a large number of stakeholders both within and outside of the Core Transformation Program.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 In your role as Technical Project Manager in the ‘Mobility and Classic SE Solutions’-unit you will be assigned to work in different delivery contexts. The first assignment will be in the Core Transformation Program.
 



 In your role as the Technical Project Manager in the CTP-program, you will be involved in the work with program backlog breaking down the backlog into adequate size and complexity.
 



  





 One of the most important responsibilities of the role is to take a joint ownership in that we deliver a system with operational excellence securing that we deliver a high functioning system that works in practice.
 



 You will work especially close with our System squad in topics regarding infrastructure and engineering related questions not necessarily derived from top-level functional requirements.
 



  





 Secondly, you will also work very close our Delivery Leads in planning, prioritizing and executing the work needed to be done.
 



 Finally, you will also work closely with our architects complementing them in driving engineering topics as needed. Especially needed is to compliment the architects with the work regarding non-functional requirements part of the system.
 



  





**We offer** 




 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
 


* An inclusive work environment that embraces diversity and welcomes all.
* Career and development opportunities within the largest insurance company in the Nordics.
* Engaging social activities alongside highly skilled professionals.
* Flexibility with a hybrid workplace model.
* A health-promoting environment, including wellness allowance, a variety of sports activities, compensation for home office equipment, and more.
* Comprehensive insurance benefits.
* A lunch bonus to fuel your productivity.
* A robust pension saving plan to secure your future (subject to location).



  





**Who you are** 




 We are looking for a driven professional with a passion for technical project management that appreciate the opportunity and welcomes the challenge of running a large-scale complex transformation program within one Sweden’s largest insurance companies. We think that you are used to delivering value in an agile or agile at scale high-performance context.
 



  





**You also have** 




 You are a servant leader, a caring team player and problem solver who understands the challenge and finds a way through it.
 



  




* You execute with a strong conviction balancing the need for progress with the need for communicating and delivering quality work.
* You have very good technical understanding, and you are comfortable facilitating deep technical discussions with different stakeholders.
* You have strong working knowledge in project and program management.
* You have strong working knowledge when it comes to agile and agile at scale ways of working.
* You have extensive experience from technical project management delivery.
* You are passionate about delivering a system with high operational excellence.
* Strong practical, working knowledge of addressing non-functional requirements.
* Strong communication skills and fluent in English.



  





**Our promise to you** 




 You will be part of an international, modern, and dynamic working environment within the leading insurance company in the Nordic region. You will have challenging and exciting tasks driving your personal development. Training opportunities within and outside the organization will support your career growth. You will be at the forefront of delivering solutions aimed at the changing mobility landscape.
 



  





**Additional facts and the recruitment process** 




**Application deadline** 
 : Screening will start at the beginning of August due to the vacation period in July.
 



**To apply for the position** 
 : Please attach your CV.
 



**Work location** 
 : Sweden (Stockholm, Gothenburg) or Finland (Helsinki, Turku), Latvia (Riga)
 



**Start** 
 : As soon as possible or by agreement
 



  





 For more information, please contact hiring manager Niklas Lindström, +46-70-7935714
 



  





 Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.
 



  





 Read more about our Tech Community at If and how we together create tech that matters: http://www.if.se/tech
 



  





 Ready to be part of our dynamic team and drive impactful change? Apply today and seize this opportunity!

title: Product Specialist
description:
**Why join Bannerflow?** 




 Bannerflow is a hyper-growth company and one of Europe's most exciting SaaS companies. Our Creative Management Platform serves more than 6 billion ads each month, viewed on 500 million unique devices all over the world. This breaks down to a massive >25 000 requests and almost 2GB of data transfer - per second, on average, constantly! We allow enterprise brands to create, publish, analyze and optimize rich media ads in-house at scale. Our mission is to become the most user-friendly platform for creative automation and campaign management - across channels.To be able to deliver this, we have to stay in the front line of technical development and always keep up with the latest tools and technologies.
 



 We advocate and work along with an agile architecture without hierarchy and bureaucracy where we work in small autonomous and cross-functional feature teams. We are a Creative Management Platform that allows companies to focus on being creative rather than spending precious time on repetitive tasks and changing the game by removing the mystery of digital marketing. We simplify complexity, challenge the status quo and as a result, we have the happiest customers in the world.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 As a Product Specialist, you work cross-functionally with customers and prospects to ensure excellent product delivery, high adoption and commercial success throughout the customer lifecycle.
 



 Product Specialists have both broad and deep knowledge about the Bannerflow platform, the pains it solves, and the value the customer gets. The role acts as a trusted advisor within the digital advertising landscape by guiding customers to success by showcasing our platform, recommending best practices in ways of working, and leading customers in technical projects.
 



  





**Daily Tasks And Responsibilities Include** 



* Master and demonstrate how the Bannerflow platform works, what value it generates and the pains it solves different personas and industries.
* Master in-depth product training sessions with existing customers and conduct value driven sales demos for prospective customers.
* Have the curiosity to over time get an in depth understanding of the Bannerflow go-to-market execution, market dynamics, product vision, and our Must Win Battles (company strategy) that support the company growth.
* Lead customer - initiated projects together with Customer Success Managers and Account Executives who primarily own the customer relationship.
* Assist with customer ad-hoc troubleshooting sessions and solve complex software issues.
* Guide customers through a perfect account setup and best practices for customers network integrations.
* The role requires a high - level understanding of the network destination (DSP).
* Contribute to product development of our platform by sharing customer insights and feedback with Product and Tech.
* Identify improvement areas for internal processes and drive initiatives related to this.



  





**Who are you?** 




 To enjoy working at Bannerflow you should be eager to learn new things and happy to take on challenges. To succeed at Bannerflow in general you need to be passionate and have a black belt in collaboration. As the Bannerflow team is constantly growing, it’s important that you embrace change and thrive in an environment where the landscape is always evolving.
 



  





**Skills** 




 We are looking for someone with skills in these areas (you might be an expert on all of these or just a few):
 


* Solution-oriented and creative mindset.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills. A listener as well as a presenter with ability to adapt communication to different personas and use industry specific terminology.
* Driven and structured problem solver.
* Previous experience from SaaS or B2B.
* An eye for design and experience from working with tools like Photoshop and Illustrator.
* Familiar with JSON and XML feeds.
* Knowledge about JavaScript, CSS and HTML.
* Experience and good understanding of digital marketing.
* Availability and flexibility to travel if needed.
* Fluent in English. It is a big bonus if you're fluent in Swedish or another language, but it's not a requirement.



  





**Why join us?** 




 We live alongside our values of Passion, Collaboration and Challenge; with many events going on at Bannerflow such as Friday beer, team activities, kick-ass inspiration webinars, health month, values week and level-up hackathons, there’s something for everyone. As a member of the Bannerflow crew, you will get the opportunity to work with a creative, enabling, and highly advanced product within a 100% cloud-based architecture. We take leadership very seriously and our leaders get extensive leadership training in order for you to get the best possible coaching and guidance in your role. Of course we offer a hybrid workplace, furthermore we offer a compensation package including pension according to ITP1, health care insurance and health allowance.

title: Säkerhetsspecialist
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Just nu söker vi en senior säkerhetsspecialist till vårt team inom CGI Public !
   

  

 Drivs du likt oss av att ligga i digitaliseringens framkant? Vill du dessutom använda denna drivkraft i en konsultroll och hjälpa våra kunder att bättre ta tillvara på digitaliseringens möjligheter?
   

  

 CGI är en global IT leverantör som levererar högkvalitativ affärsrådgivning, systemintegration och outsourcing tjänster. Vi arbetar sida vid sida med kunder för att omvandla innovation, data och teknik till framgång för dem.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som senior säkerhetsspecialist, kommer du att ansvara för att monitorera säkerhetshändelser och bland annat analysera nätverkstrafik och loggar från kunders mest kritiska nätverk och agera på ”onormala” händelser genom att göra säkerhetsbedömningar. Du kommer även att arbeta med säkerhetsincidenter genom att skapa rekomendationer till ökad säkerhet i kundernas IT-miljöer.
   

  

 I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår framförallt:
   

  

* Säkerhetsanalys och klassificera påverkan på säkerhetsincidenter
* Rapportera och utreda potentiella säkerhetsincidenter
* Rekommendera åtgärder för att stärka IT-säkerhet
* Incident respons
* Bistå vid forensisk utredning


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som senior säkerhetsspecialist söker vi dig som är problemlösare, ansvarstagande, flexibel och relationsskapande med ett brinnande intresse för IT-säkerhet och nätverk. Du trivs med att jobba både i grupp och självständigt.
   

  

 Du kan flytande svenska, både i tal och skrift, då våra kunder primärt finns inom den publika sektorn samt behärskar engelska som är CGIs koncernspråk samt har en akademisk examen som högskoleingenjör eller motsvarande civil-/master examen inom exempelvis IT-säkerhet, data IT eller nätverk, alternativt relevant erfarenhet från liknande roll.
   

  

 På grund av tjänstens karaktär kräver att du har svenskt medborgarskap då du arbetar med säkerhetsklassificerad information och samhällskritiska system.
   

  

**Vi önskar att du har erfarenhet från/inom:**
* TCP/IP
* UNIX/Linux samt Windows
* Förstår hur nätverk fungerar på protokollnivå
* Projekt inom IT-säkerhet
* Kompetens kring system- och applikationsdrift
* Meriterande med utvecklarbakgrund


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Customer Sales Service till ALSO
description:
Är du en serviceinriktad person som vill arbeta i en supporterande och administrativ roll med breda sociala kontaktytor och samarbeten? Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i Customer Sales Serviceteamet på internationella ALSO!
 



  

**Företag :**
 ALSO Sweden AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Kista
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Kundtjänst
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 40h/v
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 ALSO verkar inom teknologisektorn och distribuerar varor och tjänster inom IT och Teknik till några av Nordens största IT-bolag. De befinner sig just nu på en spännande tillväxtresa och växer kontinuerligt med nya kollegor. Företaget sitter i fräscha, ljusa lokaler i Kista. Du kommer att tillhöra Customer Sales Services och arbeta tillsammans med 15 kollegor varav 3 kollegor i samma roll.
 


  


 Customer Sales Services är en intern såväl extern stödfunktion. Som medarbetare i teamet är man företagets ansikte utåt och arbetar med breda kontaktytor – både internt och externt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett långsiktigt arbete på ett spännande, modernt och växande bolag med högt i tak och familjär stämning
  
* En öppen kultur med engagerade och hjälpsamma kollegor i blandade åldrar
  
* Arbetet är förlagt på ALSOs kontor i Kista men med viss möjlighet till distansarbete
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Ta emot inkommande samtal och mail, bland annat besvara på leveransfrågor
  
* Utringande telefonsamtal i samband med aktivitet
  
* Säljarbete i tät relation med vår säljavdelning
  
* Löpande orderläggning i SAP och bevakning av backlog samt administration däromkring
  
* Hantera omfakturering/kreditering
  
* Kundprofiler i webshop
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska såväl i tal som i skrift
  
* Har erfarenhet från ett serviceyrke med kundrelationer och/eller administrativ erfarenhet
  
* Är nyfiken och har lätt att lära och förstå nya saker
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**
 erfarenhet av försäljning, förståelse av IT-branschen samt erfarenhet i SAP.
 


  


 I den här rollen kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och din motivation för tjänsten. Vi söker dig som är serviceinriktad, lösningsorienterad och kommunikativ. Du har en positiv inställning, en nyfikenhet och driv att lära dig och för att förstå helheten i ditt arbete. Vi tror att du är en person som sprider energi och värnar om relationen till dina kollegor på kontoret.
 


  


  

**Övrig information**



  

  
* Start: Augusti
  
* Uppdrag: Långsiktigt, initialt sex månader med ambition till förlängning eller överrekrytering därefter såvida alla parter är nöjda
  
* Placering: Kista
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**ALSO Sweden AB**

 Läs mer om ALSO här!
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Lizette Wiedel eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105298

title: Junior Content Planner
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **Junior Content Planner** 
 in our
 **Stockholm office** 
 – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The role** 
  

  

 You will be joining the Central Content team for Viaplay streaming service and Pay TV based in Stockholm. This team work across all our Nordic territories and ensure we have a strong Acquisition content offering. Your role will be planning the "V film" linear premium channels and administrate our third party Viaplay streaming service platform. Ensure there is a strong and competitive schedule every week. Produce internal promotion material to create excitement around our content and schedule
   

  

* Content assessment, planning and scheduling
* Ensure all systems related to the schedule are updated
* Act as the internal point of contact for license, premiere dates, rights and
* USPs definitions for all Movie channels
* Be involved in developing and optimizing workflows and technical solutions
* Work closely with the promo scheduler to ensure the right content is prioritised for promotion
* Work closely with the Head of content around start dates, volume needs and strategic planning


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

 We are looking for a structured person who loves content. You thrive in a dynamic and high paced environment where new ideas and creative mindset are embraced. You might come from an administration role and ready to take your first step into the world of content.
   

  

* Structured and organized
* Thinking outside the box
* Positive and can do attitude
* Strong in navigating in user systems and the Office package
* Fluent in English and minimum one of the Scandinavian languages


****What** 
 we offer you**
**We’ve got you covered!** 
 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
   

  

**Your wellbeing matters.** 
 We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
   

  

**A safe space to grow and up-skill.** 
 Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
   

  

**Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do** 
 . So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including series & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
   

  

**Hit play today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Account Manager
description:
*Nu startar vi upp nytt sälj-team som ska förvalta ett samarbete med ett av Sveriges mest välkända bolag. Vår samarbetspartner arbetar med digitala tjänster inom kredit- och marknadsinformation, och dina kunder är främst chefer inom ekonomi, marknadsföring och försäljning.* 




  





**VAD INNEBÄR DIN ROLL?** 




 I rollen som Account Manager kommer du ha ditt fokus på att identifiera affärsmöjligheter och driva nyförsäljning. Du ansvarar även för den affärsmässiga relationen med kunderna i din kundportfölj vilken är en mix av små och medelstora kunder.
 



  





**VEM ÄR DU?** 




 Vi ser att du tidigare arbetat i en roll med stort kundfokus och har erfarenhet inom B2B försäljning. Du har en drivkraft som få andra och vill ta ditt nästa steg inom försäljning.
 



  





**Förutsättningar:** 



* Du har erfarenhet av att driva hela säljprocessen
* Erfarenhet inom B2B-försäljning
* Arbetat med att bygga upp egen kundportfölj
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i både tal och skrift.



  





**VAD ERBJUDER VI?** 




 Fast lön + Provision.
 



 Heltidstjänst: Mån - Fre kl. 08-17.
 



 Möjlighet till personlig och professionell utveckling genom olika utbildningar.
 



 Karriärmöjligheter inom företaget.
 



  





**IMPRESSIVE RELATIONS** 




 Vi är ett etablerat Sälj- och Bemanningsföretag, grundat 2012. Vi arbetar idag med flera stora aktörer över hela Norden, inom branscher som Bank & Finans, IT och Solenergi.
 



 Impressive Relations ser starkt på personlig utveckling och erbjuder kontinuerliga utbildningar inom försäljning. Vi ger våra medarbetare möjligheten att växa inom företaget oavsett tidigare erfarenhet.
 



  





 Vi jobbar alltid i starka team och skapar roliga arbetsdagar tillsammans.
 



**Impressive Relations utmärker sig på marknaden genom att göra ett bra jobb med goda resultat.** 
 Vi tror på en stadig tillväxt och pålitliga relationer som nyckeln till framgång. De affärsområden vi arbetar inom - Event, Bemanning och Försäljning - ger våra medarbetare en trygg grund med olika valmöjligheter inom företaget.
 



  





***Välkommen med din ansökan!***
*Vi genomför löpande urval och kan tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag. Tveka därför inte, skicka in din ansökan redan idag!* 




  





 Felicia Rullander
 *|* 
 Rekryterare
 



*076 425 35 70 | felicia.rullander@impressiverelations.se*

title: Volunteer Team Member
description:
**Private Equity Conference Volunteer** 
 (25 October)
   

  

 Do you want to expand your network with 500+ leaders, entrepreneurs, investors, limited and general partners of the Private Equity sector, plus develop your skills in leadership? Now is your chance!
   

  

 Private Equity Insights organises the largest global events enabling finance and investment innovation by connecting C-level executives, GPs and LPs, with entrepreneurs and investors. Our conferences bring together some of the most important big industry players such as Blackstone, BlackRock, Apollo, Carlyle, CVC, KKR, Permira, Oliver Wyman, Mercer, and many more.
   

  

 We offer the opportunity for students in undergraduate and graduate programmes relating to business and finance, or for people with a strong interest in the Private Equity sector, to gain exposure to these companies and expand their network through our volunteer programme.
   

  

 We are building a community where the smartest, most innovative and ambitious people can meet and create the future of private equity. With the pace of industry change increasing and the reach of new possibilities expanding, this is needed more than ever. We are looking for ambitious and talented people, who want to be a part of a team of 25+ peers and help us build, run and deliver the leading Nordics Private Equity Conference.
   

  

 Private Equity Insights would not exist without our volunteers. Simple as that. Join us and see how the world's largest Private Equity community is built – from the inside.
   

  

**Sign up below and join NPEC24 at Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel in Stockholm on the 25th October 2024! Apply on this link.**
**You can get a better sense of the conference, in our 2023 Milan's highlight video.**
**For more information please visit our website here** 
**.**
**PROFESSIONAL BENEFITS:**
* Expand your network with 500+ leaders, entrepreneurs, investors, limited and general partners of the Private Equity sector.
* Create your next business opportunity & meet your new mentor
* Develop your soft skills and receive individual training in management from the Private Equity Team
* Receive the official 2024 Private Equity Insights Volunteer Certificate


**PERSONAL BENEFITS:**
* Take part in the 2024 Private Equity Insights Workshop, along with 25+ ambitious and talented people and learn the insights of running the leading Private Equity Conference and the possibilities that this entails
* Experience the unique atmosphere of Private Equity Insights on the day of the conference.
* Gain valuable knowledge, insights, and inspiration by listening and chatting to the world's leading speakers.
* Seize the opportunity to develop your competencies in communication and learn what it takes to create the leading event in Europe.


**SOCIAL BENEFITS:**
* Create personal relationships with like-minded, hardworking professionals from the Volunteer Programme and from the Private Equity Insights team.
* Exclusive access to the official 2024 Private Equity Insights Dinner for all members of the Volunteer Programme after the event!


 The conference will take place on the 25th of October 2024 at the Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel.
   

  

 Hours to contribute: the day of the conference, plus 2h the afternoon before the event, for training session & rehearsals.

title: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Data Engineer - UT783
description:
• Design, build, and maintain data pipelines on Google Cloud Platform (GCP) using services such as BigQuery, Dataplex, Dataflow/Dataproc, Pub/Sub, Cloud Functions, Cloud Run, Cloud Scheduler and Cloud Workflows.
 



 • Develop and implement data models using dbt (data build tool) to support analytical reporting and data science needs.
 



 • Collaborate with data analysts and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into data models.
 



 • Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure high quality of data in our data warehouse.
 



 • Optimize data pipelines and data models for performance and cost efficiency.
 



 • Document and communicate data models to the wider team and train them on how to use it effectively.
 



 • Proven experience as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
 



 • Strong experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its data services such as BigQuery, Cloud Run, and Pub/Sub.
 



 • Experience in data modeling and transformation using dbt.
 



 • Knowledge of SQL and good experience with Python.

title: Bemanningsassistent till AVA
description:
På AVA, tar vi emot internmedicinska diagnoser och erbjuder skräddarsydd vård efter individuella behov. Hos oss krävs hög flexibilitet och ett varierat omvårdnadsfokus för att möta det breda spektrum av patienter vi vårdar. Förutom våra vanliga akutvårdsplatser, har vi fyra specialutrustade platser för medicinsk övervakning, där vi främst vårdar patienter med intoxikationer, kramper eller anafylaxi.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Som bemanningsassistent ansvarar du för den kort och långsiktiga personalplaneringen i nära samarbete med vårdenhetschefen och enhetsledare på avdelningen, för att kunna möta organisationens behov. Det finns även ett samarbete med övriga bemannings-assistenter på Intern Medicins avdelningar. Du är ansvarig för schemaarbetet och dessa ska byggas utifrån lagar, avtal och riktlinjer. Du ansvarar för att schemaläggningen registreras i Heroma.
   

  

 Du kommer även få sköta den dagliga rapporteringen som att fastställa ledigheter, rätta flex, sjuk- och friskanmälan med mera i vårt personaladministrativa system Heroma.
   

  

 Du kommer att ha ha en viktig del i att säkerställa att våra medarbetare är väl introducerade och utbildade i användningen av Heroma självservice. Det är avgörande för oss att varje medarbetare kan hantera systemet självständigt och effektivt, och din roll kommer att vara central för att uppnå detta mål.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Som bemanningsansvarig är det även viktigt att du har god kommunikativ förmåga och är serviceinriktad då medarbetare främst vänder sig till dig gällande schema och planering. För att trivas i rollen är det även viktigt att du är flexibel och har lätt för att anpassa dig till förändrade omständigheter. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Därför söker vi en person som är ansvarsfull, engagerad och trivs med att arbeta i team.
   

  

**Kompetenskrav**
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att ha arbetat som bemanningsassistent, alternativt annan administrativ likvärdig tjänst.
* God IT vana och kan arbeta utifrån organisatoriska mål.
* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska, i både tal och skrift.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av arbete med schema- och lönesystem Heroma.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med Medlo


**Erbjudande**
 Våra medarbetare är vår viktigaste resurs och därför månar vi om att du ska ha ett utvecklande, tryggt och hållbart arbetsliv. Vi erbjuder många olika förmåner och fördelar oavsett var du befinner dig i livet och i karriären. Några av dessa förmåner är:
   

  

* Vidareutbildning. Vi erbjuder regelbundna, kompetenshöjande aktiviteter utifrån medarbetarens och verksamhetens behov.
* Ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag
* Personalgym och hälsoteam med fysioterapeuter, ergonomer och hälsopedagoger som kan stötta dig i din träning.
* Föräldrapenningtillägg och föräldralön.


 Läs mer om vårt erbjudande här
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Södersjukhuset tillämpar kontroll i belastningsregistret före beslut om anställning. I denna rekrytering arbetar vi med löpande med urval och intervjuer.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Läs mer här om hur det är att arbeta inom Region Stockholm.
   

  

 Södersjukhuset är ett av Nordens största akutsjukhus. Akutsjukvården står i centrum och utgör tillsammans med de stora folksjukdomarna vår specialitet. Vi har även en av Sveriges största förlossningskliniker. Hos oss arbetar cirka 5000 medarbetare. Vi bedriver omfattande klinisk forskning och utbildning och för oss är det viktigt att kombinera det stora sjukhusets möjligheter med den nära och personliga patientkontakten. Vår vision är att vara Sveriges ledande akutsjukhus.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/3800 | Kontakt: Anna Sennerö 08-12361000, | Facklig företrädare: Kommunal 0812361683, | Publicerat: 2024-06-12 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-07-12

title: SAP Training Coordinator - Based in Sweden - 6 month contract
description:
Our client is currently undergoing a digital transformation from SAP ECC6 to S/4HANA therefore looking to engage with SAP Training Coordinator.
   

  

**Tasks**
* Support business resources in creating and implementing training in end-to-end processes
* Coordinate rehearsal of training
* Assist in planning training sessions
* Training Administration


**Background**
* Experience in the creation and implementation of end-user training
* Experience from ERP/SAP implementation
* Experience from project work
* Very good communication skills, teaching skills & technical understanding
* MUST speak fluent Swedish & English


**SAP Training Coordinator - Based in Sweden - 6 month contract**
 bluewaveSELECT is a global recruitment business that is exclusively focused on SAP. Involved in placing over 4,000 SAP professionals, our team has helped deliver some of the highest-profile SAP programmes for some of the most recognisable brands all over of the world. We are on a mission is to become the world's most trusted SAP recruitment business, delivering our unique wow factor by consistently exceeding expectations for both our customers and our network of SAP professionals. We are an official SAP partner, you will find us on the Ariba Network and we have a 5-Star approval rating on TrustPilot from fellow SAP enthusiasts. Whether this will be your first experience with us, or you are a bluewaveSELECT regular, we look forward to working with you!
   

  

 Disclaimer; We try and contact all applicants to every advert however due to volumes of responses with some adverts we may not be able to get back to you in some cases. If this is the case and you do not hear from us within 5 working days please take it that your application has been unsuccessful. Please note, your profile will be rejected if you do not meet language/legislation criteria. Thank you

title: Senior IT Analyst for Model Development Programme working with Credit Risk
description:
**Job ID: 22507**
 Would you like to work in an agile, friendly and international environment in close collaboration with our business teams and at the same time grow your IT analyst talent? If yes, then this opportunity is for you. We are now looking for a Senior IT Analyst, who will support our team in the Model Development Programme working with Credit Risk.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 Welcome to the Model Development Programme in Group Functions Technology. We add value by translating business needs to operational software requirements and verify their validity and priority. We actively contribute to the collaboration between business and IT and drive requirement engineering work by making an effort in understanding both parts.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Working with technical requirement specifications in close collaboration with business analysts, IT architects and developers
* Collaborating with multiple stakeholders in alignment with the target picture to enable sustainable and reliable solutions
* Securing requirements traceability during the end-to-end development
* In cooperation with our end users ensuring that the application is continuously configured to match the changing business needs, and to ensure smooth upstream and downstream processes
* Ensuring that applications are updated according to internal guidelines and other infrastructure changes
* Facilitating understanding and impact of requirements, functional as well as non-functional, from business to technology and vice versa



  

  



 You’ll join a team where people are the most important and work is not only a place to go! We take pride in what we do, prioritize a learning culture and strive to have fun in our daily work. The role is based in Gdańsk or Warsaw with hybrid approach.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Are a self-driven team player
* Have excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, and enjoy interactions with other people
* Have good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Have a good business or technical background with great analytical skills
* Have good requirement elicitation skills (functional and non-functional requirements)
* Should be able to understand the business terminologies and act as a very good interface between Business and IT development team
* Have a foundational understanding of programming, so you are able to read it
* Are familiar with agile ways of working and methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban)
* Are able to find or create order in complex and chaotic processes
* Are structured and with your analytical mindset be able to handle complexity, be creative and curious
* Should be able to support in UT, ST and end-to-end UAT testing
* Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* 5 years experience in IT /Data Analysis
* Knowledge of Credit Risk and more specifically Risk Models
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills
* Well versed and comfortable working with large datasets
* Profound experience in doing data analysis using SQL
* Added advantage to have Functional background around Credit Risk
* Knowing SAS/Python is an added advantage



  
 





 It is not a must that you can put a check mark to everything in the above lists, but you should be willing to proactively learn the rest.
 





  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 01/08/2024
 



 .
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden only -** 
  For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Poland only -** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.
 





  
 





 #Mid-Senior

title: Oracle Cloud EPM Specialist
description:
Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for an
 **Oracle Cloud EPM Specialist** 
 to join the team to build, support and drive customer innovations, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule.
 



 In alignment with Avigna’s values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
 



  





**Role:Oracle Cloud EPM Specialist** 




 Seniority level: Senior
 



 Mode : Onsite
 



 Location: India (who is willing to move to Sweden)
 



  





**Responsibility** 



* Excellent function skills in Implementing Account reconciliation Cloud, Design, Configuration and Testing
* Customer facing skills
* Providing process consulting
* Having proficiency in business process understanding, conceptualization, Documentation
* Develop testing scenario, Test scripts, leading teams in unit, integration, and acceptance testing
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues with a strong analytical and debugging approach.
* Provide process consulting to clients, ensuring alignment with best practices.
* Demonstrate strong communication skills in customer-facing interactions.
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions.
* Customer facing skills
* Minimum of 6 years of functional experience with ARCS.
* Familiarity with Oracle Cloud EPM suite and its integration capabilities with other Oracle cloud applications.
* Knowledge of finance modules such as AP, AR, SL, and projects would be advantageous.

title: Project Team Manager
description:
**Nu vill vi stärka vårt team med ytterligare en Team manager!** 




**På landets snabbast växande** 
 kontor söker vi en kollega som ska leda och utveckla en grupp härliga systemutvecklare samt bidra med kunskap inom intressanta projekt. Detta är en nyckelroll som ska bidra till vår plan att vara en champion inom automationsbranschen!
 



  





*”Vi står mitt i sommaren snart -Stockholmskontoret blommar precis som vår fina natur. Efter att ha vunnit förtroende att leverera våra tjänster genom flera stora och viktiga avtal ser vi det som en naturlig följd att förstärka vår organisation med nya kollegor. Med denna tillsättning ser vi till att säkerställa ett bra ledarskap för att kunna fokusera på ytterligare utveckling. Du kommer att ingå i en grupp med fullt fokus på att leverera det bästa för våra kunder. På Sveriges snabbast växande kontor där vi alltid tävlar om nya anledningar att fira tillsammans med våra kollegor. Välkommen att bli en del av INIT Swedens Stockholmskontor"- Roger Löfgren, Business Unit Manager* 




  





**Om rollen:** 




 Rollen är en kombinationsroll, vilket innebär att du ofta också är en projektledare, men kan också vara t ex en Affärsutvecklare.
 



  




* Du kommer att ingå i ett engagerat och inspirerande team som tillsammans leder kontoret i Göteborg. Du har
 **personalansvar** 
 (rekrytering av systemutvecklare, medarbetar- och utvecklingssamtal och lönejusteringar) för dina medarbetare likväl som ansvar för ditt
 **projekts framfart** 
 . Dina ledaregenskaper kommer komma väl till hands i rollen som team manager som i projektledningen.
* Du säkerställer att vi levererar det vi lovat i rätt tid, med rätt kvalitetskrav till rätt budget. Storleken på projekten kan vara allt ifrån mindre eftermarknadsprojekt till stora projekt för prestigefulla kunder.
* I rollen ser du även potentiella
 **affärsmöjligheter** 
 och deltar i anbudsarbetet. Du kommer att kunna bidra till att generera nya projekt, och är även delaktig i merförsäljningen i befintliga projekt. Vi arbetar med ett projektverktyg som följer vår projektprocess - som du använder som hjälpmedel i din vardag.



  





**Vi söker dig:** 




  





 Som är en erfaren projektledare/teamledare inom
 **automation** 
 och har ett
 **naturligt engagemang** 
 för att motivera, engagera samt säkerställa kvaliteten i varje steg av processen. Du har god förmåga att skapa förtroendegivande relationer, både internt och externt. Du är en naturlig ledare som är prestigelös och ödmjuk i ditt sätt.
 


* Kvalifikationer bör inkludera
 **+5års arbete med automation**
* Erfarenhet av att leda projekt inom installation, infrastruktur eller industri där tjänst, material, underkonsulter och/eller underentreprenörer kombineras
* Erfarenhet av att leda entreprenadprojekt, både löpande och fasta avtal/projektleveranser inom privat eller offentlig sektor
* Erfarenhet av budget - och resultatansvar
* Vana att arbeta mot uppsatta KPI:er
* Branschkännedom
* Tidigare erfarenhet av personalledning är högt meriterande.
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska flytande, samt är svensk medborgare



  





**Du blir en del av** 




  





 En väldigt spännande resa när vi tillsammans med ett tiotal andra bolag nu bygger
 **Nordens största automationshus!** 




  





 Vi har en ambition att samla de bästa företagen – och människorna – inom industriell IT och automation med en total omsättning på 500 miljoner DKK och snart 700 anställda i Danmark, Sverige, Norge, Serbien och Spanien, som är specialister inom industriell IT, automation, IOT och OT cybersäkerhet.
 



  




* Ett företag med en tydlig och kontrollerad tillväxtstrategi
* Goda karriärmöjligheter med professionella, inspirerande och innovativa miljöer med plats för nörderi och professionell utveckling.
* Ett företag som stöttar ditt specialområde



 Vi tror att bra arbete kommer från glada och motiverade människor. Det är därför vi lägger lika mycket kraft på att ge dig en rolig, säker och inkluderande arbetsmiljö som vi gör på att utveckla dina professionella förmågor. Oavsett om det handlar om sociala evenemang eller balans mellan arbete och privatliv gör vi allt vi kan för att göra Init till en positiv del av ditt liv.
 



  





**Placeringsort;** 
 Stockholm, Liljeholmen
 



**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



**Närmaste ledare:** 
 Roger Löfgren, Business Unit manager
 



**Vad händer efter att du har skickat in din ansökan?** 




  





 Vi läser ansökningar och träffar kandidater löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vid frågor, kontakta mig, Rekryterare, Sara Rensfeldt Romin, på sara.rensfeldt@initgroup.com
 



 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! #Init2winit

title: Spanish Speaking Account Manager
description:
Do you have knowledge of computer hardware, such as the differences between a CPU, RAM, SSD, and HDD? Are you proficient in Spanish and English and comfortable with cold calling companies and speaking with new people over the phone?
 



 Then you might be the person we are looking for!
 



  





 Inrego is a company with clear values and a corporate culture characterized by constant development, openness, and innovation. Our vision is to become the largest in Europe, and we are well on our way.
 



  





  





**About the role** 




  





 As an Spanish Speaking Account Manager in Inrego's international division, you will conduct B2B business and build long-term relationships with international customers and partners in over 90 countries. You will be responsible for the entire sales process, including negotiation, logistics, administration in our systems, closing deals, following up on sales, and RMA management with customers.
 



 Our international division currently consists of 8 people from 8 different nationalities, speaking 8 different languages, with an age range of 23-45 years. All internal meetings for our division are conducted in English.
 



 Initially, your work will largely involve acquiring new customers in both new and existing markets. The long-term goal is to manage approximately 20-30 accounts with a turnover of 3.5-4 million Euros per year.
 



 You will be part of an experienced team, which is the market leader, and as the new Account Manager, you will be assigned a sponsor who will support and advise you during the initial period. Our team works from our offices in Täby, Sweden, three days per week.
 



  





**Your profile** 




  




* Knowledge of computer hardware, for example, what HDD, RAM, and SSD are
* Ability to work independently and take your own initiatives
* Basic knowledge of Excel
* Proficiency in Spanish & English, both spoken and written
* Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively
* Sensitivity to customers' needs and a willingness to help
* Experience in sales is a merit



  





**Additional Information** 




 Selection and interviews are conducted continuously.
 



**Scope:** 
 Full-time, permanent position (probationary employment applies)
 



**Start Date:** 
 Immediate, according to agreement
 



  





**About Us** 




  





 Inrego has been around for over 25 years and has a drive to transform the world's IT consumption into a sustainable one. We are an agile company with short decision-making processes and a culture where we solve problems and seize opportunities horizontally rather than vertically. If you enjoy being able to influence and change, and are passionate about promoting reuse in society, this role is perfect for you!
 



 We welcome employees who are driven by an interest in our vision and who can identify with our co
 **re values: Upstanding, Happy Eyes** 
 , Big
 **Heart and** 
 Strong Will. Together, we make a
 



 difference!
 



 Today, we have about 170 employees with offices in Täby, Stockholm, and Helsinki.
 



  





 For more information about us, please visit our website.

title: Operations Associate (Courier Communications)
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you a detail-oriented team player with excellent written communication skills in both Swedish and in English? Do you enjoy working in a highly-dynamic environment across countries? Are you passionate about helping others, and want to be a key player in ensuring the best in the world experience and communication for our Courier Partners in the Northern region of Europe? If this sounds like you, we'd love to chat!
   

  

**Role background**
 Our Courier Experience Team is responsible for maintaining and developing the co-operation with thousands of Courier Partners in Sweden. As an Operations Associate in Courier Communications you’d be responsible for making sure our Courier Partners and Courier Partner applicants get the help they deserve and have the best possible experience with Wolt. This includes for example helping to start their cooperation with Wolt in the best way possible by focusing on their questions, feedback, concerns, answering messages, updating information and helping Courier Partners make the most out of their partnership with Wolt. You will also focus on creating outgoing communications from the Delivery Operations team and ensuring it is of the highest quality!
   

  

 In this role, no day is the same and there’s always something to do. As such, you need to be adaptable, self-motivated and driven to succeed. You must also have excellent interpersonal skills and a big heart - we think people first at all times!
   

  

 What you'll be doing
   

  

* Creating, translating and reviewing outbound messages to Courier Partners in both English and Swedish
* Helping Courier Partners with a wide range of questions that are related to entrepreneurship and cooperation with Wolt (while Wolt Support helps Courier Partners with live deliveries related questions)
* Supporting the Operations team with development projects (for example translating content about sustainability measures and e-vehicles, or new product safety features)
* Coordinating the outgoing communications such as newsletters from the Operations team to Courier Partners
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams, investigating and evaluating individual cases to ensure top-notch service standards
* Sharing development ideas within the Operations team and with other teams at Wolt (such as Support, Marketing, Restaurant, Retail and Product)
* Handle day-to-day escalated issues in our various inboxes via email or other messages systems


**Our humble expectations**
* You have excellent interpersonal skills - you will be working with awesome people from diverse backgrounds across countries in the northern region of Europe (Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, Iceland, Luxembourg and the Baltics)
* You are strong at working with communications and creating written content and visuals
* You have excellent or native-level proficiency in both verbal and written English and Swedish
* You are detail-oriented and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
* You preferably have experience in customer service or similar and are keen to solve problems
* You are tech savvy and a quick learner
* You are based in Stockholm, Sweden - and will be working at our HQ and with the possibility for some home/remote work
* You have a can-do attitude and are ready to roll up your sleeves and get to work in a fast-paced high growth environment
* Bonus skill: you are strong at working with data and basic tools (such as Google Sheets) - or outbound tools such as Intercom or Iterable/Taxi


**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants) and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 29 countries today, 25 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.
   

  

 We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.
   

  

 Join us today to build Wolt together.

title: Electrical Design Engineer
description:
Alfa Laval in Tumba is looking for a
   

  

**Electrical Design Engineer**
*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping.*
*As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*
**About The Job**
 As part of the Automation Development team, you will help develop advanced control systems and IoT solutions for Alfa Laval core products. You will design and maintain automation systems in an Agile environment throughout the product lifecycle. Your key responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Electrical design of automation control panels
* Performing technical calculations, creating documentation, and writing test instructions
* Managing product specifications in our PDM system
* Utilizing tools such as ePlan Electric P8, Pro Panel, Inventor, Cogineer/eBuild, Team Center, etc.
* Reviewing customer requirement inputs
* Planning design activities
* Conducting quality reviews
* Developing modularized designs and specifications
* Collaborating with cross-site teams in our competence area
* Continuously engaging in department development to improve processes and quality


**Who You Are**
 As a professional, you have an agile mindset and a strong desire to learn. You enjoy using collaborative tools and working with people from different countries. You thrive in a vibrant workspace where knowledge sharing, teamwork, and digital face-to-face interactions are valued. You have a high degree of cross-cultural awareness and are eager to contribute to our team.
   

  

 You Are Detail-oriented And Capable Of Creating Precise Specifications. You Are Result-oriented, Eager, And Curious With a Strong Willingness To Learn. You Are Proactive, Self-driven, And Able To Work Independently. You Have a Keen Interest In The Electrical Field And Understand How Electrical Systems Integrate. Additionally, You Understand Machinery Design, Electrical Construction, CE-marking, CE Compliance, And Machine Safety In Construction. Furthermore, We Expect You To Have
   

  

* A degree in Electrical or Instrumentation Engineering.
* Experience in electrical design
* Experience with electrical design for machines following relevant CE requirements like EN ISO 60204-1
* Skills in conducting risk assessments
* Experience with safety design following EN ISO 13849
* Practical experience in electrical/instrumentation, sensors and measurements, and fault tracing
* Experience in marine approval, verification, and relevant documentation
* Project management experience
* Fluency in written and spoken English.


**What’s in it for you?**
 We offer a challenging position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value for our customers. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success.
   

  

**For more information, please contact**
 Morgan Bengtsson, Electrical & Compliance manager, Core Automation, morgan.bengtsson@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Richa Sethi, Talent Acquisition Partner, richa.sethi@alfalaval.com
   

  

**Union Information**
 Anders Jansson, Unionen, anders.jansson@alfalaval.com
   

  

 Francisco Garcia, Akademikerna, francisco.garcia@alfalaval.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application no later than
 **July 7th, 2024,** 
 through our career page https://career.alfalaval.com/jobs/search
   

  

 Interviews will be conducted on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to please submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

*We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.*

title: Event Assistant (volunteer)
description:
**Private Equity Conference Volunteer** 
 (25 October)
   

  

 Do you want to expand your network with 500+ leaders, entrepreneurs, investors, limited and general partners of the Private Equity sector, plus develop your skills in leadership? Now is your chance!
   

  

 Private Equity Insights organises the largest global events enabling finance and investment innovation by connecting C-level executives, GPs and LPs, with entrepreneurs and investors. Our conferences bring together some of the most important big industry players such as Blackstone, BlackRock, Apollo, Carlyle, CVC, KKR, Permira, Oliver Wyman, Mercer, and many more.
   

  

 We offer the opportunity for students in undergraduate and graduate programmes relating to business and finance, or for people with a strong interest in the Private Equity sector, to gain exposure to these companies and expand their network through our volunteer programme.
   

  

 We are building a community where the smartest, most innovative and ambitious people can meet and create the future of private equity. With the pace of industry change increasing and the reach of new possibilities expanding, this is needed more than ever. We are looking for ambitious and talented people, who want to be a part of a team of 25+ peers and help us build, run and deliver the leading Nordics Private Equity Conference.
   

  

 Private Equity Insights would not exist without our volunteers. Simple as that. Join us and see how the world's largest Private Equity community is built – from the inside.
   

  

**Sign up below and join NPEC24 at Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel in Stockholm on the 25th October 2024! Apply on this link.**
**You can get a better sense of the conference, in our 2023 Milan's highlight video.**
**For more information please visit our website here** 
**.**
**PROFESSIONAL BENEFITS:**
* Expand your network with 500+ leaders, entrepreneurs, investors, limited and general partners of the Private Equity sector.
* Create your next business opportunity & meet your new mentor
* Develop your soft skills and receive individual training in management from the Private Equity Team
* Receive the official 2024 Private Equity Insights Volunteer Certificate


**PERSONAL BENEFITS:**
* Take part in the 2024 Private Equity Insights Workshop, along with 25+ ambitious and talented people and learn the insights of running the leading Private Equity Conference and the possibilities that this entails
* Experience the unique atmosphere of Private Equity Insights on the day of the conference.
* Gain valuable knowledge, insights, and inspiration by listening and chatting to the world's leading speakers.
* Seize the opportunity to develop your competencies in communication and learn what it takes to create the leading event in Europe.


**SOCIAL BENEFITS:**
* Create personal relationships with like-minded, hardworking professionals from the Volunteer Programme and from the Private Equity Insights team.
* Exclusive access to the official 2024 Private Equity Insights Dinner for all members of the Volunteer Programme after the event!


 The conference will take place on the 25th of October 2024 at the Radisson Blu Waterfront Hotel.
   

  

 Hours to contribute: the day of the conference, plus 2h the afternoon before the event, for training session & rehearsals.

title: Senior Account Manager(Swedish speaking)
description:
**Company Description**
 Freshworks makes it fast and easy for businesses to delight their customers and employees. We do this by taking a fresh approach to building and delivering software that is affordable, quick to implement, and designed for the end user. Headquartered in San Mateo, California, Freshworks has a global team operating from 13 global locations to serve more than 65,000 companies -- from startups to public companies – that rely on Freshworks software-as-a-service to enable a better customer experience (CRM, CX) and employee experience (ITSM).
   

  

 Freshworks’ cloud-based software suite includes Freshdesk (omni-channel customer support), Freshsales (sales automation), Freshmarketer (marketing automation), Freshservice (IT service desk), Freshchat (AI-powered bots), supported by Neo, our underlying platform of shared services.
   

  

 Freshworks is featured in global national press including CNBC, Forbes, Fortune, Bloomberg and has been a BuiltIn Best Place to work in San Francisco and Denver for the last 3 years. Our customer ratings have earned Freshworks products TrustRadius Top Rated Software ratings and G2 Best of Awards for Best Feature Set, Best Value for the Price and Best Relationship.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Senior Account Manager at Freshworks, you’ll be responsible for driving sales into existing defined accounts in the
 **Nordics** 
 region. Your accounts will all have strategic importance to the growth of the region. You will collaborate with teams across Freshworks to manage all aspects of the sales process including business development, lead management, qualification, evaluation, and closing. You will advocate multiple Freshworks product lines and as a brand ambassador, you will champion our innovative Software-as-a-Service products to make organizations more productive, efficient, and customer-oriented.
   

  

**Your Role and Responsibilities:**
* Along with your manager, define and execute plans for your accounts, and then exceed your sales goals through stakeholder mapping, prospecting, qualifying, and closing opportunities
* Develop and manage your sales pipeline, by assessing and moving many activities simultaneously
* Grow, manage, and track customer contact and install base within your accounts
* Act as a guide and strategic partner to your accounts by becoming intimately knowledgeable about their key business challenges
* Partner closely with Customers Success Managers on your accounts in the ‘Pod’ structure with a focus on both retention and growth of customer portfolio. Leverage insight and product adoption knowledge shared by CSMs to target growth opportunities in your accounts.
* Use resources effectively, including MRE, SDR, Pre-Sales, Support, Project Managers, and Product Marketing Managers to meet your sales goals
* Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecasting
* Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues, and products
* Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care
* Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts as and when required


**Qualifications**
* 5-8 years of sales experience; preferably in an Account Manager role in a high-velocity software sales environment. Domain knowledge in the field of SaaS, CSM, CRM, or ITSM is advantageous
* You have a desire, even an obsession, to bring new teams into the Freshworks world to maximize revenue. You are a Farmer and a Closer at heart
* Showed consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory selling a technical product
* Highly driven individual with an execution focus a strong sense of urgency and a belief in the Freshworks mission. Able to go beyond relationship management
* Customer-oriented, extraordinary communication skills, eagerness to learn, and consultancy skills to understand our customers and to best support them
* Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful
* Fluent in English and Swedish. Proficiency in multiple Nordics languages is a plus.


**Additional Information**
 At Freshworks, we are creating a global workplace that enables everyone to find their true potential, purpose, and passion irrespective of their background, gender, race, sexual orientation, religion and ethnicity. We are committed to providing equal opportunity for all and believe that diversity in the workplace creates a more vibrant, richer work environment that advances the goals of our employees, communities and the business.

title: Junior Project Manager Internship (Swedish & English)
description:
**Join Adam and Revolutionize the Painting Industry!** 




  





**About Us:** 

 Adam is a fast-growing Czech startup with a mission to provide affordable and straightforward construction and renovation services. Led by founders who previously helped build one of the largest and fastest-growing technology companies in Europe, Adam is already active in more than 10 European countries! Our vision is to expand to more markets, add more trades, and become the next European unicorn. Do you want to be part of it?
 




  





**The Opportunity:** 

 We are looking for a talented and ambitious student to help us launch and build the entire market in Sweden. This is a unique chance to gain hands-on experience in marketing, legal, recruitment, and day-to-day business operations. If you aspire to one day run your own business or manage a large department, Adam is the place for you.
 




  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Market Launch:** 

 Help to build the Swedish market from scratch.
* **Support Business Processes:** 

 Assist in all of Adam's business processes.
* **Trend Response:** 

 React quickly to market trends and manage a growing number of orders.
* **Strategy Development:** 

 Develop and implement new expansion strategies within Sweden.
* **Customer Communication:** 

 Engage with customers and partners.
* **Product Improvement:** 

 Continuously improve our product in line with Adam's value proposition.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* **Education:** 

 Students who have completed at least their 1st year of university. Opportunities for full-time positions for top performers.
* **Internship Duration:** 

 Minimum of 3 months.
* **Language Skills:** 

 Excellent written and spoken Swedish and English skills (full professional proficiency). Other languages are a plus but not required.
* **Skills:** 

 Excellent communication skills, a data-driven analytical mindset, and a hustler's attitude who doesn't stop after facing multiple obstacles.



  





**Why You'll Love It Here:** 



* **Compensation:** 

 Paid internship for top students, working with a young, talented team.
* **Experience:** 

 Internship at a startup that has expanded to over 10 countries in the last 6 months.
* **Language Skills:** 

 Greatly improve your language skills through daily work in Swedish and English.
* **Innovative Work:** 

 Work on an innovative product transforming traditional industries, with excellent feedback from customers.
* **Work Culture:** 

 No corporate manners. We believe in having fun at work and expect the same from you!
* **Future Opportunities:** 

 Prepare for future internships or potentially join us full-time.



  





**Meet Our Team:** 

 Check us out on Instagram:
 
 @team\_of\_adam
 



  





**Read More About Us:** 



* Businessplus
* Forbes
* CC



  





**Interested? Send your resume to us now!**
