Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.


*Den här rekryteringen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför samtal och mail från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.*


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan till oss!** #LI-HYBRID#

description:

Must be AZ-104 certified. AZ-500, AZ-400 will be added advantage

title: QA Manager
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging the status quo in the property management industry. We're committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our cloud-based platform is unique, and we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player in a brief time. Our global product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?  

  



**About the role**  

  



We are looking for a technically skilled QA Manager to join an expanding Productivity team. The team works with QA, DevOps and SRE across different markets. As a QA Manager, you will play a crucial role in our software engineering process, ensuring that our processes for delivery of software meet the highest standards of quality. You will work closely with QA specialists, reporting to you, and other stakeholders. The QA specialists are currently working in a number of agile development teams across Odevo’s products.


Your expertise in quality and software engineering will be crucial as Odevo increases its global footprint. ile development teams across Odevo’s products.


Your key responsibilities will include:

* Lead and mentor Odevo’s QA professionals, fostering a collaborative and high-performance work environment.
* Manage QA teams across value streams, ensuring consistency and alignment in QA practices.
* Conduct regular one-on-one meetings, performance reviews, and career development sessions with QA professionals.
* Develop and implement a comprehensive QA strategy that aligns with the company’s overall objectives and product roadmaps.
* Collaborate with product managers/leads/owners, developers, and other stakeholders to define QA objectives, priorities, and deliverables.
* Create and maintain a QA roadmap, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery of all QA activities.
* Continuously evaluate and improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Implement best practices in automated testing, manual testing, and other QA activities.
* Drive initiatives for improving test coverage, reducing defects, and enhancing product quality.
* Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between QA teams and other departments, such as development, DevOps, and product management.
* Act as the primary point of contact for all QA-related matters, ensuring timely resolution of issues and clear communication of QA activities.
* Promote a culture of quality and continuous improvement within the QA teams and the broader organization.
* Allocate QA resources effectively across projects and products, balancing workloads and priorities.
* Identify and address skill gaps within the QA team, providing training and development opportunities as needed.

**Who you are**

You are a coaching leader with the ability to motivate and inspire a team. Collaboration is a key aspect of our organization, and we are looking for someone who can thrive while working harmoniously across departments and engaging with stakeholders at all levels. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas and concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


A good eye for details is crucial in ensuring that our products meet our quality standards. Furthermore, experience in a fast-paced, high-growth environment will be highly regarded, as it demonstrates the ability to thrive in dynamic settings.  

  



**Experience**

  

* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* You have at least five years of experience as a QA Manager or a similar role.
* Solid understanding of software engineering methodologies and CI/CD.
* Experience with coaching and developing team members.
* Knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
* Experience working with E2E test automation, for example, Playwright or Cypress.
* Knowledge of at least one programming language.

**What we offer**


* Remote friendly - you'll be part of a team that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.  
* 

**Location**


Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.  

  



**Excited?**

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.  

  



Why we formed Odevo  

About Odevo
  

Our Software

title: Technical Specialist
description:
Avigna is hiring for **Technical Specialist****.**


Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for **Technical Specialist** to join the team to build, support and drive customer innovations and workflow improvements, bringing efficiency to the processes through efficient management of cost and schedule. If you want to grow and build the foundation on the IT platform working across multiple customers, look no further.


In alignment with Aviana's values, we are committed to providing an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.  

  



Experience: 5 to 8 years


Location: Gävle.


Mode of work: Hybrid


Contract duration: 6 months


Responsibilities:

  

* Operate and maintain the technical platform, including monitoring, logging, backup, and capacity planning.
* Implement or upgrade engineering/functionality, participating in System Testing, Factory Acceptance Test, or Site Acceptance Test.
* Maintain and support IT infrastructure, ensuring updates align with policies and supplier specifications.
* Manage incidents, requests, and problems by investigating, solving, performing status updates, and documenting solutions remotely and onsite.
* Expert on Design, configure, install, and upgrade hardware and software.
* Evaluate new technologies and methods.
* Implement and support system integration between platforms, operating systems, networks, applications, and production equipment.
* Create and maintain standard operating procedures.
* Perform capacity planning, resource optimization, and lifecycle management.
* Follow established processes and instructions, contributing to applicable Service Level Agreements.
* Suggest and contribute to continuous service improvements.
* Coordinate activities and projects.
* Perform knowledge sharing within the organization, including colleagues, Systems Developers, Service Desk, Operators, and other groups locally and globally.

**Required Skills:**

* SharePoint farm administration
* Windows Server administration
* Experience with Azure IaaS & PaaS
* Infra as Code for Azure – ARM (Azure Resource Manager)
* Experience with Agile/SCRUM methodologies
* Networking concepts (DNS, Firewalls, etc.)
* PowerShell scripting
* Azure DevOps

**Nice to Have Skills:**

* SQL
* Big-IP (F5 Networks' application delivery controller technology


**What we offer:**


Access to a strong developer community within the company to learn and grow. Competitive Salary, Good work-life balance along with health and life insurance.

title: Agil produktägare (PO)
description:
Vill du vara med och bidra till att skapa Sveriges bästa hälso-och sjukvård och ett hållbart samhälle med tillväxt i hela Västra Götaland? Västra Götalandsregionen är Sveriges största offentliga arbetsgivare med ambitionen att bli Sveriges bästa offentliga arbetsgivare. Hos oss får du chansen att utföra ett meningsfullt arbete för samhället och bidra till Västra Götalandsregionens vision ”det goda livet”. På Koncernkontoret arbetar vi dagligen med att göra skillnad för patienter, medarbetare, besökare och invånare.


I Sverige har vi en lång tradition av att använda kvalitetsregister för kvalitetssäkring och utveckling av vårdens kvalitet. Det finns ungefär 100 nationella kvalitetsregister som finansieras av regionerna och staten. Registercentrum Västra Götaland är ett av landets sex registercentrum. Ungefär vart fjärde kvalitetsregister i Sverige är anslutet till oss.


Nu söker vi en produktägare som drivs av att varje patient ska erbjudas bästa möjliga vård. Som produktägare är du spindeln i nätet mellan vårdprofessionen och tjänsteleverantörer inom IT, statistik och kommunikation. Ta chansen och sök dig till en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare.

**Ditt uppdrag**

  

Rollen som produktägare är bred och varierande och har både ett operativt och strategiskt fokus. Du jobbar med flera register och översätter behov från vårdprofessionen till en specifikation till IT- och statistikmedarbetare. Arbetet infattar förvaltning och utveckling av nationella kvalitetsregister genom kravhantering, projektledning av stora och små projekt, prioriteringsarbete, driftshantering och felsökning. Informationssäkerhet är en stor del av vardagen och uppdraget innefattar utredning av juridiska begränsningar och möjligheter.


Produktägare är en kommunikativ roll med många kontaktytor, såväl internt med kollegor inom regionen som externt med vårdprofession, nätverk och andra intressenter. Det ingår administrativa uppgifter som till exempel mötesadministration och dokumentation.


Som product owner kommer du att ha en central och viktig roll i den agila leveransmodellen SCRUM som kommer att implementeras på Registercentrum under hösten.

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**


På Registercentrum Västra Götaland drivs vi av viljan att förbättra vården. Målet är bättre hälsa och längre liv för patienterna och bättre utnyttjande av sjukvårdens resurser. Du får arbeta tillsammans med engagerade och kompetenta kollegor och det finns goda möjligheter till egen utveckling. Västra Götalandsregionen erbjuder flexibla arbetsformer utifrån verksamhetens förutsättningar. Huvudsakliga arbetsplatsen är på Medicinaregatan 18G i Göteborg. Det finns möjlighet att jobba på distans under en del av arbetstiden efter överenskommelse.

**För att lyckas i rollen behöver du:**

Kvalifikationer:

* Erfarenhet av projekt- och utvecklingsarbete.
* Utbildning på högskolenivå inom relevant område.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med IT-strategiska frågor.
* Kunskaper inom statistik.
* Förmåga att ta in och förhålla sig till flera olika perspektiv. Exempelvis ledningens, leveransteamets och vårdprofessionens perspektiv.
* Förmåga att förstå och företräda vårdens behov och önskemål.
* Förmåga att fatta klara och välgrundade beslut för att optimera produkten.
* Uttrycka tydliga krav och mål till utvecklingsteamet och intressenter.
* Förmåga att rangordna och välja vilka funktioner som ska utvecklas först.
* Förmåga att både jobba självständigt och att samarbeta i olika gruppkonstellationer, beroende på situation och behov.
* Behärska svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
* Goda kunskaper i Word, Excel, Powerpoint och Microsoft Teams.

**Vi ser det meriterande om du har:**

* Erfarenhet av arbete med kvalitetsregister.
* Erfarenhet av SCRUM.
* Erfarenhet av Azure DevOps.
* Erfarenhet av kvalitetsarbete inom hälso- och sjukvård.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom sjukvårdens kunskapsstyrning, både regionalt och nationellt.
* Erfarenhet av offentlig förvaltning.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Du är strukturerad och lösningsorienterad. Du har en positiv attityd och en väl utvecklad social förmåga. Du har en förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta egna initiativ och tycker samtidigt om att arbeta med andra.


Det är viktigt för oss att du kan arbeta utifrån vår värdegrund:

* Tillsammans gör vi varandra framgångsrika.
* Vi lyssnar in. Vi lyssnar av.
* Feedback bidrar till vår utveckling.

**Övrigt**

 ***På grund av stundande semester så är det paus i rekryteringen under veckorna 30-32.***


Tjänsten kan komma att säkerhetsklassas.


Som en av Sveriges största arbetsgivare kan vi erbjuda rätt person goda karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.


Vi eftersträvar jämlikhet för alla medarbetare, att de trivs på arbetsplatsen och värnar om en god balans mellan arbetsliv och privatliv.


Läs mer om vår verksamhet här: http://www.vgregion.se/om-vgr/


Om Västra GötalandsregionenVästra Götalandsregionen finns till för människorna i Västra Götaland. Vi ser till att det finns god hälso- och sjukvård för alla. Vi arbetar för en hållbar utveckling och tillväxt, bra miljö, förbättrad folkhälsa, ett rikt kulturliv och goda kommunikationer i hela Västra Götaland.Västra Götalandsregionen arbetar aktivt för att digitalisera fler arbetssätt. För att vara en del av den digitala omvandlingen har du med dig grundläggande färdigheter och kan använda digitala verktyg och tjänster. Du kan söka information, kommunicera, interagera digitalt, är riskmedveten och har motivation att delta i utvecklingen för att lära nytt.Västra Götalandsregionen krigsplacerar alla tillsvidareanställda medarbetare. Vill du veta mer om Västra Götalandsregionen kan du besöka vår introduktion till nya medarbetare på länken www.vgregion,se/introduktion. Du kan även läsa mer i presentation om Lön, ersättning och förmåner – det här får du som medarbetare i VGR. AnsökanVästra Götalandsregionen ser helst att du registrerar din ansökan via rekryteringssystemet. Om du som sökande har frågor om den utannonserade tjänsten eller av särskilda och speciella skäl inte kan registrera dina uppgifter i ett offentligt system - kontakta kontaktperson för respektive annons. Till bemannings-, förmedlings- och rekryteringsföretag och till dig som är försäljare:Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings-, förmedlings- och rekryteringsföretag samt andra externa aktörer och försäljare av ytterligare jobbannonser. Västra Götalandsregionen har upphandlade avtal.

Ec Utveckling och Förvaltning 0700-852727, | Facklig företrädare: Vision: Jeanette Hansson 0767-742849, Akademikerförbundet SSR, SACO: Git Olofsson 072-2063558, Akavia, SACO: Stig Holmlund 0709-512345, Sv Ingenjörer: Yvonne Jagersjö 073-8048765, | Publicerat: 2024-06-24 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-07-12

title: Driven DevOps-ledare inom mjukvaruutveckling
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*


Din roll


Vi söker en driven DevOps-ledare till vår programvaruutvecklingsverksamhet. I din roll kommer du att vara en nyckelperson i vårt företags pågående "Software Transformation", där du ansvarar för att utveckla och förbättra vår DevOps-verksamhet. Genom att implementera nya strategier, automation och moderna verktyg bidrar du till att ta vår växande verksamhet till nästa nivå.


Du kommer att arbeta nära en annan DevOps-ledare och ett team av ingenjörer för att skapa förutsättningar för att våra sex affärsområden effektivt och kontinuerligt kan utveckla och leverera programvara till våra kunder. Du kommer att ha en central roll i att optimera vår CI pipeline och säkerställa hög kvalitet i vår programvaruutveckling.


Arbetsuppgifter:

* Utveckla våra miljöer för Continuous Integration och Continuous Delivery.
* Underhålla och förbättra våra utvecklingsmiljöer.
* Integrera och utveckla AI-stöd för att förbättra processer.
* Analysera och visualisera KPI-data för kontinuerlig förbättring.
* Ansvara för att våra testramverk är effektiva och uppdaterade.
* Stötta programvaruteam med processefterlevnad och kvalitetskontroll (SQA).


Din profil


Nödvändiga erfarenheter:

* Bachelor-examen inom engineering, computer science eller liknande.
* Ledarskapserfarenhet, t.ex. som teamledare eller motsvarande.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av CI/CD-miljöer.
* Bred erfarenhet av programvaruutveckling.


Meriterande erfarenheter:

* Erfarenhet av virtualisering och containerisering.
* Kunskap om verktyg som Docker, Artifactory, Git, Jenkins, Jira, etc.
* Erfarenhet av programmeringsspråk som C/C++, Python.
* Utveckling i både Linux och Windows.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Observera att annonsen kommer ligga publicerad över sommaren och därför kan längre ledtider förekomma. Återkoppling kommer att ske tidigast vecka 33.


Tjänsten är placerad i Karlskoga eller Linköping.


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 22 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här

title: Bli vår nästa Software Configuration Manager
description:
*Vill du påverka och göra skillnad på riktigt? Här bidrar du till att skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen. Det du gör spelar roll.*


Din roll


Vi letar efter en engagerad och driven Software Configuration Manager som kan leda vårt arbete inom mjukvarukonfigurationshantering. Som en central del av vårt DevOps-team kommer du att förbättra våra konfigurationshanteringsprocesser och säkerställa att vi använder de senaste verktygen och metoderna för att optimera kvalitet och effektivitet för våra produktteam. Du kommer att spela en avgörande roll i att lyfta hela vår programvaruutvecklingsverksamhet genom att automatisera processer och metoder för SCM samt integrera dessa i vår gemensamma infrastruktur och verktygsuppsättning.


Arbetsuppgifter:

* Ansvar för versionshantering, konfigurationshantering och ändringshantering av programvara.
* Framtagande av strategi och processer för konfigurationshantering samt implementering av dessa i vår verksamhet.
* Ta fram metodik för Open Source, Reuse och Inner Source, VM och Containers samt produkt-konfigurationer.
* Fungera som ett SCM-stöd till våra mjukvaruteam, och ge vägledning och support i konfigurationshanteringens bästa metoder och verktyg.
* Ansvar för SCM-verktyg som Bitbucket, Gitlab och Artifactory-installationer, drift och underhåll.
* Driva förändringsarbete inom området för att säkerställa att vi håller oss i framkant inom konfigurationshantering och använder oss av bästa praxis.


Din profil


Vi söker en kvalificerad kandidat med följande egenskaper:

* Bachelor's eller motsvarande examen inom datavetenskap eller mjukvaruteknik.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom mjukvarukonfigurationshantering eller relaterat område.
* Djupgående kunskap om uppsättning och användning av verktyg för konfigurationshantering.
* Erfarenhet av att implementera och hantera Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
* Starka analytiska och problemlösningsförmågor.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Software development could be so much better and so much smoother. By bringing processes, tools and people together, we can help develop awesome products in shorter time than ever. We are strengthening our team and are looking for a Cloud Solution Architect that can help our development teams unleash their potential by coaching them through our centralized Cloud offerings. This includes Azure and Google Cloud platform.
The role is a Nordic role and will be expected to weigh in on everything from application architecture, cloud architecture, cloud operations and DevOps culture.
You will join a team that always has one foot in the cloud and DevOps as a mindset. DevOps is about influencing people and having an effective coaching is a big part of that success. This is what we do in a fast-paced and geographically diverse environment. The role will be key to ensure If’s digitalization journey and have a major impact on the architecture and development of current and future product and platform offerings.  

Responsibilities* Be a subject matter expert in Cloud and be able to zoom in and out dependent on situation and team maturity
* Provide technical and architectural guidance as well as hands-on support that support If´s digitalization journey
* Develope and improve Cloud FinOps best practices and help teams hands on to be as cost effecient as possible
* Review, improve and assist in further development of our cloud automation journey
* Help improve our cloud security posture
* Work collaboratively across multi-disciplinary teams throughout the company as a Cloud subject matter expert with implementation and modernization in focus
* Coaching and working with Cloud Engineers located in Riga
* Advisors of adoption of good development and operations practices in If, in terms of DevOps practices, environments, processes and tools
* Monitor current and future trends in the Cloud

  

To be successful in this role, you think that you have these skills:* Strong understanding across Cloud and the services they provide
* Strong experience in: Microsoft Azure (cloud and architecture), Cloud Governance and Infrastructure, Cloud FinOps, Cloud Security
* Preferably experience in: Networking
* Strong belief in automation and implementation of configuration management and continuous deployment practices
* Development experience is a plus

  

In addition to this, we also believe that you are forward-thinking, visionary and driven. You adept at structuring & analysing technology questions and concluding recommendations, also incorporating the financial dimension of decisions. You are able to communicate, educate and collaborate effectively with others, and speak English fluently. You should also have strong technical knowledge in Infrastructure/Technical Architecture, preferably with concrete experience of Cloud Services for application hosting - as well as being dedicated to creating an inspiring working environment for our IT units and engineering teams  

In return, we are able to offer an inspiring role driving adoption of emerging technologies and new ways of working in If. You will get the opportunity to be instrumental in adoption and transformation of Infrastructure Architecture as well as supporting DevOps across If. Last but not least, we will give you as much freedom as possible – including the accountability that comes with it.
Application deadline: Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, application deadline is 24 July 2024.  

To apply for the position: Please attach your CV.  

Work location: Bergshamra, Sweden  

Travelling: Several times a year in the Nordic countries is required.  

Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.  

For more information, please contact Viktor Junling, Head of Cloud CoE viktor.junling@if.se
Clean credit information and criminal record are a requirement for the position. The applicant's credit information and criminal record will be checked before being selected for the position

title: Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
Platform Cloud Engineer – NOVO Energy, Gothenburg
  
  

We are looking for a Platform Cloud Engineer join our growing team and help us implement and develop cloud-first, state-of-the-art factory solutions. If you're a hands on Cloud Engineer, eager to build Industry 4.0 solutions, develop and drive AWS products in a true high-tech industry we'd love to see you on the team.
  
  

Our mission
  
Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Torslanda will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with the potential to produce battery cells for half a million Volvo cars per year.
  
  

The role
  
As a Platform Cloud engineer, you will be part of building the foundation for NOVO Energy’s Gigafactory in close collaboration with Northvolt by implementing selected solutions. This will be a cloud first, smart factory / Industry 4.0 state-of-the-art MES system. Extensively using Amazon Web Services (AWS) for modern cloud capabilities will be a key.
  
  

This role will see you working on a proprietary technology that is key to advanced lithium-ion battery manufacturing. As such you will work in tight partnership with the Northvolt teams, where you will be the main point of knowledge transfer. This will offer you a rare opportunity to influence the direction and functionality of cloud solutions with some of the very best in the business.
  
  

As such, this role requires frequent travels to Stockholm to meet with, and learn from the teams there.
  
  

Key responsibilities
  
  

* Bring best practices from DevOps and site reliability engineering disciplines to industrial technology while building and improving the tooling needed to support this.
* Design, test and deploy infrastructure to operate a modern factory producing large amounts of data and connected batteries daily using infrastructure as code.
* Collaborate with software engineers to develop automation solutions for how we safely test and deploy code.
* Work to develop and help to document NOVO Energy’s processes around infrastructure and software deployment, best practices and ways of working.
* Work with the Security team to continuously test, monitor, and improve the security of our infrastructure.
* Work with people with network competence to help build out the right network architecture and deployment solutions for 3rd party software we need.
* Improve and build the ML/AI Platform leveraging the data available from all our factories
* Keep up with the state of the art in infrastructure, “everything as a software,” virtualization, CI/CD frameworks, cross-platform software development, engineering processes, as well as develop more domain knowledge in related areas (among others, automation, battery manufacturing and connectivity)
* Help us build a great team and make NOVO Energy a great place to work!


You and your skills
  
  

We know that many different names are given to this role in other companies, and your experience likely spans a variety of areas including software development, cloud and traditional infrastructure. It is likely that in the past you have had titles like devops, infrastructure, software, cloud or site reliability engineer.
  
  

We believe you are a strong team player with an outgoing, holistic and cost efficient fit for purpose approach. You understand that the mission is to establish a well-functioning Gigafactory where the timeplan is tight and the collaboration with our owners are key. Finding ways to proceed in a context where there are numerous of questions is something you are comfortable with. It is important for us to work with people that are reliable, good at communication and structured.
  
  

**In addition we believe you have experience from:**  

* deploying and managing infrastructure in the cloud (AWS, GCP or Azure) using infrastructure as code (ideally Terraform)
* developing and managing highly automated continuous integration and deployment pipelines and helping developers increase their productivity
* working with distributed systems, microservices, load balancing, etc.
* working with virtualization, containerization, Kubernetes and related technologies
* programming in at least one language (ideally Go or Python) and desire to learn more


What’s in it for you?
  
  

The teams at NOVO Energy are highly collaborative. Together we innovate, reinvent, and learn quickly to build a world class Gigafactory, establishing a new high-tech industry in Gothenburg and build an exceptional business. Currently in a start-up phase, this is an outstanding opportunity for you to make an outsized impact, contribute to our shared success and to grow your role, remit and career together with us.
  
  

Our expansion is rapid, and in coming years there will be 3,000 of us operating in a high-tech manufacturing setting where IT will be a critical enabler.
  
  

Information about the recruitment process during the summer vacation period:
  
We would like to inform you that our recruitment process may take longer than usual due to the holiday season. We ask for your understanding as our lead times are extended during the summer, and we appreciate your patience. We will review your application as soon as possible and get back to you at the earliest opportunity.
  
  

Thank you for your understanding, and we look forward to connecting with you!
  
  

Volvo Cars is one of the most well-known and respected car brands in the world. Northvolt is a leading supplier of sustainable, high-quality battery cells and systems, dedicated to delivering the world’s greenest lithium-ion battery. Together, we have formed a joint venture, NOVO Energy, to power the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars.
  
  

Our Gigafactory in Gothenburg will be one of the largest cell production facilities in Europe, with a potential annual cell production capacity of up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh) - thereby enabling a supply of batteries for approximately half a million Volvo cars per year. Our state-of-the-art R&D facility will gather leading expertise from all over the world, to create the next generation battery cells.
  
  

You can read more about this joint venture in these press releases, here and here.

title: DevOps-ingenjör – Heltid, Stockholm
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. Besök oss på www.modernera.se.
  
På uppdrag av en kund söker vi nu en DevOps-ingenjör. Vår kund är en ledande specialist inom digitala lösningar som sedan 1984 skapar nya möjligheter, förenklar livet för människor och stärker kunders konkurrenskraft. Som IT-konsulter bygger de viktiga system som är centrala för kunders verksamheter inom en mängd olika branscher. Företaget har över 140 anställda och kontor i Stockholm, Uppsala, Göteborg, Malmö samt Sevilla. Kunden strävar efter att hälften av deras projekt till 2025 ska bidra till FN: s hållbarhetsmål.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm, med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån. Som en DevOps-ingenjör kommer du att arbeta i flera av företagets projekt och bidra till att effektivisera arbetsprocesserna. Du kommer att ha ett nära samarbete med kollegor som sitter utspridda över hela Sverige, där ni tillsammans arbetar för att skapa och upprätthålla företagets externa åtaganden gentemot kunder.
  
I rollen som DevOps-ingenjör ingår flera kontaktytor eftersom du agerar som ett stöd åt flera projekt samtidigt. Arbetsuppgifterna inkluderar bland annat underhåll av system, installation och uppgradering av dessa när det behövs.
  
  

**Krav:**  

* Minst 2 års tidigare erfarenhet av DevOps
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


**Meriterande:**  

* Erfarenhet från arbete i offentliga organisationer
* Programmeringskunskaper i C#, JavaScript, TypeScript eller PowerShell
* Kunskaper i Jira, Bamboo eller Bitbucket


**Du får:**  

* Ett kreativt och stimulerande arbete i en utmanande miljö inom en börsnoterad koncern
* Extra föräldraförmåner och en god företagskultur
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter för den som vill avancera
* En flexibel arbetsplats med stor frihet att planera din vardag så att arbete och privatliv kan samordnas
* Ett modernt och välutrustat kontor i Stockholm med tillgång till eget gym, cykelgarage och takterrass


Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund på heltid. Anställningen inleds med en sex månaders provanställning, som därefter övergår i en tillsvidareanställning. Tillträde: Omgående.
  
  

**Ansökan:**  

Skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Ange "DevOps-ingenjör – Heltid, Stockholm" i ämnesraden.

title: Development Lead till techbolag i expansionsfas
description:
Erfaren development lead med gedigna utvecklingskunskaper som önskar nå sin fulla potential på modernt techbolag. Här blir du del av en grupp erfarna och nytänkande individer som använder sin kompetens och kärlek för modern teknik till att främja entreprenörskap och nyföretagande.
  
Yoin Technologies är ett ungt och modernt techbolag som består av ett litet men sammansvetsat gäng med en mängd olika erfarenheter och kompetenser. Här får du chansen att briljera med din egen kunskap och samtidigt växa genom andras. Nu söker man en duktig och driven individ med flera års erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling med fokus på webbutveckling som vill bli en ledande stjärnan i Yoins utvecklingsteam.
  
Som development lead får du möjligheten att vara den ledande profilen på bolaget inom webbutveckling och blir en betydande del i Yoins satsning framåt genom att tillsammans med övriga områdesansvariga inom DevOps och Test bygga upp ett starkt och kompetent team för att kunna möta kunders behov på bästa sätt. Du kommer spendera en hel del tid med att vara ute hos kund men också med att bygga upp verksamheten inom ditt område. Här blir dina erfarenheter av att bedriva mjukvaruutvecklingsprojekt och dina gedigna kunskaper inom produktutveckling, back- och frontendutveckling samt molnplattformar viktiga faktorer när bolaget strävar mot att nå sina nya mål.
  
---
  
**Gå in direkt och gör en anonym lönematchning:** https://jobnet.se/development-lead-yoin?utm\_source=arbetsformedlingen&utm\_medium=annons&utm\_content=yoin-technologies&utm\_term=development-lead
  
---
  
Rekryteringen sker via Jobnet.se där du även hittar bilder, videos och mer information om tjänsten och företaget.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Join our dynamic team at a leading fintech company based in Stockholm, as a DevOps Engineer, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of financial technology. If you're passionate about cloud infrastructure, automation, and driving innovation in a collaborative environment, this opportunity is perfect for you. We are seeking a skilled professional fluent in Swedish, with expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP, to enhance our cloud infrastructure and streamline our development processes.
 



  





**Must Have Requirements:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role, preferably in the fintech industry.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong expertise in cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
* Hands on experience with infrastructure automation tools like Terraform, Ansible, or Chef.
* In-depth knowledge of CI/CD concepts and experience with tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.



  





**Nice to Have Skills:** 



* Familiarity with containerisation technologies such as Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Prometheus, ELK Stack, or Splunk.
* Understanding of security best practices and compliance standards in cloud environments.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and adapt to changing priorities.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Join a leading gaming company in Stockholm, Sweden, as a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) and be part of a team dedicated to delivering seamless gaming experiences to players worldwide. With a focus on innovation and cutting-edge technology, we are seeking a talented individual fluent in Swedish, with expertise in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP. Exposure to Kubernetes and Docker is a plus.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Manage and optimise cloud infrastructure across AWS, Azure, or GCP to maintain high availability, scalability, and performance of gaming services.
* Develop and maintain automated deployment pipelines and scaling mechanisms for efficient game deployments and player traffic management.
* Implement monitoring solutions to detect and resolve issues affecting game services, minimzing downtime and player impact.
* Identify performance bottlenecks in gaming systems and collaborate with development teams to implement optimisations.
* Ensure security best practices and compliance standards are followed to protect gaming systems and player data, conducting regular audits and assessments.
* Design and implement disaster recovery strategies for business continuity in case of system failures or disasters.
* Advocate for Infrastructure as Code principles, managing infrastructure configurations and deployments through version-controlled code repositories.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline workflows and ensure smooth operations.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Site Reliability Engineer or similar role, preferably in the gaming industry.
* Proficiency in Swedish and English, with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong expertise in cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
* Experience with automated deployment tools and configuration management systems.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Kubernetes and Docker.
* Solid understanding of networking, security, and performance optimization principles.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and adapt to changing priorities.



  





**Nice-to-Have Skills:** 



* Certification in cloud platforms such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or Azure DevOps Engineer Expert.
* Experience with game development or game server management.
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI, or CircleCI.

title: ALTEN Industry - DevOps Engineer Stockholm
description:
Are you skilled in DevOps and Clouds and want to take your next career step? Then we would like to meet you! We are looking for talented DevOps engineers who are interested to work with modern technology and construction for a sustainable future. With us at ALTEN in Gothenburg, you work in a dynamic, innovative and international environment together with knowledgeable and supportive colleagues. Does it sound interesting? Apply today!
 



  





**We offer you:** 




 At ALTEN, every individual is equally valuable in building tomorrow’s world today. We meet future challenges by supporting our clients’ projects and enabling our people to reach their full potential. We do so by offering technological challenges, fulfilling opportunities, inspiring togetherness and the possibility to contribute to a sustainable future.
 



  





 We are convinced that your development is driven by your passion. By being active in several different industries, we can offer a wide range of assignments and an opportunity to influence both the world around you and your own development. With a coaching leadership, our leaders will guide you in the right direction. We also offer personalized training opportunities through your individual training budget, which you can use in our internal ALTEN Academy or on external courses.
 



  





**Role Description:** 




 As a DevOps engineer with us, you will be part of our amazing international consulting team where our consultants possess different skills in IT. You will have various tasks and the opportunity to work with national and international projects at one of our world-leading customers. We appriciate if you are communicative, responsive and value good cooperation. We would like you to have a background in development and are passionate about DevOps. Perhaps you also have experience of being a technical consultant or advisor.
 



  





 We need you who are experienced in:
 



  




* Python, GoLang or Bash
* AWS, Azure or Google cloud platform
* CI / CD
* Docker or Kubernetes
* Git, Jenkins or Gerrit
* Atlassian
* And have
 **minimum 3 years** 
 of practical experience of DevOps



  





 It makes you even more interesting for us if you have:
 



  




* Work experience in agile environments
* Speaks swedish



  





**About Alten:** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest consulting companies within Engineering, IT and Life Sciences with over 57,000 employees in more than 30 countries. We’re a global actor with a local presence with 1400 committed colleagues in offices from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the product development chain of the most prestigious companies in sectors such as Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Energy, Manufacturing, Public Sector and Life Sciences.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
We are a growing green tech startup with a vision to revolutionise how we manage and utilise eco-friendly resources. Our passion is to create innovative solutions that promote sustainability and reduce our environmental footprint. We are currently seeking an experienced Platform Engineer to join our team and drive progress in technology and sustainability.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Responsible for designing, implementing, and operating scalable and secure cloud platforms on AWS, Azure, and other cloud services.
* Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using tools like Terraform to automate resource management.
* Create and maintain Docker containers and Kubernetes clusters to support software development and deployment.
* Collaborate with the development team to optimize and improve architecture and performance of platform services.
* Implement and monitor systems to ensure high availability, performance, and security of platform services.
* Participate in incident management and troubleshooting to minimize operational disruptions and enhance system stability.
* Conduct regular security audits and manage compliance with relevant standards and regulations within the green tech sector.



  





**Requirements:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, or related technical field.
* Strong knowledge and experience working with AWS and Azure cloud services.
* Experience using tools such as Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes is advantageous.
* Ability to communicate effectively in both Swedish and English, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work independently and in a team, with the capability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Interest and commitment to sustainability and environmental issues.



  





**Benefits:** 



* Opportunity to be part of a rapidly growing startup in the green tech sector.
* Challenging and meaningful projects that promote sustainable development and eco-friendly solutions.
* Flexible work arrangements and a creative work environment that fosters innovation and personal growth.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
Our cloud-based infrastructure spans AWS, Azure, and GCP, hosting customer-facing applications and internal support systems. While we have some legacy applications, we prefer containerization and cloud-first setups. You'll help us maintain a well-architected infrastructure, using tools like Terraform to manage infrastructure as code. Reliability and compliance are key, and you'll build systems that meet these requirements.
 



  





 We use an agile workflow and encourage collaboration to deliver relevant products and services. Our fast-paced environment offers demanding tasks that trigger creativity. We value quick communication and regular hackathons to tackle challenges.
 



  





**Role and Responsibilities** 



* Enhance our infrastructure and share knowledge.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and system stability.
* Solve complex problems with simple solutions.
* Collaborate across teams and perform as a sole contributor when needed.



  





**Requirements** 



* Experience with Azure, GCP, and AWS.
* Understanding of security from development to production.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines (GIT, Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Octopus, GitHub Actions).
* Knowledge of Terraform, Ansible, networking principles, Docker, Kubernetes, Helm charts, system administration, and scripting (PowerShell, Shell).
* Excellent English communication skills.



  





**Ideal Candidate** 



* 5+ years of professional experience.
* Committed to documentation and automation.
* Raises the level of those around them.
* Enjoys R&D and is always learning.
* Has a vision for product development and code evolution.
* A pleasure to work with.

description:

title: IT Operations Manager
description:
**Job ID: 24379** 






  

  



 Would you like to work with the Common Data Warehouse (CDW) Tech Application Management Team as an IT Service Manager? We are now looking for a IT Service Manager to operate, monitor, optimize and automate our application.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the financial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 As the IT Service Manager for CDW Tech Application Management, you’ll play a valuable role in ensuring the stable operations of the CDW application . You will also provide the direction to the team and has a deep technical understanding of how operate, optimize and automate the application (based on Snowflake & DataStage Platform).
 





  

  



 You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to operate, monitor, deploy, automate, and scale our applications and systems effectively. You will help us support our users, developers and our BizDevOps journey, to ensure we are geared towards high quality and low cycle-time and that our customers are our first priority.
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Leading the Operations (Incident, Problem & Change Management) execution
* Actively leading our DVM Operational calls and act as SPOC for Operations
* Extensive Stakeholder Management
* Managing the external vendor while also being a technical mentor, coach and perform competence development and knowledge sharing within your capability
* Operate and monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure high availability and reliability
* Work closely with ART/development teams to integrate BizDevOps best practices into the software development lifecycle and to enhance collaboration, automation, and efficiency across the organization
* Working closely with development teams to help support our Nordea BizDevOps ambitions with architects and hardware/infrastructure engineers within Nordea
* Working across cultures enabling an international footprint



  

  



 You'll join a cross-functional agile team of talented and very technically-skilled people, working with modern technologies and tools – and prioritising learning culture and having fun in our daily work. This role is based in Helsinki, Stockholm or Warsaw/Gdansk office. This is a permanent full-time role and we follow hybrid model of working. Ideally you could start already before end of Summer.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* 2+ years of hands knowledge of Snowflake & Datastage
* Have good communication skills and are able to explain complex concepts in a clear and understandable way, and enjoys interacting with other people
* Are goal-oriented and takes responsibility for and focus on the big picture
* Are a quick learner that is interested in expanding your knowledge in the Data Warehousing domain
* Ability to build relationships across Business, Technology and Architecture



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* A degree in the fields of Engineering, Computer Science or Information Systems
* 3+ years of devops experience in the Data Warehousing Domain
* In-depth knowledge about the banking domain
* Self-driven with ability to work independently and under own initiative once the initial guidance is given
* Analytical skills and ability to deal with complex and demanding issues
* Experience of stakeholder's engagement management



  

  



**Additional background and/or skillset, that are useful in this role:** 





* Experience in Mainframe Technologies like COBOL, JCL would be an added advantage



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 07/07/2024
 



 .
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’.  The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete.  https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
 







  
 







 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Technology Service Lead in Application Management team
description:
**Job ID: 23783**




  
 





 We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us. 
 





  
 





 We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.
 





  

  



 We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues and meeting our potential candidates.
 

  
 





 We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on the broader perspective in our daily challenges. 
 

  
 





 We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
 

  
 




**About this opportunity**





  
 





 Come join an exciting Technology Service Lead position in Application Management Team, Enterprise-wide master and reference data domain in a global bank, leading the daily management & operations for a curtain set of services within the Group Functions Technology Service function.
 





  
 





 You will act as a Technology Service Lead for all applications within your service portfolio. You will play a valuable role in setting the strategy and creating the roadmap for your portfolio and you will be doing this together with key stakeholders across the bank. Working with international teams in an inspiring & work-life balanced based working environment, you will have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.
 





  
 



**What you will do:**



* Managing and leading the interface to key Business & Technology stakeholders including ensuring continuous alignment with Technology Business Strategy (workforce, partnerships, standards) as well as with Common Frameworks, guidelines and Tech Standards
* Planning and optimizing the Technology total cost of ownership for own business portfolio including annual target setting and following up on this. You are fully responsible for your financial management!
* Ensuring execution and deliverables according to Technology & Business roadmap observing the priorities, execution structure, funding and capability resource plans across the full value-chain
* Championing technology strategies and creating awareness of technology trends and opportunities
* Ensuring management of portfolio specific & vendor contracts
* Working across cultures enabling an international footprint



  
 





 This role is based in Helsinki, Stockholm or Gdynia/Gdansk office. This is a permanent full-time role and we follow hybrid model of working. Ideally you could start already before the summer.
 





  
 




**Who you are**





  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.
 





  
 



**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:**



* Have leadership experience and know how to both set direction & challenge the status quo for the greater good of Nordea
* Are role model for collaboration, empowering own team, inspiring the “Can Do” attitude
* Have strong communication skills and good at Stakeholder Management at all levels of the bank
* Are result oriented, taking ownership, reaching out and “making things happen”. Basically being customer centric mindset actively seeking value-creation opportunities through technology
* A preferred candidate with an IT technical background enabling the candidate to understand the technical context of the area
* Have strong skills within transformation and project/programme management creating proven changes in complex financial environments
* Have knowledge of DevOps & ITIL principles preferably from working within financial services institutions



  
 



**What we offer**






 Our team collaborates with several different stakeholders, and we value our good team spirit. You would join in truly international cross-country team as we are located in Finland, Sweden, Denmark, India and Poland. Many of your future colleagues have technical background and are thinking strategically as we are responsible of financial crime applications and financial reporting for the whole group. We follow hybrid model of working and have flexible working hours. Nordea offers great benefits which differs in each country.
 





  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than 04/07/2024
 



 .
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  

  



 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**For candidates in Sweden only -** 
  For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**For candidates in Poland only -** 
  Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: QA Manager
description:
We are looking for a technically skilled QA Manager to join an expanding Productivity team. The team works with QA, DevOps and SRE across different markets. As a QA Manager, you will play a crucial role in our software engineering process, ensuring that our processes for delivery of software meet the highest standards of quality. You will work closely with QA specialists, reporting to you, and other stakeholders. The QA specialists are currently working in a number of agile development teams across Odevo’s products.
 



  





 Your expertise in quality and software engineering will be crucial as Odevo increases its global footprint. ile development teams across Odevo’s products.
 



  





 Your key responsibilities will include:
 


* Lead and mentor Odevo’s QA professionals, fostering a collaborative and high-performance work environment.
* Manage QA teams across value streams, ensuring consistency and alignment in QA practices.
* Conduct regular one-on-one meetings, performance reviews, and career development sessions with QA professionals.
* Develop and implement a comprehensive QA strategy that aligns with the company’s overall objectives and product roadmaps.
* Collaborate with product managers/leads/owners, developers, and other stakeholders to define QA objectives, priorities, and deliverables.
* Create and maintain a QA roadmap, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery of all QA activities.
* Continuously evaluate and improve QA processes, tools, and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Implement best practices in automated testing, manual testing, and other QA activities.
* Drive initiatives for improving test coverage, reducing defects, and enhancing product quality.
* Facilitate effective communication and collaboration between QA teams and other departments, such as development, DevOps, and product management.
* Act as the primary point of contact for all QA-related matters, ensuring timely resolution of issues and clear communication of QA activities.
* Promote a culture of quality and continuous improvement within the QA teams and the broader organization.
* Allocate QA resources effectively across projects and products, balancing workloads and priorities.
* Identify and address skill gaps within the QA team, providing training and development opportunities as needed.



  





**Who you are** 




 You are a coaching leader with the ability to motivate and inspire a team. Collaboration is a key aspect of our organization, and we are looking for someone who can thrive while working harmoniously across departments and engaging with stakeholders at all levels. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas and concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 



  





 A good eye for details is crucial in ensuring that our products meet our quality standards. Furthermore, experience in a fast-paced, high-growth environment will be highly regarded, as it demonstrates the ability to thrive in dynamic settings.
 



  





**Experience** 



* Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* You have at least five years of experience as a QA Manager or a similar role.
* Solid understanding of software engineering methodologies and CI/CD.
* Experience with coaching and developing team members.
* Knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
* Experience working with E2E test automation, for example, Playwright or Cypress.
* Knowledge of at least one programming language.



  





**What we offer** 



* Remote friendly - you'll be part of a team that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
* Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.



  





**Location** 




 Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.
 



  





**Excited?** 




 If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.
 



 👉🏽 Why we formed Odevo
 



 🔍 About Odevo
 



 🌐 Our Software

title: Välkänt IoT bolag söker Data Engineer
description:
Ett ledande, skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över söker dig som drivs av komplex datahantering och arbetat med stora dataflöden
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm, Sverige
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, möjlighet till distansbarbete 2 dagar i veckan
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augsti/September
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Ett ledande, skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över.
   

 Detta företag är en global ledare inom IoT och hanterar mer än 20 miljoner uppkopplingar för multinationella kunder som Volvo, Scania, Hitachi, Verisure Securitas Direct och Husqvarna. De erbjuder enkel och tillförlitlig tillgång till varje marknad i världen och möjliggör för branschledande aktörer att koppla upp sina produkter och tjänster på global skala över alla vertikaler.
   

 Företaget är rankat topp tre bästa IoT-operatörerna i Europa och bland de tio bästa i världen. Med huvudkontor och tekniskt centrum beläget i Norden har de försäljningsrepresentation i Storbritannien, USA, Tyskland, Italien, Sydafrika, Sydkorea, Kina, Taiwan och Japan.
 


  

  

**Tjänsten och teamet**
  


 De söker en erfaren Data Engineer med utmärkta färdigheter inom avancerad och modern databehandling av stora volymer och hastigheter för att gå med i deras team.
   

 I denna position är teamet ansvarigt för:
 


  

  
* Arkitektur och utveckling av deras dataplattform, inklusive insamling, bearbetning och förberedelse av data – både batch och realtidsdata.
  
* Utveckling av analysrapporter och verktyg.
  
* Utveckling och hantering av ML-modeller.
  
* Piloter och implementering av AI-användningsfall i produktion.
  
* Teamet har också ett DevOps-ansvar vilket innebär att "det vi bygger, det driver vi också".
   

 Datateamet interagerar och levererar affärsvärde till nästan alla delar av organisationen. Teamet är också ansvarigt för att leverera direkt kundvärde, antingen genom att stödja kundnära kollegor eller via kundnära datalösningar.
   

 Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet att bli en del av ett moget och effektivt datateam med stor exponering mot den globala verksamheten.
   

 Denna roll rapporterar till Head of Data (Data Science and Analytics team) och är placerad i Stockholm, Karlskrona eller Göteborg.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 För att lyckas i denna position ska man ha omfattande erfarenhet och färdigheter inom:
 


  

  
* AWS
  
* Big data
  
* Utveckling inom Python eller Java
  


  

  

**Andra krav**
  

  
* MSc i mjukvaru-/dataingenjör eller liknande
  
* Utmärkta skriftliga och muntliga kommunikationsfärdigheter på engelska och helst svenska
  


  


  

**Meriterande**



  

  
* PySpark
  
* Pandas
  
* Athena/Trino
  
* Apache Iceberg
  
* AWS Glue
  
* AWS StepFunctions
  
* Apache Flink
  
* CI/CD designmönster
  
* Dataorienterade testfall
  
* Hantering av referensdata
  
* Distribuerade arbetsbelastningar inklusive partitionsstrategier
  
* Skalbara databehandlingsmönster
   

 Stor vikt läggs vid erfarenhet av att hantera höga och växande datavolymer. Om man har varit en del av ett team som stött på skalningsproblem och löst det på ett innovativt sätt är man en bra kandidat. Kandidater bör också vara kunniga inom säker design och åtkomstmönster, och helst ha en AWS-certifiering.
  


  

  

**Som person**
  


 De söker en engagerad och självdriven person med en positiv och optimistisk inställning. Man ska inte vara rädd för att ta stort ansvar, vara affärsorienterad och bra med människor. Man ska älska att dela tekniskt kunnande och god praxis. Teamet delar en testdriven inställning och ett gemensamt intresse för att arbeta över flera miljöer och programmeringsspråk, utnyttjande av molnets krafter.
   

 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Första steg i denna process kommer vara beteende och logik tester.
   

 Därefter telefonavstämning samt tekniskt test.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Anton Hegart eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sts04@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104900

title: Cloud Solutions Architect – Stockholm
description:
Brinner du för molnteknologi och gillar att stödja och utveckla verksamheters molnkompetens? Vi söker nu en arkitekt till vårt Cloud & Connectivity-team. Flexibilitet, autonomi, vidareutbildning och projektrotation är viktiga delar av vår kultur – kanske är du vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjligheten att jobba teamorienterat i en rad meningsfulla och kundnära projekt. I vårt team ansvarar vi för att designa, utveckla och implementera integrations- och plattformslösningar i molnmiljö. Vi har en cloud-first strategi sedan flera år tillbaka och är ett av de ledande företagen i Norden inom offentliga molnlösningar och -tjänster – i nära samarbete med Azure, GCP och AWS.
   

  

**Som Molnarkitekt i Vårt Team Kommer Du**
* Stötta våra kunder i ett tidigt skede och hjälpa till att designa lösningsarkitekturen för lösningar baserade på olika molntekniker;
* Som expert driva kunden i rätt riktning och lyfta deras kompetens inom cloud.
* Samarbeta med kollegor i en miljö som präglas av hög grad av eget ansvar och tillit.


 Detta är en bredare roll där du får möjlighet att jobba både med lösningsarkitektur och hands-on implementering – du befinner dig gärna i gränslandet mellan arkitektur och teknik. För rätt person finns även möjlighet att stötta och vägleda våra kunder i strategiska frågor beträffande arkitektur, kostnad och innovation.
   

  

**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har**
* Jobbat med att designa lösningsarkitekturen för lösningar i molnet. Vi jobbar just nu främst i Azure men värdesätter även erfarenhet i AWS eller GCP.
* Hands-on erfarenhet av att bygga DevOps pipelines eller sätta upp infrastruktur från scratch.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling i exempelvis C#, Python eller Node.


 Din arbetsplats kan vara belägen i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö. Vi erbjuder både möjlighet att arbeta på plats och på distans med flexibla arbetsmodeller – resor till kund kan ibland förekomma.
   

  

 Karriärbanor på Solita
   

  

 Jobbet som konsult hos oss innebär ofta en brant utvecklingskurva och variation sett till både arbetsuppgifter och roller. Vi ser karriärbanor inte som en specifik trappa utan mer som ett landskap med flera möjliga individanpassade orienteringar, både i höjd- och sidled, inom ett flertal kompetensområden.
   

  

 Sam jobbar exempelvis idag som People Lead parallellt med sin roll som Service Delivery Manager.
   

  

 Lia har haft chansen att bära många hattar under sin tid hos oss – från developer till lead developer och arkitekt i både lokala och gränsöverskridande integrationsprojekt.
   

  

 Andrei har i nuvarande uppdrag fått utforska ett flertal olika roller såsom Scrum Master, Team/Tech Lead, Service Delivery Manager, Architect, Project Manager, samt Requirements Analyst.
   

  

 Vem är vi?
   

  

 Vi är ett värderingsstyrt konsultbolag med kapacitet inom data, design, moln, integrationer och mjukvaruutveckling. Som ett gediget kompetensföretag kan vi garantera att du lär dig mer när du börjar hos oss – det är vårt löfte till dig. Genom att värna om kontinuerligt lärande ser vi till att vi har intressanta projekt för framtiden, och även möjligheter till projektrotationer.
   

  

**Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;**
* Projekt som skapar avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället;
* Variation; i branscher, i team, i nya teknologier och system, i angreppsätt;
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg;
* Growth Academy – vår kunskapsportal för att stödja din utveckling och dina ambitioner. Vi har en lärande kultur och uppmuntrar våra medarbetare att växa och bredda sina kunskaper genom en rad kompetensnätverk, info sessions, föreläsningar och certifieringar;
* En trygg och human arbetsmiljö för att främja innovation, motivation och välmående;
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med ett komplett förmånspaket bestående av exempelvis 30 semesterdagar, Friday breakfasts, AWs, bike leasing, intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande, och pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet.


*Lyssna inte bara på oss – läs mer på Glassdoor!*
 Låter det spännande?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Berätta om dina färdigheter och önskemål, så tar vi tillsammans reda på om det kan bli en bra match. Detta är en löpande rekrytering; vi går igenom ansökningar och kontaktar löpande de kandidater som bäst matchar vår kravprofil för denna roll.
   

  

 Om du har frågor får du gärna nå ut till oss på LinkedIn eller via mail: Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller Talent Acquisition Specialist Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

**Vi rekryterar också till våra kontor i Göteborg och Malmö!**

title: Lead Golang Developer
description:
**Lead Golang Developer - Stockholm (on-site)** 




  





 Join our dynamic and innovative tech scale-up based in Stockholm, Sweden, where we are revolutionizing the FinTech sector. We are a team of passionate individuals committed to pushing the boundaries of technology and creating impactful solutions that drive our company's success.
 



  





 As we continue to grow, we are seeking a talented Lead Golang Developer to lead our development team in building scalable and efficient software solutions.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As the Lead Golang Developer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technical direction of our company and leading a team of talented engineers. You will be responsible for architecting, designing, and implementing high-performance, reliable, and maintainable backend systems using Go. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions. This is an excellent opportunity for a skilled developer with leadership experience who is passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technologies to drive business growth.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  




* Lead and mentor a team of Golang developers, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
* Architect, design, and implement scalable and efficient backend systems and microservices using Go.
* Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and ensure code quality and best practices are maintained.
* Participate in recruitment efforts, including interviewing and hiring top engineering talent to expand the team.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* Proven experience (8 years) as a software engineer with a focus on backend development, ideally using Go extensively.
* Experience with designing and implementing scalable, distributed systems and microservices architecture.
* Proficiency in writing clean, efficient, and maintainable code, with a deep understanding of Go programming language and its core concepts.
* Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Familiarity with cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and serverless architectures is a plus.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and drive technical initiatives.
* Prior experience in a leadership or mentorship role is preferred.



  





 Join us in shaping the future of our business and make a meaningful impact in an exciting and fast-paced environment. If you are passionate about Go development and leading high-performing engineering teams, we would love to hear from you!
 



  





 Apply direct or reach out to me at owen.butler@ifindtech.com

title: Security Specialist
description:
**Welcome to Eficode!**
 We are building the future of software development - specializing in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organizations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, psychological safety and culture - we appreciate our laid-back and autonomous, but supportive atmosphere.
   

  

**We’re on the lookout for a Security Specialist or Engineer**
 Eficode is looking for an experienced Security Specialist or Engineer for our Security Team. The role is primarily focused on managed services security but will share duties with the wider security organization at Eficode.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Collaborate with managed services technical teams to support and guide security-related processes and tasks.
* Collaborate with customers on security-related topics.
* Take part in security awareness programs, developing and refining security processes, and incident management protocols.
* Conduct thorough security reporting and drive continuous improvement in our security practices within the business area.
* Integrate IT security controls into business area operations.
* Take the lead in monitoring and responding to security incidents in our environments, ensuring swift detection and response.
* Coordinate response and recovery activities during incidents as part of our incident management efforts, ensuring continuous business operations.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure optimal operation of our ISO 27001-certified security system.
* Mentor and train your colleagues on the industry's best practices.
* Develop our security practices and processes to help us scale further securely-
* Play a pivotal role in sustaining and enhancing the security posture of our systems and processes.
* Engage in proactive learning and development to stay ahead of security trends and technologies.
* Provide coaching and training to colleagues, fostering a culture of security awareness and competence.


**Who are we looking for?**
**Our Ideal Security Specialist Or Engineer Is Someone Who**
* Has a minimum 5 years relevant experience with a proven track record of success in IT security operations.
* Has experience in Cloud Security, with a focus on securing cloud-based infrastructure and services.
* Holds an information technology or security degree (bachelor's or higher).
* Is skilled in cybersecurity tools and software applications.
* Demonstrates analytical thinking capabilities and a problem-solving mindset.
* Can communicate effectively in English.
* Shares our continuous learning and knowledge-sharing culture.
* Has experience with security process management and incident response.
* Conducts training sessions and presentations.
* Collaborates effectively with different teams, technical and non-technical.


**It’s Advantageous If You Have**
* Previous experience in managed services environments.
* Experience with security certifications and frameworks such as CIS, NIST, ISO/IEC 27000 Series.


**Why Choose Eficode?**
