* You’ll have the opportunity to contribute and participate in an exciting international growth story.
* Eficode is a hub of bright minds working on groundbreaking projects.
* We provide an environment that respects experience, nurtures talent, and encourages growth.
* Open collaboration and clear communication are the cornerstones of our culture.
* With our commitment to personal development, your growth never stops.
* Flexible Work: Tailor your work environment and schedule to fit your life best, with remote work options available.
* On top of your compensation, we offer fringe benefits that depend on your location.
* Possibility to explore life in another country through our international presence.


**Join Us!**
 If you're ready to lead in the creation of an innovative enterprise architecture and want to make a significant impact in a growing international organization, Eficode is where you belong.
   

  

 This is a full-time, hybrid remote role available in
 **Finland, Sweden, Poland, or the UK** 
 (please note that we hope you are already located in one of these countries).
   

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, please apply
 **by 21st of July 2024** 
 , we would love to hear from you!
   

  

*At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants.*
*We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognize that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds and cultures we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*
*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information and your picture on your job application.*
*Eficode, better made possible.*

title: Configuration Manager plattformsteam
description:
Vill du jobba med webbteknik och automation, samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan? Hos oss får du intressanta arbetsuppgifter i samhällets hjärta, kombinerat med utvecklingsmöjligheter och balans mellan arbete och fritid. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Du kommer att arbeta i ett team vars mål är att skapa stabila och säkra plattformar och tjänster. I din roll stöttar du utvecklingsteam med incidenthantering, beställning och uppsättning nya servrar, brandväggsöppningar, DNS-namn, certifikat, behörigheter samt underhåller och förvaltar Sitevision-plattformen. Utöver det integrerar du också upphandlade molntjänster med vår miljö. Du använder din kommunikationsförmåga och samarbetsförmåga i den viktiga samverkan teamet har med nyttjarna av plattformen och molntjänsterna, samt med driftsorganisationen och leverantörerna. Ni har frihet att själva organisera ert arbete i teamet och jobbar tillsammans mot ert gemensamma mål. En del av arbetet är också att utveckla och anpassa teamets arbetssätt t.ex. effektivisera flöden genom automatiseringar.
   

  

 Med din kompetens inom RedHat Linux, automation, Git, Jenkins samt Bash script bidrar du till resten av teamet. Även om större delen av arbetsuppgifterna löses tillsammans så förekommer moment som kräver stor självständighet. Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Vi jobbar aktivt med kompetens- och teknikutveckling, du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor it-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Du tillhör it-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* ha god problemlösningsförmåga
* vara självgående, ta egna initiativ och agera proaktivt i syfte att målet med verksamheten uppnås
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av RHEL och scripting i bash
* flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av Apache HTTPD och Apache Tomcat
* erfarenhet av automation
* förståelse för IT-säkerhet och nätverk
* arbetslivserfarenhet av Jenkins och Git


 Det är önskvärt att du har en eftergymnasial utbildning samt arbetslivserfarenhet av
   

  

* Sitevision drift
* Ansible
* CM/CI/CD
* Jira/Confluence/Sharepoint
* SAFe/Agile
* HTML/Javascript
* OCP/Minishift
* Artifactory
* Java / Groovy


**Bra att veta**
 Vi förlänger annonseringstiden över sommaren på grund av semestertiden. Den rekryterande chefen svarar gärna på dina frågor. Intervjuer kommer att ske i början av augusti.
   

  

 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/294 | Kontakt: Anna Skytt, sektionschef 076-7255516, Bojana Dukic, hr-specialist rekrytering bojana.dukic@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-06-11 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-04

title: System Integration Specialist (Azure) – Stockholm
description:
Vi letar nu efter en person som vill fortsätta utvecklas inom Azure, systemintegration och cloud-native lösningar. Engagemang, autonomi och värdeskapande arbete är centrala delar av vår kultur – är du vår nästa kollega?
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjligheten att jobba teamorienterat i en rad meningsfulla och kundnära projekt. Vårt team ansvarar för att designa, utveckla och sätta upp integrationslösningar i molnmiljö. Vi har en cloud-first strategi sedan flera år tillbaka och är ett av de ledande företagen i Norden inom offentliga molnlösningar och -tjänster – med partners såsom Azure, GCP och AWS.
   

  

**Dina Ansvarsområden**
 Som integrationsspecialist hos oss kommer du jobba med att utveckla, implementera och testa integrations- och plattformslösningar i Azure.
   

  

 Om du redan jobbat en längre tid med integrationer i molnmiljö och gärna tar dig an arkitekturbiten, är du även med och analyserar våra kunders integrationsbehov samt arbetar fram en integrationsstrategi som kan omfatta allt från principer för integrationer och API hantering till organisation, arbetssätt, teknologival, etc. Du är med och stöttar implementeringen av framtagen strategi, samt utformar integrationslösningar och ramverk så att dessa kan utvecklas och köras effektivt och med kvalitet hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Ifall kravställning och projektledning är din “cup of tea” har du möjlighet att jobba i en roll som överbryggar gapet mellan verksamhet och teknik, där du i dialog med kundens verksamhet och andra leverantörer tar fram krav på integrationer, leder integrationsarbetet och tester av integrationer.
   

  

 Vi samspelar ofta i olika typer av konstellationer vilket innebär möjligheter för vidareutbildning och bredare ansvar beroende på projekt och kund.
   

  

**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har**
* Erfarenhet av att bygga lösningar från scratch i Azure med hjälp av ett par av följande komponenter: Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, App Services, API Management, Event Grid, Service Bus;
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att utvecklat och tagit fram integrationslösningar tillsammans med verksamheten;
* Bekantskap med DevOps och CI/CD genom verktyg såsom Azure DevOps och GitHub.


 Din arbetsplats kan vara belägen i Stockholm, Göteborg eller Malmö. Vi erbjuder både möjlighet att arbeta på plats och på distans med flexibla arbetsmodeller – resor till kund kan ibland dock förekomma.
   

  

**Karriärbanor på Solita**
 Jobbet som konsult hos oss innebär ofta en brant utvecklingskurva och variation sett till både arbetsuppgifter och roller. Vi ser karriärbanor inte som en specifik trappa utan mer som ett landskap med flera möjliga individanpassade orienteringar, både i höjd- och sidled, inom ett flertal kompetensområden.
   

  

 Sam jobbar exempelvis idag som People Lead parallellt med sin roll som Service Delivery Manager.
   

  

 Lia har haft chansen att bära många hattar under sin tid hos oss – från developer till lead developer och arkitekt i både lokala och gränsöverskridande integrationsprojekt.
   

  

 Andrei har också utvecklats väldigt brett som scrum master, team/tech lead, SDM, arkitekt, projektledare och kravställare i ett större projekt under de senaste 3 åren.
   

  

**Vem är vi?**
 Vi är ett värderingsstyrt nordiskt IT-konsultbolag med kapacitet inom data, design, moln, integrationer och mjukvaruutveckling. Som ett gediget kompetensföretag kan vi garantera att du lär dig mer när du börjar hos oss – det är vårt löfte till dig. Genom att värna om kontinuerligt lärande ser vi till att vi har intressanta projekt för framtiden, och även möjligheter till projektrotationer.
   

  

**Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;**
* Ett företag som är intresserad av gemenskap, välbefinnande och utveckling. Du kan läsa mer om det här; Solita Culture – Part 1: Come as you are – Solita
* Projekt som skapar avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället;
* Variation; i projekt, i team, i nya teknologier och system, i angreppsätt;
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg;
* Growth Academy – vår kunskapsportal för att stödja din utveckling och dina ambitioner. Vi har en lärande kultur och uppmuntrar våra medarbetare att växa och bredda sina kunskaper genom en rad kompetensnätverk, info sessions, föreläsningar och certifieringar;
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med ett komplett förmånspaket bestående av exempelvis 30 semesterdagar, Friday breakfasts, bike leasing, intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande, och pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet.


*Lyssna inte bara på oss – läs mer på* 
*Glassdoor!*
**Låter det spännande?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Berätta om dina färdigheter och önskemål, så tar vi tillsammans reda på om det kan bli en bra match. Detta är en löpande rekrytering; vi går igenom ansökningar och kontaktar löpande de kandidater som bäst matchar vår kravprofil.
   

  

 Om du har frågor får du gärna nå ut till oss på LinkedIn eller via mail: Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller Talent Acquisition Specialist Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

 Vi rekryterar också till våra kontor i
 **Göteborg** 
 och
 **Malmö** 
 !

title: Senior Data & Analytics Specialists
description:
**Job ID: 24846** 






  
 





 We are looking for a person that is passionate about getting commercial value out of data and enjoys sitting at the intersection of business, data science, data engineering, architecture and management. This is an opportunity for you to work directly with business stakeholders across Nordea while being part of Applied Data Science, Nordea's Centre of Excellence for Marketing Technology, Advance Analytics, ML and AI.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.
 





  

  



**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 You will join Data Foundation team, where we are proud of making analytics happen in the commercial space by delivering solutions that meet the needs and implement the use cases from our business stakeholders, while making our organization a successful and trusted partner.
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Identify and prioritize business use cases that analytics is suited to solve in close collaboration with our stakeholders, and enabling them to do their jobs effectively and reach their targets.
* Drive the creation of data-driven solutions by translating these use cases into requirements for our data scientists, data engineers, and other technology experts, build actionable analytics solutions using data and marketing technologies while always ensuring proper compliance, risk mitigation, scalability, GDPR, data governance and data quality.
* Define and present product roadmaps leveraging data, AI/ML and marketing technologies to our stakeholders with a clear link to the business value of our products, highlighting dependencies and identifying and managing the risks.
* Embed our current products into business operations with high quality, providing training and supporting its lifecycle and issues resolution.
* Support the democratization of data and analytics by providing your expertise to the business areas, presenting existing tools and creating a strong data culture within Nordea.



  
 





 The role is based in Helsinki or Stockholm, however some travel within the Nordic region might occur in the future.
 





  

  



 Welcome to an organization located in the Nordics with a wide range of profiles, from data scientists, engineers and statisticians to economists, researchers, DevOps and IT developers. We aim to attract and retain talented high performers by being frontrunners in our area of expertise.
 





  

  



 We take ownership for our own development and the development of our business, and we expand competencies through learning loops in a creative and appreciative rapid prototyping culture. We believe in high performing teams where everyone plays a role in reaching out for our mission to deliver world class analytics.
 





  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the four key values that guide us in being at our best. We imagine that you enjoy learning and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You’re dependable, willing to speak up – even when it’s difficult – and committed to empowering others.
 





  
 





 You have passion for complex business problems that require analytics and making them happen in the right way – and you are motivated by learning and finding good and new solutions to how we solve business challenges and customer behaviour with creativity and analytical skills.
 





  
 





 You are driven by achieving concrete result and see your work materialising in concrete customer engagement, satisfaction and sales. You always focus on execution and how your work can be transferred into real value for our customers by getting things done in a pragmatic way.
 

  
 





**Your experience and background:** 





* Experience as a data engineer / analyst / scientist with expertise in SQL, ETL processes and data modelling combining data from multiple different sources.
* Excellent communication skills, ability to communicate technical or complex matters with both business stakeholders and engineers in different levels of the organization.
* Experience within requirements analysis, ability to translate stakeholder needs into high level requirements to be implemented in the subsequent development activities.
* Experience working in Agile teams within SAFe framework.



  
 





**Even better if you have:** 





* Experience in big data and cloud computing platforms like Cloudera, AWS.
* Experience within data lake/warehousing architectures.
* Understanding of the data science modelling process.
* Experience in the data governance process and managing data privacy within applications.



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch! 
 





  
 





**Next steps** 






  

  



 Submit your application no later than 05/07/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Rexhep Haliti at rexhep.haliti@nordea.com.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden** 
 - for union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

title: English and Spanish speaking Account Manager to Linköping
description:
The company has developed a groundbreaking cloud service for transportation companies. They have customers all over the world.
  
They are experiencing strong demand of their product and because of that they need to strengthen their sales with a Spanish and English speaking salesperson.
  
We are looking for an outgoing and self-motivated Spanish and English speaking person who wants to work with sales from the company's office in Linköping towards North America.
  
  

About you
  
Qualifications for this job
  
* A couple of years’ experience in B2B sales.
* Excellent customer assistance and problem solving skills.
* Fluent in English and Spanish with no accent.


We see it as a positive if you have previous experience in working with international SaaS sales.
  
  

About this position
  
You will mostly work with assigned qualified leads.
  
A lead is a transportation company who is looking to upgrade their booking system.
  
You will work with the full sales cycle from first demo to a closed deal. After the deal is closed you will continue working with the customers to make sure we keep them happy.
  
The sales will mainly be done via web meetings and phone, so travelling will not be required for this position.
  
It is a very developing job in an international environment where you will interact with a lot of people every day.

title: Product owner - Tietoevry Care (m/f/d)
description:
You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.
Product Owner Lifecare HSL – Tietoevry Care
At Tietoevry Care you’ll get a chance to provide patients and end users with product offerings that help them in their life, reinventing the world for good. If that sounds interesting, please keep on reading.
About us
Tietoevry Care is modernizing the Nordic health and social care sector with modular, open, and interoperable software. We develop and deliver high quality software solutions and services that enable healthcare and welfare professionals to do their work even better and with higher efficiency - have more time to care.
We are a global team of professionals working on providing products and services to different sectors from intensive care to laboratory and social care. In addition to working closely with our customers, we also have our own products that we build and develop for various fields in society. From enabling healthcare professionals to spend more valuable time with their patients to providing data for professional athletes to achieve even better results, we make all that possible. With us you can build technology for the good of society and make your mark on the health and wellbeing of people in need.
About the role
Do you want to work with a modern product portfolio for the next generation of offering to our welfare industry and society? Do you have deep domain knowledge about the municipality’s welfare and social care? Do you have experience of working as a nurse, occupational therapist or physiotherapist in a municipality or have been working in Lifecare or a similar system?
As part of our growth strategy, we are seeking a Product owner that help us to continue to build the best solutions for the Swedish municipal Health & Care market.
Our company is growing, and now we are looking for great people to join us!
 In this role, you will:* Primarily be responsible the portfolio’s solutions for the Swedish municipal Health & Care market (HSL - Hälso- och Sjukvårdslagen)
* Build our product portfolio by developing new ideas and offers based on your insights, customer needs, and market changes
* Meet with customers to understand and analyze their needs
* Interpret legal requirements and ensure our solutions meet these standards
* Maintain relationships with authorities and partners
* Work closely with the product and development teams to define and prioritize with the goal of transforming our customers' needs into the best solutions on the market
* Develop documentation and marketing materials for your area
* Assist with complex domain issues and provide support during public procurements
* Participate in customer meetings, partner dialogues, fairs, and other events
* Work on core aspects of our solutions, including testing and documentation, with the product team


The role includes travel, especially in Sweden. Travel to our office in Poland, Norway or India may occur.
As part of our Nordic product team, we together drive the direction of our future offerings and products.
We expect you to have:* Degree as a Nurse, Occupational therapist, Physiotherapist or equivalent with broad experience of municipal health and social care
* Deep domain knowledge primarily of the Swedish welfare and social care landscape, knowledge about the Nordic and European market is a plus
* Good knowledge of current legislation and the National Board of Health and Welfare's processes
* Experience and good knowledge of how municipal activities are run and organized, preferably also experience of healthcare in the borderland between municipality and region
* Knowledge of Lifecare HSL and preferably experience of system administration in municipal health and social care or similar area
* Fluency in English and Swedish, both spoken and written
* Knowledge of how personal data should be handled, and guidelines linked to GDPR


As a person, you are:* Committed to working collaboratively and driving projects forward with a strong sense of teamwork
* Business-minded, always focusing on delivering high-quality service to customers
* Passionate about continuous learning and enjoy sharing your knowledge with others
* Motivated by achieving goals and thrive under pressure
* Adaptable and able to work effectively both independently and within cross-functional teams
* Welcome to have experience in product management, project management or similar. Working as a product owner means being a leader without being a manager
* Friendly and positive, with a natural inclination towards teamwork
* Driven and can make strategic decisions independently
* You enjoy exploring new ideas and have a genuine interest in the municipal health care field


What’s in it for you?
With us you will be part of the important and meaningful work of developing healthcare for all of us. You have an important mission to make a difference that really matters. In addition, as a company we offer you professional growth, open and friendly culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working.
Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle. We want to encourage you to keep up that curiosity and deepen your knowledge on topics you’re interested in. For example, we host a ‘Keep Learning Week’ twice a year, a week where everyone at Tietoevry has the possibility to join different training courses in a truly global setting.
Could you be our new colleague?
We look forward to hearing from you! We will fill the position as soon as we find the right person, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manage Jahn Sundin, jahn.sundin@tietoevry.com.
We will evaluate candidates continuously. Please apply as soon as possible.
The last date for application is - 11/08/2024
At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equality, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)  

We perform background checks on all final candidates.
Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.
About Tietoevry
Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
#LI-Hybrid

title: SAP SCM consultant to Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP consultant in our Technology practice are a perfect find for you!


Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**About our SAP Nordics Practice**


Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As a leading business partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation, to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business.


We are market leading with SAP in the Nordics with close collaboration and a long-lasting relationship. We drive multiple major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies. Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.


Accenture is not only leading with Technology but also functional expertise. If you are experienced in Finance, Supply Chain, Procurement or HR – you will find peers to develop together with.


And, as we know – Data and Analytics is further key expertise we are looking for.


We have a strong sustainability agenda. As advisors, innovators and solution developers, we help clients define and enable sustainability strategies – reduce carbon footprints, for example, or curb waste – and, at the same time, create new sources of value for the business.


We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at candidates for several positions and seniority levels.


To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at


https://www.accenture.com/se-en/services/sap-index.

**What’s in it for you:**

* Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.
* Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.
* Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.
* Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.
* Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.
* A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.
* Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.
* Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP Supply Chain and other, by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.
* Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.
* Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.
* Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.
* Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Supply Chain team and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

  

**Qualifications**

**About our SAP SCM Practice**


Our SAP Supply Chain Management practice is the largest in the industry, a great community of colleagues, and a key area of focus for our clients. Accenture has an extensive footprint in the Nordics within Retail, Industrial Equipment, Consumer Goods, Automotive, and Chemicals. An optimized Supply Chain is critical in all those segments, in particular under the current dynamic market conditions.


Our team and services cover notably:

* **Supply Chain Planning**, leveraging SAP solutions such as IBP, S/4HANA Advanced Planning, and S/4HANA Advanced ATP
* **Supply Chain Execution**, including Warehousing (EWM), Transportation (TM), Global Trade Services (GTS), and Logistics Business Networks (LBN)
* **Manufacturing**, including S/4HANA Manufacturing, S/4HANA Quality Management, Digital Manufacturing Cloud (DMC) and Product Lifecycle Management solutions (PLM)
* **Digital Asset Management**, including S/4HANA Plant Maintenance and Asset Intelligence Network (AIN)


If you love material flows, shop floor processes, or warehouse optimization, our team is a great home for you!

**Who we are looking for:**

*Required Qualifications*

* Min. 2+ years of hands-on SAP experience in one or more of the above mentioned areas, preferably in the Nordic region
* Hands-on Supply Chain experience from S/4HANA solutions
* Good understanding of Supply Chain process and their business value drivers
* Strong resonance with Accenture core values
* Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies
* Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment
* Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence
* Passionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients
* Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment
* Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player
* Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English
* Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner
* A Bachelor or Master’s degree

*Preferred Qualifications*

* Experience in at least one S/4HANA or Digital Supply Chain Cloud solution implementation
* An SAP certification
* Experience across the full lifecycle, including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-end
* Deep business and industry experience in one or more of the industries
* Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken


#LI-EU
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: SAP S/4 HANA Sales Konsult
description:
Är du redo att ta din kompetens till nästa nivå?


Vi expanderar och letar efter dig som vill vara en del av vårt team.


På Accenture är ingen dag den andra lik och det är precis därför vi trivs här! Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet att bygga en spännande karriär inom Accentures affärsområde för SAP. Med oss får du arbeta i ett avslappnat och drivet team med talangfulla kollegor. Vi samarbetar för att nå våra mål i ett team där alla kan vara sig själva.

**Accentures svenska SAP-affärsområde**


Som marknadsledande affärspartner sedan över 40 år tillbaka arbetar vi med SAP end-to-end, från produktinnovation till utveckling och leverans. Vi driver flera stora SAP-transformationsprojekt med några av de största företagen. Inom vårt nordiska SAP-community arbetar vi med de senaste SAP-lösningarna och tjänsterna såsom SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP och SAP RISE.


Accenture är inte bara ledande inom teknologi utan också inom funktionell expertis. Om du har erfarenhet inom finans, supply chain, inköp eller HR kommer du att hitta andra kollegor att utvecklas tillsammans med. Erfarenhet inom Data and Analytics är ytterligare en nyckelkompetens vi letar efter.


Vi har ett starkt hållbarhetsfokus och hjälper kunder att definiera och möjliggöra hållbarhetsstrategier samtidigt som vi skapar affärsvärden för kunden.


För att läsa mer om vår SAP-verksamhet, besök oss på https://www.accenture.com/se-en/services/sap-index.

**Hos oss får du**

* Arbeta med några av våra största SAP-kunder med stora implementerings- och förändringsprojekt.
* Betydande karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter med en dedikerad mentor som vägleder och coachar dig
* Bli en del av ett samarbetsvilligt team med stor mångfald i en arbetsmiljö som värderar din insats och välmående.
* Få tillgång till omfattande möjligheter för karriärutveckling med utbildning och en tydlig väg för framsteg.
* Tillgång till vår globala organisations omfattande verktyg, såsom databaser, expertnätverk och benchmarking.
* Utveckla och dra nytta av din kompetens inom SAP-lösningar genom att analysera, utforma och implementera affärsprocesser
* Vi har kul på jobbet och har ett starkt fokus på balans mellan arbete och fritid.
* Konkurrenskraftiga lönevillkor, bonusprogram, pension, attraktiv sjukförsäkring, program för köp av aktier och andra förmåner.

**SAP Customer & Channels Nordic Value Tower**


Som en central del av vår technology practice, specialiserar sig gruppen Customer & Channels på att implementera, anpassa och optimera SAP S/4 HANA Sales-lösningar för att hjälpa våra kunder och deras verksamhet med deras förändringsresa.

* Vi söker passionerade och innovativa konsulter.
* Idealkandidater har en stark bakgrund inom SAP S/4 HANA, särskilt inom Sales samt en drivkraft att kontinuerligt lära och anpassa sig i en snabbföränderlig miljö.

  

**Kvalifikationer som krävs**

* Minst 2 års praktisk erfarenhet av SAP.
* Expertis inom S/4 HANA Sales eller Sales & Distribution.
* God förståelse för Quote/Order to cash-processen.
* Erfarenhet av minst ett S/4HANA-projekt från början till slut.
* Erfarenhet av det senaste inom SAP S/4 HANA, t.ex. BRF+, RISE, SAP BTP.
* Vara anpassningsbar och trivas i en teamorienterad miljö.
* Passionerad inom SAP och innovation, och drivas av att leverera de senaste teknologierna till våra kunder.
* Ha starka analytiska kunskaper, vara resultatinriktad och ha en god känsla av ansvar, flexibilitet och struktur.
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och presentationsfärdigheter i både svenska och engelska (i tal och skrift), för att kommunicera med tekniska och icke-tekniska målgrupper på ett lättillgängligt sätt.
* Stark vilja att ta sig an problem och föreslå möjliga lösningar i samarbete med andra teammedlemmar
* Inneha en kandidat- eller masterexamen.

**Meriterande kvalifikationer**

* Erfarenhet av minst en S/4HANA-implementering, antingen SAP Greenfield eller Brownfield.
* SAP-certifiering inom relevant område.
* Erfarenhet av andra SAP-moduler exempelvis MM, CAR, EWM.
* Erfarenhet av att leda ett team.
* Fördjupad kunskap eller erfarenhet inom en eller flera branscher.

Plats: Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö

**Tilltalar detta dig?**


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


Mer information om Accentures rekryteringsprocess hittar du här.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**


We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

  



**Experienced Data Engineer**

  

**Let's create the future together!**


At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. We’re moving towards becoming more of a software developing company and where our products give the driver’s a car-experience that improves every day. Highlights of the areas in focus are Infotainment, Autonomous drive, and a core system optimized for electric cars. We look for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.

  

**What do we offer?**


**“We drive Continuous Integration to accelerate development and increase quality.”**

  

At Software factory we are building a community with highly skilled personnel. We are harmonizing the workflows and developing tools to be used across R&D, with the aim to


accelerate the software development at Volvo Cars. Our main objective is to secure a stable, robust, and secure electrical system for Volvo Cars new SW and Electronics platform. The responsibility area includes:


* Developing continuous integration (CI) architecture & infrastructure.
* Maintaining the complete software build and CI flow.
* Enabling high utilization of infrastructure, test objects and test artefacts.
* Creating automated tools & applications to secure an efficient flow.
* Supporting traceability to fulfill all legal requirements.
* Golden path (aligning the companies tools usage, education)
* SIL (virtualizing HW into SW, test system development, test case creation, education)

We are applying manufacturing principles and techniques to software development to


mimic benefits of traditional manufacturing and creating a software product line.

  

**Now we are looking for an Experienced Data Engineer to join our journey!**

  

**What you’ll do**

  

As a Data Engineer, you'll be at the forefront of designing, constructing, installing, testing, and maintaining highly scalable data management systems and pipelines. Your expertise will be pivotal in optimizing data pipelines for peak performance and efficiency, encompassing every aspect from extraction to loading (ETL / ELT). Collaborating closely with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders, you'll decipher data requirements and deliver innovative solutions. Your commitment to staying abreast of emerging technologies and best practices will drive continuous improvement, while your adeptness at integrating, consolidating, and cleansing data from diverse sources will ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability. As a person we believe that you can take initiatives which will help the organization in their data-driven decisions.


You will be defining and documenting the data standards, policies, and procedures in alignment with Volvo Cars' data strategy and principles.


You will collaborate with data owners, data engineers, data analysts, and data scientists to identify, classify, and catalog the data assets, using appropriate tools and metadata.


You play a key role monitoring and reporting on the data quality and compliance of the software factory and resolving any data issues or gaps in collaboration with the relevant stakeholders.


You shall provide guidance on data management best practices, data literacy, and data ethics.


You are actively promoting a culture of data-driven decision making and innovation within the Software Factory and fostering cross-functional data sharing and collaboration.

  

**Role specifics – Data Engineer / Data Stewart**


As a data engineer and data steward at Volvo Cars, you will be responsible for:


* Designing, building, and maintaining scalable and reliable data pipelines and platforms that enable data-driven decision making and innovation across the organization.


* Developing and implementing data quality standards, policies, and processes to ensure the accuracy, completeness, timeliness, and consistency of the data assets.


* Collaborating with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide them with the best data solutions and services possible.


* Managing the data lifecycle, from acquisition to archiving, and ensuring compliance with data governance and security regulations and best practices.


* Identifying and resolving data issues and anomalies, and proactively improving the data quality and reliability.


* Evaluating and adopting new data technologies and tools to improve the data infrastructure and capabilities.


* Documenting and communicating the data architecture, design, and metadata to facilitate data discovery and reuse.

  

**You and your skills**


* MSc in Computer Science and Software Engineering or similar relevant experience.
* Proficiency in Python programming language.
* Strong understanding of SQL for data manipulation and querying.
* Experience with data orchestrators like Dagster, Airflow etc.
* Familiarity with database management systems like Snowflake, Azure Data Lake etc.
* Expertise in data modelling and transformation using tools like dbt.
* Ability to optimize data pipelines for performance and scalability.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail in data management processes.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders.
* Proactive approach to staying updated with emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering.
* Experience working with cloud platforms such as Azure.
* Experience working in an agile environment with agile methodologies like Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, etc.
* Structured way of working.
* Positive attitude.
* Self-driven, result oriented and flexible.
* Team player with good communication skills.
* Creative mindset.
  

Meritorious


* CI/CD Basic Knowledge and understanding.
  

**How to learn more and apply**


For questions about the position please contact


Raphael Puccinelli at raphael.puccinelli.de.oliveira@volvocars.com.


We are looking forward to your application.

  

  

**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  



  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
  

  

Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more here  

Curious about our story? Read more here
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
Odevo is a group of exciting brands with a shared vision of challenging the status quo in the property management industry. We're committed to revolutionizing the industry with innovative software solutions that make managing properties easier, more efficient, and more effective. Our cloud-based platform is unique, and we have proven ourselves as a leading and innovative player in a brief time. Our global product development department acts as a SaaS supplier to all the companies in the Odevo group and several other players in the industry. Together, we will continue to challenge and change this industry. To continue our ambitious growth journey, we seek more great people to join us to build market-leading property management software products. Are you one of them?  

  



**About the role**  

  



We are looking for a technically skilled DevSecOps Engineer to join an expanding DevSecOps & SRE team working across different markets. As a DevSecOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in our software development process, ensuring that our processes for delivery of software meet the highest standards of automation, speed and suitability. You will work closely with software developers, QA specialists and other stakeholders. The team works in an agile environment and supports development teams to make sure that we deliver high-quality property management software products.


A few of the tools and technologies we use are Microsoft Azure, private cloud, Bitbucket, GitHub, Jenkins, Terraform, Docker, Docker Swarm, Zabbix, Azure Application Insights, Sentry and Grafana.


Your expertise in DevSecOps tools and practices will be critical when Odevo increases its global footprint.


Your key responsibilities will include:


* Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines for applications and services to ensure smooth and efficient software development workflows.
* Create, manage, and version infrastructure, to enable reproducible and scalable deployments across different environments.
* Design, deploy, and manage cloud-based infrastructure on platforms, including virtual machines, containers, serverless architectures, and related services.
* Implement and manage configuration management tools, to automate the provisioning, configuration, and maintenance of servers, networking devices, and other infrastructure components.
* Deploy monitoring and logging solutions to gather and analyze logs, metrics, and events from both system and application levels, and generate actionable insights on system health, performance, and availability.
* Ensure that systems and applications meet security and compliance requirements by implementing security best practices.
* Develop and maintain automation scripts, tools, and utilities, to automate repetitive tasks, streamline workflows, and improve operational efficiency.
* Embracing and promoting DevSecOps practices, such as Scrum, Kanban, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Deployment (CD) to enable fast, iterative, and collaborative software development and delivery.

**Who you are**

You are a curious person who thrives on improving activities and process, working collaboratively as a part of a team. You have excellent technical and analytical skills, with a strong attention to detail. You enjoy taking on new challenges and working with a focus on DevSecOps best practices and meeting targets while being humble and easy to interact with as well as eager to learn. You are fluent in Swedish and English.  

  



**Experience**

  

* You have at least five years of experience as a DevSecOps Engineer, SRE engineer, developer or a similar role.
* Solid understanding of software development methodologies, CI/CD, Linux and Linux shell scripting.
* Experience with at least one programming or scripting language.
* Knowledge of Agile development methodologies.
* Experience working with container technology, cloud solutions and infrastructure as code.
* Hands-on experience with setting up CI/CD pipelines.

**What we offer**


* Remote friendly - you'll be part of a team that values collaboration and communication, regardless of location.
* Professional growth - to work with the most talented developers in the industry.
* Modern technology - we invest in the latest technologies and tools and encourage our team members to share their ideas and take ownership of their work.
* Innovation - to work on exciting projects that push the boundaries of our industry and make a real impact.
Commitment to quality - a dynamic and forward-thinking company that values profitable and long-term product development.  
* 

**Location**


 Our office is on the top floor in the newly built Sthlm 04, which offers stunning views over Stockholm.  

  



**Excited?**

If you are excited about being part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position.  

  



Why we formed Odevo  

About Odevo
  

Our Software

title: Senior AI Engineer, Foundational Team Member at Moondrop
description:
**About:**


Moondrop is a a fully-funded AI startup working to transform the pre-production landscape for creative industries with our real time story platform. By streamlining story development and pre-visualization, we enable studios to move faster, focusing on creativity over technical setup. Moondrop is model agnostic and integrates a range of state-of-the-art models into a specialised UI with huge amounts of prompt engineering built in (co-written with top-tier experts from the creative fields). With significant interest from potential customers based on our early prototype, we’re poised for rapid growth and an exhilarating journey.

**The Role:**


We’re looking for a Senior AI Engineer to join us as our first hire at Moondrop. This is a critical role where you’ll work directly with Adam Chrigström (prev. co-founder/CPO/CEO of Playpilot), to lay the technical foundation for the company. You’ll also collaborate closely with the Dagg AI team (team of senior AI developers building our MVP) and our senior advisors Johan Billgren (co-founder Acast) and Fredrik Limsäter (co-founder ftrack).

**Responsibilities:**

* Implement advanced AI models and algorithms that push the boundaries of what’s possible in creative storytelling.
* Rapidly prototype and iterate on innovative solutions to complex problems.
* Work closely with the founder to shape the technical direction and foundation of the company.
* Collaborate with the Dagg AI team and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and scaling of our solutions.
* Develop high-quality, robust, and scalable AI-driven applications from conception to deployment.

**Technical background:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, AI, machine learning, or a related field. Exceptional candidates with proven track records are also welcome.
* Demonstrable experience in AI, machine learning, deep learning, or related fields.
* Proficiency in multiple programming languages (C/C++, Go, Rust, Ada, assembly varieties, etc.) and familiarity with AI.
* A proven track record of successful, innovative, and impactful software development projects.

**Meritorious:**

* Experience with Dart/flutter.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for AI services and data processing.
* Contributions to open source projects related to AI, machine learning, or innovative software solutions.
* Experience with distributed computing for scaling AI solutions and managing large datasets.
* Preferably located within a similar time zone (CET) for effective remote collaboration.

**Who you are:**

* You have strong communication skills and can clearly articulate complex concepts and ideas.
* You solve difficult challenges independently and get things done.
* You have a curious mindset and embrace new technology to improve your output.
* You prioritise your time effectively and focus on results rather than process.
* You strive to find the simplest solution to get things done.
* You have a hacker’s mindset with the ability to adapt and innovate under rapidly changing conditions.
* You are ego-less when searching for the best idea and can kill your darlings.

**What We Offer:**

* A dynamic, supportive, and fast-paced environment where your work directly shapes the future of AI-powered storytelling.
* Market salary with significant stock options, offering a stake in the company’s success.
* Access to state-of-the-art resources and tools to bring your ideas to life.
* A collaborative team of innovators dedicated to making the impossible possible.
* Flexible remote work, with a preference for alignment with the CET time zone.

**Join Us:**


If you’re ready to dive into the world of AI-driven storytelling and be a foundational member of our team, apply now to become Moondrop’s Senior AI Engineer. Let’s redefine the future of creative production together.


Become a foundational team member at the best company in the world!


Foundational hire at Moondrop! Help us  

  

Join Moondrop as our first Senior AI Engineer and revolutionize AI-driven storytelling with us! Work directly with our founder and top-tier advisors. Apply now!

title: Arkitekt med erfarenhet av systemutveckling
description:
**Arkitekt med erfarenhet av systemutveckling - Inriktning digitala försäljningssystem inom QSR**

  

Vi söker just dig, en passionerad och innovativ arkitekt/utvecklare med erfarenhet redan inom QSR och/eller retail med digitala försäljningslösningar, eller som är sugen på att starta en ny karriär och har rätt teknisk bakgrund.


I den här rollen kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att underhålla, utveckla och förbättra våra digitala försäljningskanaler, inklusive t.ex. appar, online lösningar, självbetjäningskiosker, kassor, delivery och lojalitetslösningar. Vi tror att du har en bred teknisk profil gärna kombinerad med en bakgrund som systemutvecklare med erfarenhet av webbutveckling och API-programmering.

**Ansvarsområden:**

* Underhåll, design och utveckling av nästa generations digitala försäljningsplattformar för Bastard Burgers.
* Underhålla, integrera och optimera digitala kassasystem och försäljningskanaler som t.ex. våra appar, online, självbetjäningskiosker, delivery lösningar och lojalitetsystem.
* Samarbeta med våra tvärfunktionella team för att säkerställa smidig integration av system och teknik.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom digital försäljning.

**Vi tror att du har:**

* Stor passion för att vara med och skapa nästa generations försäljningsplattformar.
* God kommunikationsförmåga och förmåga att arbeta i en dynamisk och snabbväxande miljö.
* Teknisk bakgrund där du har en bred förståelse för teknisk arkitektur och infrastruktur i botten med inriktning mot cloud miljöer.
* Erfarenhet inom webbutveckling och API-programmering, inklusive kända tekniker och ramverk (t.ex. .NET, Java och REST erfarenhet).
* Utmärkta problemlösningsfärdigheter och förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Erfarenhet från QSR och retail och arbete med digitala försäljningssystem och betalningslösningar är meriterande.

**Vi erbjuder dig**

* Möjligheten att vara en del av ett innovativt och framåtblickande företag.
* Arbete och samverkan i ett tight och glatt IT-team.
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö där dina idéer och initiativ värderas högt.


Bastard Burgers värdeord är kvalité, kultur och människor, där dessa ligger till grund för gemensamma mål. En tjänst hos oss innebär en möjlighet att få vara delaktig i ett innovativt och snabbt växande företag, där vi är stolta över vår kultur och familjära känsla!

**Perks**

* Föräldraförmån – vi toppar upp föräldrapenningen! (upp till ett visst belopp).
* Kollektivavtal (tjänstepension, förmåner etc.)
* Veckovis pulsmätning
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Betald startavgift för lopp och tävlingar
* Försäkring via Euro accident

**Ansökan:**


Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och vara med och vara med och forma framtiden för vår digitala försäljning hos oss på Bastard Burgers? Ansök med CV och personligt brev senast 30/7.


Vi värdesätter de kvaliteter som jämn könsfördelning och mångfald tillför verksamheten. Vi ser därför gärna sökande av alla kön och med olika födelsebakgrund, funktionalitet och livserfarenhet.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


IT-teamet på Bastard Burgers

**Om Bastard Burgers**


Bastard Burgers är ett ungt och snabbt växande företag som grundades i Luleå, Sverige, år 2016. Idag finns det fler än 70 Bastard Burgers-restauranger runt om i hela Sverige och ytterligare restauranger i Finland, Norge och New York.


Vi är stora och vi växer snabbt, men vägrar tappa personlighet eller bli basic. Kom hit för att du gillar musik, graffiti, streetwear, riktigt bra streetfood, klistermärken på borden, svengelska – allt det där som gör Bastard Burgers till Bastard Burgers. Kärlek till mat och människor har skapat en stark kultur runt Bastard Burgers, där såväl klimatsmarta initiativ som högljudd hiphop ryms.

title: Head of Service Area Shared & Corporate
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*


Your role


Our IT delivery is divided into Service Areas and your role is responsible for the area Shared & Corporate. Service Area Shared & Corporate provides IT support and development of the IT abilities used within the areas Human Resources, Procurement, Strategy, Finance, Property, Quality and the rest of Saabs Group Functions.


As Head of Service Area, you are accountable for the delivery across Saab. You will lead a team of two Service Owners (your delivery heads) and two Line Manager (your Line organization of about 60 people all in all) working in a matrix setup.


In your role you are expected to lead and develop the IT area at Saab, introducing new abilities, focusing on automation and digitalization and effectively run different Cloud-initiatives the coming years. You are leading and developing your team and your area in conjunction with Saabs IT Strategy, which aims towards digital transformation for the company.

  

Main responsibilities


* Responsible for overall service level fulfilment, project performance and cost adherence for the Service Area
* Make decisions related to governance within the Service Area and sub-services
* Manage and prioritize projects and initiatives within the Service Area and sub-services
* Responsible for IT roadmap within the Service Area
* Manage and make changes within the authorized budget for the Service Area
* Handling Vendors relevant to the area and working with Sourcing


Your profile


We are looking for a candidate with understanding of business and financial management. The person we are seeking for may have a few years of experience in people management, possessing deep knowledge of IT Service Management and/or Project Management. Experience in application management is also merited. This role requires business acumen as well as expertise in strategic, tactical, and operational planning.


For the role of Head of Service Area, we believe that you have some of the following skills or experience:

* You have a Master/ Bachelor of Science degree or have equivalent work experience within relevant area (Computer Science or related field)
* Experience of DevSecOps and Agile working methods
* Knowledge in ITIL, PM3
* Knowledge and/or experience of Security standards (ISO 27 000, NIST, CMMC etc.)
* Speak and write fluent in both Swedish and English


The workplace is located in one of our locations: Järfälla, Göteborg, Linköping, Huskvarna, Malmö/Lund, Karlskoga or Karlskrona.


The position requires approval in accordance with current security regulations. This means that you participate in a security test in accordance with the Security Protection Act, performed by Saab Security Department.


What you will be a part of


Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive trouble-shooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.


Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics , command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. We have major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Customer Engineer, Networking
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
* Experience in cloud computing (e.g., infrastructure, storage, platforms, data), cloud market, and customer buying behavior.
* Experience in networking (e.g., Network Virtualization, Open Protocols, Application Acceleration/Load Balancing, Virtual Private Networks).

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Master's degree in Computer Science, or a related technical field.
* Experience as a Technical Sales Engineer in cloud computing or a customer-facing role in a professional services/systems engineering team.
* Experience in installing, optimizing, and maintaining cross-country networks, leveraging traditional and innovative protocol frameworks.
* Experience managing complex network implementations, with an understanding of the ISO Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) Layer protocols.
* Knowledge of traditional routing protocols, such as TCP/IP, MPLS-VPN, IPSEC, Load Balancing, Network Security, DNS, Encryption, and QoS.
* Ability to learn, understand, and work with new technologies, methodologies, solutions in cloud/IT.

**About the job**
-----------------


The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.



Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Identify business/technical requirements, conduct full technical discovery, and architect client solutions to meet gathered requirements.
* Lead the technical project, including technology advocacy, supporting bid responses, product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and coordinate supporting technical resources.
* Work with Google Cloud Platform products to demonstrate and prototype integrations in customer/partner environments. Travel across EMEA for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities, as needed.
* Prepare and deliver product messaging to highlight Google Cloud Platform value proposition using whiteboard and slide presentations, product demonstrations, white papers, trial management, and Request for Information (RFI) response documents.
* Provide recommendations on integration strategies, enterprise architectures, and platforms/application infrastructure to implement a complete solution. Provide advice to customers to optimize Google Cloud Platform effectiveness.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: VIE Junior Brand Manager Absolut Strategy & Planning
description:
What is a VIE?
It’s an international graduate program for European citizens having graduated from a University School. This is an initiative created, designed, and supported by the French Government primarily to provide professional international work experience for European citizens aged between 18-28 recently graduated from University or Business School.
To apply for this V.I.E assignment you need to fulfil the following criteria:* International Graduates (European citizens) aged between 18 - 28 years old with an average of 12 months of professional experience
* Higher education level (master’s degree)
* Fluent in English
* International profile (work experience or studies abroad)
* Eager to continue your career abroad


This is a V.I.E position based in Stockholm, Sweden and lasts for 12 months with possibility for extension of another 12 months. The position is not open to applicants already based in Stockholm, Sweden. For more information on the V.I.E program’s specificities please visit Mon Volontariat International : site officiel du V.I.E | V.I.A (businessfrance.fr).
ABOUT US
The Absolut Group (TAG) holds global responsibility for the production, packaging development, innovation and strategic marketing of an extensive range of premium spirits brands. They include the iconic Absolut Vodka, Beefeater, the world’s most awarded gin, Malibu, the leading flavoured rum and Kahlua, the number one coffee liqueur, along with a selection of agave spirits, including Altos tequila and craft gins such as Monkey 47. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, The Absolut Group is part of Pernod Ricard, a worldwide leader in the spirits and wine industry.
We strive to redefine the global spirit market and the world we live in by inspiring people of all backgrounds to come together to mix ideas and drinks, respectfully and responsibly. And we have a true long-term commitment to sustainability – doing the right thing for consumers, society, the environment and our people.
We are always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our team and help us shake things up. We believe that work should be more than a paycheck, so whether you are just starting your career or looking to take it to the next level, we offer a dynamic and supportive work environment that will help you grow. Come join us and let’s raise a glass to a fulfilling career and a bright future at The Absolut Group!
ABOUT THE ROLE
Are you passionate about working with an iconic brand, to create impactful, culturally relevant content for our consumers? Do you want to be part of an international, diverse and inclusive team that values collaboration, creativity and fun? Then look no further than The Absolut Group!
Absolut Vodka is an iconic brand that has built tremendous cultural equity along the years, transcending the vodka category by becoming a lifestyle brand. As the world’s leading premium vodka, Absolut Vodka is a living and ever–changing brand with a solid history and traditions. If you want to know more about the brand, please visit our website: https://www.absolut.com/en-gb/
Our Absolut Brand Team is looking for a 1-year VIE as Junior Brand Manager Strategy & Planning based in our Stockholm office and starting the 1st of September ideally. The VIE will lead the Absolut Integrated Business Planning (IBP) publications (x3 a year), working with cross-functional teams and senior leadership to develop a compelling narrative on how to win at the market level with Absolut. This individual will also support in managing the data sources, updating them as and when required and analyzing them monthly for key trends that show up. They will also support in the creation of the next 3-year plan for the brand.
This role will require a curious and structured approach and implies close coordination with other departments and global teams. This role also requires a high level of comfort with studying and analyzing data trends – to derive insights from the same. You will be working with senior experts and be part of a fun team. This is an amazing opportunity to work for one of the most recognized spirit brands in the world as well as fantastic opportunity to learn more about hospitality industry.
Key responsibilities:
Absolut (Masterbrand) Integrated Business Planning (IBP)* Lead creation of the Integrated Business Planning storybook, including cross-functional alignments
* Ensure proper asset management including uploads to My Brands/Brand Cloud.
* Support the overall brand planning process as needed, including analysis, workshops and presentations.
* Lead smaller brand strategy projects for the brand.
* Support the Absolut Strategy & Planning team on other various tasks.


Absolut Data Master Management* Creating a central repository of key data sources for the brand that need to be updated as and when newer versions come in
* Trackers and analysis templates to get a quick read on performance
* Project manage and supervise the filling of these trackers if required from different departments


Absolut 3 Year Plan* Support the creation of the 3-year plan for Brand Absolut
* Co-ordination with different teams to collaborate and deliver on the final plan


ABOUT YOU
You are a creative, organized & strongly driven person with very good written, verbal communications and analytical skills and a teamwork orientation. You are a passionate and goal-oriented person with ownership when driving and delivering projects. You can easily collaborate and effectively interact with stakeholders on different levels within and outside the organization.
Your qualifications:* University Degree/ Business School Master in Marketing/Communication.
* Relevant marketing experience in an international organization.
* Experience in financial management / analytics is a plus [projects that have had work with data]
* Leadership skills and strong project management skills and experience
* Strong interest in communication and data analysis
* Proficient at MS Excel
* Fluent in English (verbal and written), other languages a definite plus.


OUR OFFER*At The Absolut Group, we are the thinking and doing of all our brilliant people. Be audacious and to go after your dreams right from the start – and you will thrive in a passionate and progressive environment where we collaborate across borders. Be committed to a sustainable supply chain, a safe, inclusive workplace, and a responsible consumer culture, and we can achieve real change together.**With our spirit of belonging, we create a culture of what we call convivialité. It’s the magic of human connections that makes things happen. You are welcome to The Absolut Group for who you are. We believe that an inclusive workplace with diversity of experiences and perspectives creates a vibrant work environment and mirrors our global consumers.*  

  

*Read more about us at* Careers | The Absolut Group (theabsolutcompany.com)
APPLICATION  

If this role resonates with you, don’t hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!  

  

For more information about the position, please feel free to contact Eléna Mennrath, Talent Acquisition Specialist (elena.mennrath-ext@pernod-ricard.com). We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your application as soon as possible.
Job Posting End Date:
2024-07-11
Target Hire Date:
2024-08-01
Target End Date:
